loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмон – молодой человек 26 лет, женат и отец 1-го ребенка. У Абдурахмона есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состояшее примерно из 25 овец и 15 козлов. Его жена домохозяйка, она нянчит своего младенца. Абдурахмон каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. У Абдурахмона пока нет крупно-рогатого скота. Но Абдурахмон за этот новый займ купил одного среднего бычка, который вы можете увидеть на фотографии. Откормив 6-8 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Абдурахмон очень рад сотрудничеству с нами, потому, что кредит ему очень помогает.
texts.en:
Abdurahmon H. is 26 years old, and he has one child. Abdurahmon owns livestock, which consists of 25 sheep and 15 goats. His wife is a home-maker, she takes care of the baby. Every morning Abdurahmon takes his livestock to the mountains for grazing, and in the evening he takes the animals back. Abdurahmon does not yet own cattle. With his first loan Abdurahmon is buying a medium-size bull, which you can see in the photo. After rearing the animal for 6-8 months, he can sell it for a good price. Abdurahmon is very happy to work with us, because the credit helps him a lot.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rearing and Sale of Cattle

loans.name: Avlessi

texts.fr:
T. avléssi est une résidente du quartier de hedzranawoé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2005 et s’approvisionne au nord du Togo dans la ville de Niamtougou. Elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé, son stock de charbons de bois est épuisé et elle sollicite de WAGES son second crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de charbons de bois et assurer le transport.
Elle est veuve et a trois enfants qui sont à sa charge.
texts.en:
T. Avléssi is a resident of Hedzranawoé, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. She earns an income from commerce in charcoal. She has been in this business since 2005 and gets her supplies in northern Togo in the city of Niamtougou. She has already had a WAGES loan and has repaid it. Since her stock of charcoal is exhausted, she's requesting her second loan from WAGES to buy 20 sacks of charcoal and to cover the cost of transport. Avléssi is a widow and has three children in her care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 21 años, es soltera sin hijos, y vive en el Barrio Kennedy, cual es situada a 2 kilómetros de la ciudad de Caacupé.  Celia es una joven emprendedora que empezó el negocio hace un año atrás junto con su hermano que es de profesión panadero.

El local de la panadería es alquilada ya que no tienen recursos sufiente para montar un local propio por el alto costo.

Ella se encarga de la administración y también en el empaque de los productos realizados (panificados en general) para su posterior venta que también lo realiza con vehículos pagados con porcentaje según venta, mientras que su hermano se encarga de la producción. Al inicio comenta, que fue muy duro y difícil iniciar este negocio ya que no contaba con capital, y  las primeras inversiones realizadas fueron gracias a sus ahorros y con la ayuda de sus padres quienes les facilitaron el capital.

Celia con el acompañamiento de su hermano, quien esta con ella en todo momento para atender el negocio, hoy día están saliendo adelante. Su meta es la de tener un local propio.  

Ella comenta que esta muy contenta con la ayuda que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya con los créditos que le han otorgado y por la confianza que depositan en ella al concederle los créditos para la compra de materia prima (Harina, Huevo, Anís, Levadura, Manteca Vegetal, etc.)
texts.en:
Celia is 21 and is single without children. She lives in the Kennedy neighborhood, which is located 2 kilometers from the city of Caacupé. Celia is a young businesswoman who started her business one year ago with her brother, who is a professional baker. They rent their location since they don't have enough resources to have their own due to the high costs involved. She manages the business and also packs their finished products for their later sale. They use delivery vehicles to make their sales, which they pay for with a percentage of the sales they make. Her brother makes their products. When they started their business, Celia says it was difficult because they didn't have any capital. Their first investments were made thanks to their savings and help from their parents. Celia, along with her brother, who is always attending to their business, are getting ahead. Their goal is to have their own location. She says she is very happy with the help that Fundación Paraguaya has offered them through their credits and the confidence that they have in her. She uses the credits to purchase supplies (flour, egges, anise, yeast, butter, etc.).

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour and butter

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Cette femme est née dans un village d’atakpamé, elle a quitté tôt son village pour s’installer à Lomé  où elle s’est mariée et a eu 02 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de boissons. Les passants sont très attirés par les pagnes qu’elle expose, elle veut agrandir son stock de pagnes pour attirer plus de clients et mieux vendre, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 30 pièces de pagnes de différents modèles et quelques boissons.
texts.en:
This woman was born in a village of Atakpamé, but she left her village early on settle in Lomé where she married and now has 2 children. She earns her living by selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth), as well as drinks. Passers-by are really attracted by the "pagnes" that she displays, so she wants to expand her stock of "pagnes" so as to attract more customers and make more sales. She is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 30 lengths of "pagne" of different designs and also some drinks.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of pagnes and some drinks

loans.name: Nasreen Akhtar Muhammad Ayub Group

texts.en:
"My name is Nasreen akhtar and I am a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. My husband's name is M. A. and he is involved in animal husbandry. He feeds buffalos and sells them. He has been in this business for over 6 years. I also help him by taking care of his animals. I am applying for a loan to advance his business."


She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Tahmina baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit selling business. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy bicycles for her rented bicycles business. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: “Nasreen baji is standing with her granddaughter in this picture”.

loans.use: To buy buffalo to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. is married and has three children. She has received no formal education. Comfort has a small grocery store where she sells milk, Milo and tinned fish at Amisanu in Elmina, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is a farmer. Comfort uses her income to pay fees and bills. Comfort will use the loan to purchase more provisions for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to invest.

loans.use: Comfort will use the loan to purchase more provisions for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa P. is 49 years old. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. She lives in Barangay Mabini, Valladolid, Negros Occidental.

Mrs. P. is a natural entrepeneur who has improved her family's plight through her knowledge and skills in handling her business. From the time she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002, Luisa has continuously used her loans to improve and expand her "sari-sari" (variety) store, which now earns her about PHP 21,000 per month.

In addition to the sari-sari store, Luisa raises pigs in her backyard and has a 1.2 hectare (~ 3 acre) rice field which is harvested three times a year.

She is now borrowing PHP 14,500 to add to her working capital in the hope that she will generate enough profits to make improvements on her house. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia B. is from the town of Tukuran. She is 56 years old. Lilia is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 11,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Kyelema Eyeta Nambuya Jessica Group

texts.en: N. Jessica is 30 years old, and married with two children. Since 2005 she has been running a grocery shop where she sells groundnuts, beans, maize, etc. Jessica will use her loan to purchase grocery items such as groundnuts, beans, maize, etc. for sale to her customers. She wants to increase her stock of these items so that she can save on transport costs. Jessica is an active businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children and purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items such as groundnuts, beans, maize, etc. to sell

loans.name: Heidi

texts.en:
In 2006, Heidi and her husband decided that they were tired of working for other people and wanted to earn money on their own. Once they found a coffee shop for sale on the internet, they knew buying it was the perfect chance to take. Over the last three years, they have invested significant amounts of time and money into renovating the cafe, even cashing in their 401k. Many of the cafe's customers  had left when the cafe became run-down, before Heidi and her husband bought it. Their hard work has paid off - they have been able to get back many old customers, who remark how positive the new management has been for the business. 

They will use this ACCION USA loan to help remodel their kitchen so that they can add new equipment, like a deep fryer and a basic stove, to add more food items like soups, sandwiches, and french fries to their menu. With these new items, they think they can increase their profit margin.

In the past, Heidi has used credit cards as a cash cushion/emergency fund when unforeseen expenses come up, but she says that interest rates are so high nowadays that the convenience is not worth the price. She is thankful that she was able to receive the ACCION USA loan so that she will not have to pay so much interest. 

In the future, Heidi plans to grow the coffee by opening up in more locations and possibly roasting her own coffee beans. She looks forward to the day when she can hopefully pass the business down to her children!

loans.use: Kitchen remodeling and cooking equipment

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas S., 57, lives in Takeo province with his wife. To earn a living, he works collecting palm juice to refine into palm sugar. With this business, he is able to make US$1.80 per day. His wife, Kim Net, 49, raises animals and makes US$1 every day. This couple have four children, two are in school and two are garment factories workers. Meas S. would like to take out a loan of US$700 to purchase a motorbike for one of her children to operate a moto-taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase and operate a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela M. is from the village of Calacaan. She is 54 years old. Marcela is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Marcela owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling products to local businesses and community members. Marcela has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Marcela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Marcela is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Marcela from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 30 years old and a food vendor.  She sells different kinds of street foods and barbecue in their village located in front of their house.  Her daily net income is PHP300.  With her desire to improve her business, she is now asking to borrow a loan of PHP5,000 that she can use as additional capital for her business. With this amount, she can purchase different merchandise and strengthen her food vending business in order to sustain their daily needs.

She is married and blessed with three children who are all in the elementary level.  She is working hard in order to increase her income and for her business to grow.

loans.use: Additional capital for the improvement of her food vending business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 23-year-old engaged man. He has owned a motorcycle repair shop since 2008 and has 7 years of experience in this field. Today, Ahmad is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy additional tools to satisfy the great demand for his shop and make a good income.

loans.use: buy additional tools

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio GUILLERMO tiene 52 años, es conviviente, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” de la Asociación Arariwa. El es el fiscal del banco y tiene tres hijos.
 
El socio hace servicio de transportes en la ciudad del Cusco. El socio apoya en el negocio de su esposa donde ella vende pollos y gallinas. Ya son 25 años con el servicio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su labor. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento al carro.    
  
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Guillermo is 52 years old, lives with his partner, and is a native of the city of Cusco. He belongs to the community bank "NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA" (New Light of Tomorrow) of the Arariwa Association. He is the treasurer of the bank, and has 3 children.

Guillermo works in transportation services (taxi) in the city of Cusco. He supports the business of his wife where she sells chickens and hens. He has been in this business for 25 years, and it has gone very well thanks to all of the effort that he puts into his work. Our member is a working and enterprising father that gets his family ahead. He requires the loan in order to do maintenance on his car.

He is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means, and therefore he commits to complete the payment according to the time line.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member requires the loan to do maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Teresita's Group

texts.en: Teresita D. is from the village of Calao East Rizal. She is 49 years old. Teresita is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Teresita's Group. Teresita is married and has 3 adult children. Teresita owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from being a tricycle operator. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 28 years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce D., 22, would do anything to improve the lives of her family. Married to Bribon D., a factory worker, they are blessed with one child. Even though she had a family at a young age, she makes sure that she helps her husband earn income so that they can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for five months.

Dulce has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow four times from CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy grocery items for her variety store. Her three businesses let her earn a combined net profit of PHP 5,500 per month.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 10,000. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her to expand her business by buying mobile phone credits, added stock for her store, and assorted meat products.

She prays that her business will continue to grow so that one day she and her husband can have resources to buy their own house and lot and for their child to finish his studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone credits, added stock for her store, and assorted meat products.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 31-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil in southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Ibrahim has been working in construction, tiling floors since 2000. He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Said has requested a loan. When he first started his business, he had to face competition and he had some financial issues. He is well-known for his good work. His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans to keep improving his business and to purchase more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes es socia del Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco” desde hace 2 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa americana.

Lourdes nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  un fardo de ropa de segunda mano.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener un negocio fijo y tener su capital propio. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los incentivos y las utilidades del ahorro
texts.en:
Sra. Lourdes has been a member of the Cristo Blanco community bank for 2 years. She lives in the Juliaca district of the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno. She is 37 years old and the single mother of 1 child. She left high school in her fifth year and now works buying and selling American clothing. Lourdes tells us that she used her first Movimiento Manuela Ramos loan for S/.300 new soles to increase her working capital. She is applying for a S/.500 new soles loan that she will use to buy a bundle of second-hand clothing for resale. Her dream for the future is to have a store of her own with enough money to operate it. What she most likes about her community bank is the incentives it provides to save.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Martínez P. tiene 4 años de trabajar con esta institución financiera, actualmente habita en la comarca Ocotal, caserío Las Minitas, El Sauce, se dedica a la actividad agropecuaria contando con su propia finca, asimismo su ganado y tierras dedicadas a  la agricultura específicamente la cosecha de café orgánico. Es necesario mencionar que tiene 20 años de experiencia de trabajar en las actividades agropecuarias con la intensión de generar ingresos para la familia y por ende para su sobrevivencia.
texts.en:
Martínez P. has been with the CEPRODEL loan financing partner for four years. He lives in the Ocotal region, in the hamlet of Las Minitas of El Sauce, Nicaragua. He runs his own farm, raising both livestock and organic coffee. He has been working for 20 years in agriculture to generate income for his family's survival.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of one male calf, one female calf, and a cow.

loans.name: Danusha

texts.en:
Danusha is a 28-year-old married woman with one daughter living in Kamburugamuwa, Sri Lanka. She and her husband work together in a tailoring business that they have been running for two years now. They are both very hardworking and have seen success because there is a strong market for their tailoring services.

Danusha is seeking a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to develop her business further. With the loan, she plans to buy cloth and other materials necessary for tailoring.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy cloth and other materials

loans.name: Nalani

texts.en:
Nalani is a 23-year-old married woman living in Kekanadura, Matara. Her husband drives a three-wheeler taxi to earn income and help support the family.

Nalani operates a grocery store as her business. She is hardworking and receives help from her husband when he is not driving his taxi.

Nalani has requested a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka for the improvement of her grocery store.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan.

loans.use: To buy goods for her grocery shop

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó con tres integrantes quienes estuvieron en otro grupo, las mismas decidieron formar un nuevo grupo a causa de que ellas vivían muy lejos del lugar de reunión del comité al cual pertenecían, de esa forma se inicio el comité María Auxiliadora del María Auxiliadora - Isla Valle de la ciudad de Luque.
 Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y esta conformado por 22 integrantes las cuales invierten en distintas actividades.

La señora Higinia Céspedes es costurera, se dedica desde muy joven a esta actividad, ella confecciona ropas de todo tipo como trajes para damas, pantalones, uniformes, vestidos para novias y otros.
Ella solicita el préstamos para invertir en la compra de insumos tales como telas e hilos para la elaboración de sus prendas.
texts.en:
This group was formed by three members who were in another group but decided to form a new one because they lived far away from the other group's meeting place. Thus began the María Auxiliadora group of María Auxiliadora - Isla Valle in the city of Luque.

Now the group is in the third cycle of the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya's program. It is made up of 22 members who all invest in different activities.

Higinia Céspedes is a seamstress. She has been a seamstress since she was very young. She makes clothes of all types, for example suits for women, pants, uniforms, wedding gowns, etc.

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying materials like fabrics and thread to use in making clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of many types of fabrics, buttons, linings, and clasps

loans.name: Joseph Maina

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old. He is married to Nancy, and they are blessed with one son.

Joseph has been running a transport business for the past two years. He also does mixed farming as his other source of income.

Joseph was introduced to KADET through an existing KADET client. He plans to expand both his transportation and farming businesses with the loan he has applied for.

Joseph would like to start rearing rabbits with the extra profit expected from his businesses. He describes himself as a hardworking business man.

loans.use: To expand his transportation and farming businesses

loans.name: Sarwar Halam Group

texts.en:
Freba is a member of 'Sarwar Halam' group. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan in district 15. She is married with four children. She is a tailor and sews different kinds of clothes.

Most of her clients are from her neighborhood. She needs the loan to purchase more sewing materials such as a new sewing machine, different kinds of thread, needles, and so on. 

She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to grow her business in the future and attract more new clients. She is glad that she has this opportunity to work.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles etc. for her business

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Né le 25 Juin 1963 à Sikasso ville, Monsieur Ousmane B. est un est polygame avec deux épouses et père de 8 enfants résidant chez lui-même à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Maître coranique de profession, Monsieur B. après plusieurs années dans l’enseignement, l’abandonna au profit de la photographie et le cameraman qu’il menait en parallèle  à l’enseignement. Avec une expérience de plus de vingt  années dans le domaine, il est très sollicité et jouit d’une notoriété exemplaire pour la qualités de ses images surtout lors des cérémonies de mariages, baptêmes, anniversaires, etc. Il dispose  de son propre studio au quartier Hamdallaye près de camp militaire “TIEBA”. 
Dans le souci de faire prospérer ses affaires afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de ses clients, il décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux ans. Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel,  le prêt précédent  ayant été correctement remboursé.
 Ce deuxième lui permettra d’acheter un nouvel appareil, des pellicules photo, des cassettes vidéo vierges, des piles, etc. 
Il ambitionne réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born on June 25, 1963 in Sikasso, Mr. Ousmane B. lives in a polygamous family; he has two wives and is the father of eight children, all of whom live with him in Hamdallaye, one of the modest districts of the Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). His original profession is teaching the Koran. After some years of being a teacher, Mr. B. has decided to switch to photography and video recording, something he had been doing as a side activity before. With over 20 years of experience, he is very much in demand and enjoys a good reputation thanks to the high quality of his recordings, mostly taken during weddings, christenings, birthday parties and so on. He has his own studio in Hamdallaye near the Tieba military base. In order to keep his business going and to better meet the customer demand, about two years ago he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is now on his second individual loan, having duly repaid his earlier loan. The second loan will allow him to purchase a new camera, photo film, blank video tapes, batteries etc. His goal is to reach an average monthly income of 95,000 West African Francs, which will be used essentially to increase his business capital, contribute to the family budget and pay off the interest on his loan.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a photo camera and accessories (film, blank tapes, batteries etc)

loans.name: Ruby Elizabeth

texts.es: Ruby tiene 23 años  de edad es soltera vive  con sus padres ella tiene un pequeño negocio del servcio de fotocopias, se inicio con el apoyo de sus padres. Ella tambien trabaja por las mañanas prestando servcio domesticos  como ama de casa. Clienta joven con muchos deseos de superacion metas y objetivos uno de ellos es poder crecer en su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ruby, 23 years old, is single and lives with her parents. She has a small photocopy service business which she started with the help of her parents. She also works mornings providing domestic house keeper service. This young client has a great desire to meet her goals and objectives, one of which is to be able to expand her business. With the loan she is requesting she will invest in working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Jose Eriberto

texts.es:
José Eriberto tiene 58 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Corinto, departamento de Morazán, tiene una relación de unión libre con Doña María Elena,  con 6 hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura y ganaderia, otro rubro que se dedica es a la venta de ropa.
Don Eriberto aprendió la actividad agricola de siembra de Maíz y frijoles  por herencia de los padres, que realizaban esta actividad, por la necesidad de generar mejores condiciones se dedica tambin a la venta de  ropa de forma ambulante, El sale muy temprano de la casa y realiza un largos recorridos para vender ropa, hasta llegar a La  Estancia un lugar que pertenece a Honduras y ahí el comercializa sus productos, es una persona trabajadora, responsable.
Esta solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de abono y fertilizante para la siembra de maíz y frijoles, y otra parte para concentrado para ganado. Esto contribuirá a obtener una buena cosecha para que puedan venderla y generar ingresos para solventar las necesidades, mejora la calidad de vida de esta familia.
Las metas son a futuro comprar más ganado, mejor el cultivo, apoyar a los hijos y la esposa económicamente.
texts.en:
José Eriberto is 58 years old and he lives with his live-in partner, María Elena, and their 6 children in the Corinto municipality in the Morazán department. He engages in agriculture and stockbreeding; on top of that he also sells clothes. Eriberto was taught how to plant maize and beans from his parents, who engaged in this activity, and in order to gain better life conditions he also works as a street vendor selling clothes. He leaves his house very early and makes many long journeys in order to sell clothes, until he reaches La Estancia, a place located in Honduras where he sells his products. He is a very hardworking and responsible person. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy manure and fertilizers to plant maize and beans, as well as concentrated cattle feed. This will help him obtaining a good harvest that he can sell and earn money to provide for the necessities of his family and to improve their quality of life. His future goals are to buy more cattle, to improve the crops and to economically help his children and his partner.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers to plant maize and beans.

loans.name: Mwatatu

texts.en: Mwatatu M. S. is a married lady. Her husband is a driver and they have two children aged twelve and nine years old. Her business is located at Mishomoroni estate in Mombasa, a competitive residential area with a ready market. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many, many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean white beaches. She has been operating a restaurant well known as Usicheze Mbali Cafe for the last nine years. Although it is called a cafe, it is actually a restaurant. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is insufficient funds to run the business. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more general items to expand her business. She hopes to expand her business and in the future open a hotel with guest rooms. She describes herself as respectful, honest, and a patient mother.

loans.use: To buy items to expand her business.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza J. is from the village of Binaliwan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 26 years old. Analiza is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Analiza owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Analiza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. N. is a single mother of three ages 27, 26 and six. She is a farmer who raises both dairy cattle and poultry for milk and eggs. She sells her products to retail shops and individuals. It is now four years since she started her business, and she hopes to become a supplier of eggs to supermarkets and milk to milk-processing plants.

Since Joyce joined Faulu Kenya, she has developed an open mind to business and has thus attracted more customers. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy animal feed and vaccines. She dreams of buying more cows and chickens in the future.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and vaccines

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.ar: محمد شاب أعزب من منطقة بنت جبيل، يبلغ من العمر 33 عاماً. يملك محمد مكتبة لبيع الكتب المدرسية، القرطاسية، الحقائب المدرسية والتصوير، منذ العام 2005. سبق لمحمد وتعامل مع المجموعة وهو مقترض حسن السمعة والسلوك. يتقدم محمد الآن بطلب قرض من المجموعة بهدف تقوية المصلحة للعام الدراسي الحالي. في البدء كان رأس المال لديه ضعيف تمت تقويته من خلال القرض السابق الذي إستحصل عليه من المجموعة. أما الآن فالعمل يتطور تدريحياً. معاملته الجيدة للزبائن وأسعاره المجدروسة في ظل الاوضاع الإقتصادية الصعبة، هي التي تمييزه وتمييز عمله عن سائر المكنبات الأخرى في الجوار. يأمل محمد إفتتاح فرع آخر لمكتبته في منطقة أخرى، على أن يستمر هذا التطور والإمتداد ليشمل مناطق مختلفة.
texts.en:
Mohamad is a 33-year-old, single man from Bint Jbeil. Since 2005 he has owned a bookstore, in which he sells school books, stationery, school bags and photography. Mohamad previously dealt with A.-Majmoua and enjoys a good reputation. He is now asking for a loan to boost his business as the new academic year approaches. In the beginning he lacked capitA. and he improved it with the previous loan he obtained from the group. The business is now developing gradually. His good manner with customers and his reasonable prices at a time of economic difficulties distinguish him and his business from other bookshops in the neighborhood. Mohamad hopes to one day open another branch in another area and to keep developing his business to include different areas.

Translated from Arabic by Rebecca Saab Saade, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the necessary products for the coming school year

loans.name: Bicentenario Dos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Bicentenario 2, por las festividades de este año y porque sus integrantes son muy patriotas. Está ubicado en Lázaro Cárdenas en el Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes.

Magdalena F. García es integrante del grupo, tiene 64 años, no cuenta con estudios, es comerciante de artesanías de madera  y tiene  un hijo varón.  Ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías de madera que inició hace 3 años. Solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en más mercancía ya que las artesanías que venden son muy solicitadas por su comunidad. Sus clientes son vecinas y recomendadas de sus clientas.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta e ilusionada. Quiere este crédito para hacer crecer su negocio y sus ventas.   También espera que estas ganancias le permitan seguir solventándose y apoyar a su familia, ya que es una persona mayor y solo cuenta con su negocio para salir adelante y cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
The loan group is called Bicentennial 2, named because of this year's festivities (200th anniversary of Mexican independence) and because its members are very patriotic. It is located in Lazaro Cardenas in the State of Mexico. The group has 11 members.

Magdalena F. G. is a member of the group. She is 64 years old and didn't go to school. She has been selling wooden handicrafts for 3 years and has a son. She requests a loan to invest in more merchandise, because the handicrafts she sells are very sought after in her community. Her clients are her neighbours and the people her clients recommend her to. She is happy and excited about the loan, which she wants to develop her business and her sales. She also hopes that the profits will allow her to stay solvent and support her family, since she is quite old and only has her business to support herself and meet their needs.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.en:
Anatolia V. is from the village of Nailon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 67 years old. Anatolia is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Anatolia owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Anatolia has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Anatolia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anatolia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Anatolia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Anatolia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Nury Charito

texts.es:
Nury de 30 años, es vendedora informal de ropa, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Empezó su negocio hace unos dos años aproximadamente, inicio la venta de la ropa a sus amigas y a las personas que trabajaban en la escuela de sus hijos. Poco a poco a incrementado su mercadería recorriendo las calles de Paraíso, vendiéndola los fines de semana y haciendo las cobranzas a sus clientes de lunes a viernes. Vende ropa para niños, sabanas, pantalones etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa, sabanas, toallas para tener mas variedad al vender la ropa. En el futuro quiere incrementar su mercadería y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Nury, who is 30 years old, is an informal vendor of clothing.  She lives in the Paraiso neighborhood of Guayaquil (an area in the outskirts of the city that has dirt roads and homes built on the hillsides.)

She started her business about 2 years ago, selling clothing to her friends and to people who worked in her children's school.  Gradually, she increased her merchandise.  She goes around the streets of Paraiso selling her clothing on the weekends, and collecting payments from her customers during the week.  She sells children's clothing, bed sheets, pants, etc.

With the loan she wants to buy clothing, bed sheets, and towels to have more variety in the items she sells.  In the future, she wants to increase her merchandise and make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy clothing and bed sheets

loans.name: Henry Fabian

texts.es:
El Señor Henry M. es socio del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza natural, sus cuatro ríos que la bañan, su centro histórico que por su belleza fue nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es amable y hospitalaria.

Nuestro socio hace un mes está trabajando en unas minas de donde extraen oro, pero como es un trabajo muy peligroso va a continuar con su negocio. El es comerciante, vende ropa de todo tipo, ropa interior y colchas.  Esta actividad la realiza hace 3 años. Su mercadería la vende recorriendo en especial en la costa ecuatoriana.

Don Henry tiene 36 años, es soltero y tiene 3 hijos  de 15, 14 y 10 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos viven fuera del país, solo le pasa la pensión alimenticia a su hijo que se encuentra en el país y está estudiando en la escuela. No tiene una casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo que realiza los créditos en el banco comunal y esta muy contento de formar parte de este grupo de gente luchadora.  El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en un nuevo negocio que es en la venta de chuzos (carne en palitos). Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mr. Henry Macías is a member of the Loma de la Cruz (Hill of the Cross) communal bank.  He lives around the Feria Libre sector of Cuenca.  This city is known for its natural beauty, the four rivers that bathe it, its historic city center that was named Cultural Patrimony of Humanity and its kind and hospitable residents.

He has been working in a gold mine for a month but, because this is very dangerous work, he is going to continue with his business.  He is a merchant.  He sells all kinds of clothes, underwear and bedspreads.  He has been in this line of work for three years.  He sells the merchandise especially traveling along the Ecuadorean coast.

Henry is 36 years old, single and has three children who are 15, 14 and 10 years of age.  His two oldest children live abroad.  He sends a food stipend just to his son who is in the country and going to school.  He does not have a house of his own; he rents.

He is in his fourth cycle with the communal bank and is very happy to be part of this group of hard working people.  He will use the money from the loan to invest in a new business.  He will sell chuzos (grilled meat on skewers).  His dream is to own a house.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, potatoes, wooden meat skewers, etc.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Mrs. Neang H. and her husband, Mr. Soeun Kong, live on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one daughter. Neang and her husband run a store at home. She previously asked for a Kiva loan. She is applying for another loan of $1,000 to continue expanding her business by purchasing weaving materials (cotton thread) for resale.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials (cotton thread) for resale

loans.name: Hibat

texts.en:
Hibat D. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in their own house and property. His oldest daughter attends a local primary school while his youngest daughter is in kindergarten. Hibat owns a transportation service where he transports people using his own car between local sub provinces. He transports 8 people at one trip and charges 15,000 MNT per passenger. He makes 2-3 trips in one day. He started his transportation business in 2004 and has gained a lot of experience in his business. He has build a successful and stable operation over the years and his earnings have enabled him to buy a new car for himself. After years of operation, he was able to build a house for his family. His monthly average income has reached  a level of between 900,000 and 1,200,000 MNT with 20-30 % of net profit. 

Hibat is a very honest and hardworking man and says, " I want to start saving my business profits in order to invest money for my children's future. " He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to buy and resell grocery products from the towns he where he travels.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products for his new business

loans.name: Melvi

texts.es: La señora Melvi se dedica al comercio de productos de plástico ( vasos, bañadores, papeleros, tachos y otros ) productos que los adquiere al por mayor y la señora lo vende al por menor, no cuenta con una caseta,  su venta esta ubicada en una de las calles mas céntricas de  la ciudad de Cochabamba. Su familia esta compuesta por su hija de un año y su esposo, son una pareja muy trabajadora, ella compra sus productos por cantidad y solicito su crédito para proveerse de mercadería ya que estas fechas tienen mucha venta ya que algunas instituciones compran tachos, baldes. Bañeras para los canastos que realizan en fin de año, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Melvi's business is selling plastic products (cups, tubs, wastepaper baskets, garbage cans, etc.)  She acquires her products wholesale and then sells them retail.  She does not have a stall.  She makes her sales on one of the most central streets in the city of Cochabamba.

Melvi's family consists of her one year-old daughter and her husband.  They are a very hard-working couple.  Melvi buys her products in bulk and she is requesting this loan so that she can stock up with merchandise since she sells a lot at this time of year as some institutions are buying garbage cans and buckets.  They also buy tubs for the hampers that they create during this end-of-year period.  She is very grateful to our institution for the support she is receiving.

loans.use: To buy plastic products

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mercedes; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de librería, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia también quiere seguir estudiando para mejorar cada dia mas. La socia solicita el préstamo para la mantención de su casa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the communal bank “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; the bank is located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco. 

Mercedes is 40-years-old. She lives with her partner and has 2 children. She alternates between her daily activities and work in a bookstore. She works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. 

She also wants to continue studying in order to improve more and more each day. She's requesting the loan for home maintenance. She's happy about the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: Home maintenance

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe P. lives in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is 48 years old and married. She is a farmer who plants and harvests rice and corn crops. Ma. Fe's harvest is for her family's consumption as well as for sale. For additional income, Ma. Fe also raises pigs.  She fattens them and sells them at the market. 

She would like the loan to buy farm inputs and pig feeds. Ma. Fe hopes to be of better service to people in her community, by serving quality crops and pigs.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pig feeds

loans.name: Sayak's Group

texts.en:
Sayak S., 62, is a member of this group. Ten years ago he sold all his cattle in order to purchase a small grocery store in his neighborhood. He was willing to do that because of his age and his desire for a change of lifestyle. He is a retiree and wanted to live a decent, quiet life in his later years. His children are already grown and live independently. Sayak and his wife say it’s a perfect occupation for them, because it’s close to their house and doesn’t require much physical strength. Nowadays he brings wholesale groceries and consumer goods from the nearest market into his store. He tries to update his selection pretty often in order to satisfy customer needs. 

Sayak also breeds livestock animals for additional income. With the money received from this loan he wants to purchase more  livestock for breeding. 

        --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (remaining environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for breeding

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick K. M. is thirty-four years old, married to a businesswoman, and they have two children, ages seven and three, for whom they hope to provide a good education to the university level. 

His business is located at Kitengela and it is known by the name Lucky Fashion. He sells trouser suits, school uniforms, skirt suits and other clothing to the local people. He has been operating this business for nine years now and has two employees. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of 80,000 KES to buy more clothes to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He also plans to buy a motorcycle to facilitate his movements while doing business. He hopes to expand his business, buy land and build. He describes himself as honest, punctual and visionary.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell and a motorcycle

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is 36 years old and married to H.. She has 4 children, all of whom are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Naseem knows the importance of education and wants her children to become successful in their lives by completing their education. Naseem belongs to a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan called Khanewal. Her house consists of 2 rooms and is located in the area of Shanti nagar. Naseem operates an animal-sales business at her home. She buys young animals, raises them and then sells them to butchers on profit.

Her husband belongs to an agriculture profession and works in the fields. He grows different seasonal crops in them. He is a very hard worker and works almost 9-10 hours per day. Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in improving his business. With the loan, he will buy fertilizer and seeds to get better results from his fields. She hopes that her husband’s business will grow further and he will be able to increase his household income. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her.

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem”.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for agriculture business

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.en: Evelyn Yaneth is 37 years old and married. She has four children and three are currently in school. She works in a general store and has five years experience running the business. She started out selling small goods in the schools in her area and is now happy to have her own location. Her husband works as a merchant and helps support the family. Evelyn is requesting a loan as part of the ¨Sagrado Corazon D. Jesus¨ Group in order to stock her store with goods so that she may increase her income. Her goal is to one day own a large store with solid and consistent income. Other members of the group are involved in the following business activities: breadmaking, food service, pharmacy, and jewlery sales.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her general store.

loans.name: Donna Summer

texts.es:
La señora Donna es socia del banco comunal Las Rosas del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene 1 hijo menor.
Lleva 3 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, Donna se dedica a la venta de comida los fines de semana, esta actividad la realiza en la puerta de su casa.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 fuente cevichera, 1 ciento de platos descartables, 1 ciento de tenedores descartables, 1 balde para colocar la chicha.
Con las ventas de los fines de semana puede pagar las cuotas que tiene con Manuela Ramos y también le queda para comprar más insumos e ingredientes.
Gracias a su negocio puede apoyar así a su esposo, quien se desempeña como chofer de motocar, sus ingresos son diarios y le permite solventar los gastos de casa.
texts.en:
Donna is a member of the Las Rosas communal bank in the Yarinacocha district of Ucayali.  She is 31 years old, married, and has one young son.

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos (organization) loans for three years.  Donna sells food out of her home on the weekends.

With this loan of 1,000 PEN she will buy a ceviche fountain, 100 disposable plates, 100 disposable forks, and one pail to use for chicha.

She will repay the loan with the money she earns on her weekend sales, and will also have some left over to buy more supplies and ingredients.  Thanks to her business she is able to support her husband who works as a motorcar driver.  His daily income allows them to pay the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food stall

loans.name: Boldbayar

texts.en:
Boldbayar, 47, is married and lives with his wife and two sons in their own house in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Boldbayar's wife is an ironer at hospital No 2. His older son, age 24, graduated from college and helps with his father's business. His younger son, age 22, is a circus actor who has gone to Africa to work for a while.

Boldbayar manages a taxi service business with his older son. He started his business in 1995 and it was not as easy as it may seem. It requires great patience and hard work in order to succeed. Boldbayar is one of the lucky men who was able to stabilize his business by providing safe and comfortable rides for his customers. At first, he drove a Sonata and, a few years ago, he managed to replace it with a more advanced vehicle, a Mazda Familia. Boldbayar is planning to continue his business in the future. He is a diligent and open-minded person who says, "I would like to repair my house in order to make it as comfortable as it can be." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase new roofing material and some iron boards to repair his house.

loans.use: to purchase new roofing material and iron boards to repair his house.

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarun C. (pictured here) is 28 years old and her husband, Mr. Noeuk Nim is 34 years old.  They live along National Road 2, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two daughters. Both are in school. 

Mrs. Sarun Chhun is a tailor, while her husband has full-time employment. She hopes to start a new business raising pigs, so she is asking for her first loan of $300 to purchase piglets and feed for pigs.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, age 38, is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya, where she has been farming for 15 years. Her main products are milk, maize, beans, vegetables, and tomatoes, which are all sold locally. She is also a fish vendor. She and her husband have six children between the ages of 6 and 22, four of whom are currently attending school.
 
Joyce has applied for this loan of 31,200 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve her family's standard of living. She faces the challenge of animal diseases and the high cost of animal feed. In the next five years, she hopes to have increased her milk productivity to at least 50 litres daily. She also hopes to continue to have access to loans through Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Blandino

texts.en:
Blandino is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is widowed with three children. Blandino has a shop that sells copra (dried meat) from coconuts. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional coconuts for copra.

Blandino is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Blandino hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional coconuts for copra

loans.name: Erdenee

texts.en: Erdenee is 42 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His two children go to a local secondary school and his wife is a salesperson at a small, private store. He manages a woodworking business in his town. He started his business in 2003 and has gained much experience. He makes all kinds of household goods such as tables, chairs and kitchen furniture. He is a polite and hardworking man who says, "I will build many gers, Mongolian yurts, this coming summer so I want to buy large amount of wood with the loan." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.en: Sandra Del Carmen, a 36-year old single mother of two children, ages 8 and 14, has operated a small convenience store selling basic foods, cosmetics, toiletries, etc. for the last six years. She started the business with money she saved while working abroad. Sandra Del Carmen intends to use the loan to buy more merchandise including sodas, crackers, grains, canned soups, and detergents for her store.  She would like to construct a house for her children and herself.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, crackers, grains, canned soups, and detergents for her store.

loans.name: Sop Modou Awa Balla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité  Sop Modou Awa Balla du banc villageois de Sokhna Momy existe le 08 décembre 2010.Le groupe est composé de 06 personnes. Elles sont du même quartier et font du petit commerce.

La présidente du groupe, Khady est âgée de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Sur la photo elle est habillée en boubou elle est à l'extrême droite de la photo.

Elle est commerçante.Elle vend des fruits de saison qu'elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaire et revend au marché central de Darou.

Avec son prêt, elle veut acheter des marchandises.

Elle augmente son épargne avec ses bénéfices car la charge de la maison est assurée par son mari.
texts.en: The solidarity group Sop Modou Awa Balla of the Banc Villageois of Sokhna Momy has been in existence since December 8, 2010. The group is composed of six persons. They are from the same district and have small businesses. The group's president, Khady, is 44 years old, married, and the mother of four children. In the photo, she is the one dressed in a boubou at the far right. She is a merchant and sells seasonal fruit that she purchases from the weekly markets and resells at the central market of Darou. With her loan, Khady wants to buy some merchandise. She is increasing her savings with her profits, since household expenses are covered by her husband.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 28 years old and married with three children between one and three years old.  In addition, he takes care of five relatives. He has owned a small boutique selling goods such as sugar, soap, rice, and cooking oil. His business is well organized and he works daily from 7 am until 8 pm. 

Theogene has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more goods such as sugar, soap, rice, cooking oil and local drinks. With the profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his children.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like sugar, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 52 years old and lives in the town of Bungohko in the Mbale region of Uganda.  She is married and has four children.  Three of her children are currently in school.  Christine has a tailoring business, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase materials for making clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Christine hopes to expand her business. Christine is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 42 years old and lives in Tubod Aloran, Misamis Occdental. She is married with four children. 

Fe raises pigs for a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to purchase pigs for her pig raising business. 

Fe has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Fe hopes to have big sales from her hog fattening to help her family .

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Lua

texts.en: Lua was born in 1985. She lives in Xom Trong village with her husband and two children. Her husband is a carpenter. He has an income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND) per month. Mrs Lua has a clothing store in the To market. She has been in this business for five years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. In 2006, Lua joined Kiva partner, SEDA. Her last loan was for 8,502,000 VND. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to expand her clothing store by buying more new clothes.

loans.use: to expand her clothing store by buying more new clothes.

loans.name: C2178 Duteraninkunga Group

texts.en:
Mwadjuma is 37 years old, married and has three children between 7 and 20 years old. Mwadjuma is the president of this group, which is called " Duteraninkunga" in local language. She is in the middle on the right side.

She owns a small business where she sells different products such as beans, sugar, salt, cooking oil and Irish potatoes. Mwadjuma has been engaged in this business for one year and she currently employs one person to help her. She runs her business from 6 am until 9 pm every day.

Mwadjuma and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more products such as beans, sugar, cooking oil and Irish potatoes for resale to get better profits. With these profits, she and her group will reinvest in their business and save for their future.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sugar, cooking oil and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is a 21-year-old single man; he is living with his siblings and parents. Albert is the second of six children and graduated from senior high school two years ago. 

Albert is a hardworking man; he takes on the responsibility to support his family. Albert has been accustomed to working at the farm since he was at school in order to help his father in cultivating plants such cucumber, rice, tomatoes, and vegetables. In addition, Albert is also raising livestock such as pigs, chicken and goats to sell at the market. The income from his business is used to meet his family's daily needs. 

Albert dreams of cultivating more plants at the farm such cucumber and tomatoes. He is sure that he will generate more income since he could harvest more. Therefore he would like to request a loan of 5,000,000 Rupiah (IDR) from TLM. He would spend the loan on more seeds, fertilizer and pesticide. He believes that the loan will support him in improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Наталья обращается за кредитом уже в третий раз. Ее сын женится в октябре и Наталья с мужем потритили много средств на приготовление к свадьбе. Расходы будут покрыты со второго урожая, однако сейчас нужны деньги на закупку семян и постройку большой теплицы для выращивания рассады. Добавив собственные средства к полученному кредиту, Наталья планирует сделать следующие вложения в бизнес: новая теплица для рассады-6000грн., отопление в теплице-5000грн., пленка-4000грн., семена-3000грн. После свадьбы сын уезжает с женой к родственникам на север России, где есть хорошая работа для него.
texts.en: Natalya is coming to you with a loan request for the third time.  Her son is getting married in October, and Natalya and her husband spent a lot of money on wedding preparations.  They will cover the expenses with the second harvest; however, they now need money to buy seeds and to build a large greenhouse for growing seedlings.  Adding her own funds to the obtained loan, Natalya plans to make the following investments into her business: 6000 hryvnia for a new greenhouse for seedlings, 5000 hryvnia for heating in the greenhouse, 4000 hryvnia for plastic and 3000 hryvnia for seeds.  Her son and his wife are leaving after the wedding to live with relatives in the north of Russia, where there is a good job for him.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and build a greenhouse for seedlings

loans.name: Nahla

texts.en: Nahla is a 34-year-old young woman. She is married and has three sons and two daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver and earns the only source of income for the family. Nahla wants to help her husband in paying the expense of making repairs to the taxi car such as painting, changing the engine, etc., but the amount of money she has isn't enough. This is why she needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,500 from FATEN. When Nahla gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to help her husband in paying the expense of repairing the taxi. This will improve the taxi conditions, and enable her husband to work extra hours and increase his income. Nahla is a conservative woman, so her husband Naji is photographed next to the taxi car instead of her.

loans.use: to pay the expense of repairing the taxi car.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, necesita nuevamente un préstamo, este lo invertirá en la reparación del vehículo, pagando por los servicios de tapicería, amortiguación, mano de obra, este préstamo le será muy útil para darle mantenimiento al medio de transporte. Para Carlos los préstamos han sido un gran apoyo, hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades ni familiares ni del empleo.
texts.en: Carlos needs a new loan which he will invest in the repair of his vehicle, paying for upholstery, shock absorbers, and labor.  This loan will be useful in giving him the means to maintain his vehicle.  For Carlos the loans have been a big help.  He has had no previous family or employment problems.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the repair of his vehicle with shock absiorbers and new upholstery.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 47 years old and married with 6 children. With two children in school, Ninfa works very hard to provide for her family.

Ninfa runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. Ninfa has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sardines, oil, spices, and eggs.

In the future, Ninfa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell such as soap, sardines, oil, spices, and eggs

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 24-year-old single man who has been working as a photographer since 2004. His shop is well known in the region. Most of his customers are neighbors and relatives, in addition to nearby villagers. Ibrahim is a talented, hardworking man. He tries his best to improve his business, in order to improve both his social and financial situation. Ibrahim is recommended in most engagements, weddings, and many other private events. He has special techniques that give his pictures a special identity. 

To improve his business, Ibrahim is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy new frame collections, cameras, and batteries necessary for his business. He hopes that his business will improve more and more in the future, and he hopes to expand his business to be a special events planner from A–Z.

loans.use: to buy new frame collections, cameras, and batteries necessary for his business

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Tembea Uone Lugari Group

texts.en:
Yordan is a 46-year-old father of four children, two of them who attend secondary education. He has engaged in farming activities, especially growing coffee, maize and beans, for over twelve years. He has agricultural problems such as lack of fertilizer and insecticide that lead to low production.

Yordan seeks for more funds to finance his farming activities by buying fertilizer, insecticide and gum boots. He wishes to improve his scale of production in five years from 8 acres to 16 acres and to buy an insecticide pump machine.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and gum boots

loans.name: Teofie

texts.en:
Teofie is a 36-year-old married man from Cortes, Bohol. He has an 8-year-old child. Teofie earns a living by selling candles to the people in his community. Teofie works hard to improve his business and to continue providing for his family.

Teofie has requested this loan to buy more candles to sell. He hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more candles to sell

loans.name: Hector Santiago

texts.es: El joven Héctor a sus 19 años de edad es un emprendedor quien lleva tan sólo un mes con su negocio de venta por catálogo de productos para la belleza y la salud, esta idea surgió al ver como a un conocido le explicaban como se hace esta actividad. Con el ánimo de iniciar fuertemente con su negocio y poder llevar a varias veredas del municipio de la ceja localizado al oriente de Antioquia sus productos, el joven Héctor necesita de la compra de surtido que le aporte la materia prima para cumplir sus propósitos y a futuro pueda consolidar su negocio y tener un gran número de clientes.
texts.en: Young Héctor at 19 years of age is an entrepreneur who has been selling beauty and health products by mail order for a month. The idea for the business arose upon seeing an acquaintance run a similar business and they explained to him how to run such a business. With the spirit to begin strongly with his business and to sell his products along several paths of the municipality located to the east of Antioquia, young Hector needs to purchase an assortment of his primary products to introduce to the community so that in the future he can consolidate his business and have a great number of clients.

loans.use: to buy assorted health and beauty products

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Everline dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of oranges, tomatoes, onions and mangoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of oranges, tomatoes, onions and mangoes.

loans.name: Bunthoeurn

texts.en:
Bunthoeurn, 57, is married, resides with his wife and three children in Kampong Chhang Province, Cambodia. He is a staff of the Art and Cultural Department. His wife is a homemaker. All of his children are employed; two are staff of the governor and another one is employed in a bank. 

In order to improve his family finances, Bunthoeurn is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to set up a grocery store for his wife to run from their home. This will generate extra income to support the family. In the future, he would like to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for his wife to sell at home.

loans.name: Sardar's Group

texts.en:
Sardar belongs to a village Harpoke that is located in district Gujranwala, province Punjab.  He is a group leader of four, holding register. He is 42 years old, partnered, and has 3 children. The members of this group alternate their daily tasks with growing rice wheat and vegetables. The members have had their business for a good while, which is going well for them due to the determination they puts into their business each day. The members want to continue working so, in this way, to continue supporting their families. 

The members ask for the loan to purchase agriculture inputs like fertilizer, quality seeds and pesticides for their rice crop. This loan shall maximize their crop output. Their goal is to send their children in school for better education.

The members are grateful for the granted loan and promise to make the established payments.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel etc.

loans.name: Jlg-005-Paraipatti Group

texts.en:
Manjula is a 43-year-old, married woman. She lives with her family of seven in Karur district of Tamil Nadu, in the southern part of India. She formed a group of three along with two other women from her village. She works hard to support her family, and saves diligently, but she does not have the means to build a toilet at home.

Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields.
