Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, the family member are at risk of infection and fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters in her family are exposed to the additional risk of molestation.

So, taking advantage of the awareness initiatives, the group now seeks a loan of INR 42,000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help these families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: to fund the installation of a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.en:
Hello! My name is Pedro and my business is a shoe store. I make and sell shoes in my community and in nearby neighborhoods. I also repair shoes. I have been dedicated to this for years now and I earn enough income to support my business and family. Now, I need to buy materials to make more styles of shoes and sandals. My dream is to build a house and if I can work more with more products, I can achieve my goal.

Loan Use: Purchase of leather, glue, a sewing machine and other materials.

Hola mi nombre es Pedro y mi negocio es una zapateria, yo fabrico y vendo zapatos en mi comunidad y otras aldeas vecinas. Tambien reparo zapatos. Tengo varios años de dedicarme a esta actividad, la que me ha generado ingresos para sostener mi negocio y mi familia. Ahora necesito comprar materiales para fabricar mas estilos de zapato, sandalias. Mi sueño es construir mi casa y se que voy a lograrlo trabajando mas y vendiendo mas producto.

loans.use: Compra de cuero, pegamento, maquina de costurar y otros

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Chritine is a 46 year old single mother with two children aged 18 and 22. She also supports five dependents who are all going to school.

She begun a secretarial business one and a half years ago. She started the business with $US 1,450. She raised $US 500 from savings of her previous employment and $US 950 from a loan from SAO MFI.

She has skills in computer designing and business adminstration which she acquired from a business college.

Christine wants to borrow $1000 to buy a Riso graph stationery printing machine which will make her competitive by providing quality services.

Chritine wants to expand her business so that she is able to provide a variety of secretarial services and increase the number of employees from two to four.
 
With this loan, she hopes to expand her business increase profitabilty which will contribute to increase in her income.

loans.use: Purchase of a secretarial printing machine

loans.name: Osasere

texts.en: Mrs. Osasere O. is 33 years old. She is married with four (4) children. She has been LAPO client for over 6 years. She lives in Benin City. She wants the above amount for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband works in the fields, he drives a tractor. Maria travels to border with Guatemala and buys clothing in wholesale stores which he afterwards sells from her home to people in our community. She belongs to the group “Chiflon 1”, together with Mrs. Veronica Palacios Santiz (sales of perfumes and creams) and Mrs. Candelaria V. Ruiz (production and sales of cement blocks). With the loan, Maria will be able to buying more merchandise per trip, and so reduced in number of trips to border. Veronica will invest it in cosmetics and Candelaria will acquire a machine that speeds up the manufacturing process of cement blocks.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA TIENE 43 AÑOS, CASADA, UN HIJO, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO MANEJANDO UN TRACTOR. MARIA VIAJA A LA FRONTERA CON GUATEMALA Y COMPRA ROPA EN LAS TIENDAS DE MAYOREO Y POSTERIORMENTE LAS VENDE EN SU CASA A LAS PERSONAS DE SU COMUNIDAD, PERTENECE AL GRUPO CHIFLON 1 JUNTO CON DOÑA VERONICA PALACIOS SANTIZ (VENTA DE PERFUMES Y CREMAS) Y DOÑA CANDELARIA V. RUIZ (PRODUCCION Y VENTA DE BLOCKS DE CEMENTO). CON EL PRESTAMO MARIA VIAJARA Y COMPRARA MAS MERCADERIA PARA DISMINUIR LA CANTIDAD DE VIAJES A LA FRONTERA, VERONICA INVERTIRA EN COSMETICOS Y CANDELARIA ADQUIRIRA MAQUINARIA PARA ACELERAR EL PROCESO DE ELABORACION DE TABIQUES.

loans.use: Sales of clothing

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en: A tailor by profession, Faaiuga is also a wife and a mother to 4 children. From sewing, she gets money to take care of her family. With a taxi on hand, it really helps with delivery, and receiving financial compensation from SPBD has been a great help. She wants to own her own sewing shop.

loans.use: Top purchase sewing equipment and materials

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en: Zawadi is a 39-year-old resident of Tandika.  She runs a restaurant, a business she has been doing for the past 6 years. She prepares breakfast, lunch and supper. She is in need of more tables and chairs for her restaurant to cater to the increasing number of customers. She is in need of $225 to help her boost her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
"I would like to build a room behind my house to have more space. Houses bought with a social interest rate are very small and I need to make an effort to make it bigger and live more comfortably. I request $450 for the construction of a room behind my house."

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

“Quiero construir un cuarto en la parte de atrás de mi vivienda para que haya más espacio, las casas de interés social son muy pequeñas y tengo que hacer un esfuerzo para hacerla un poco más grande y poder vivir cómodamente. Solicito $ 450.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto atrás de mi vivienda.

loans.use: Build a room at the back of my house.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos Luis P. Macedo is married and has 6 school age children. He lives with his family in a house they own in Cruce Liberacion in the city of Santani.

He started working in the city of San Estanislao with a relative who had an agro-veterinary. He learned a lot about that business there.

He now owns a veterinary, which has been working for 6 years in the city where he lives. He rents his locale. He keeps a considerable stock of merchandise and a good clientele.

Mr. Carlos is well known in his area as a person who is hard working, honest and devoted to his job. He has good commercial and personal references.

His dream is to have his own locale so he can use the money he is now spending on rent to invest in products for his veterinary and in this way increase his business' income.

The loan will be used to buy veterinary medications and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Carlos Luis P. Macedo es casado con 6 hijos todos menores de edad en etapa escolar, vive con su familia en su casa propia ubicada en Cruce Liberación, ciudad de Santani.

Comenzó a trabajar en la ciudad de San Estanislao, con un pariente que tenía una Agro veterinaria, allí aprendió mucho sobre este rubro

Hoy es propietario de una Veterinaria, puesta en funcionamiento hace 6 años en la ciudad donde vive, su local es alquilado. Mantiene un stock de mercaderías bien considerable y mantiene una cartera buena de clientes.

El Señor Carlos es una persona bien conocida en su localidad por ser trabajadora, honesta y dedicada en su trabajo. Tiene buenas referencias comerciales y personales.

Su sueño es tener un local propio para así el dinero que gasta en alquiler utilizarlo para invertir en productos para su Veterinaria y de esa manera aumentar los ingresos de su negocio.

El crédito será destinado a la compra de medicamentos e insumos Veterinarios.

loans.use: buying veterinary medications (COMPRAS DE MEDICAMENTOS VETERINARIOS)

loans.name: Elsa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Elsa de Socorra G. is the mother of 4 children and together with her husband, works very hard to give them a good education, food and all their other necessities in life. Mrs. G. has run a grocery store ever since she was young and has continued to develop it in the market of Santa Ana, in the city of Chinandega. Her business began as she was going through a rough economic patch, which she tells us was very hard to get through because she didn't know what she was going to do to be able to support her children. And so, she decided to start this business.

With the experience she has gained over time, her business has begun to strengthen and grow, and now she is able to supply her home with it's necessities. She has worked with CEPRODEL for one year and feels very satisfied with the loans she has fulfilled, which have given her more than enough capital to purchase all kinds of products for her grocery store. She has had 3 previous loans with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Elsa del Socorro G. es madre de 4 hijos que junto con su esposo lucha por brindarles su educación, alimentación y todas las necesidades. El negocio de la señora G. es una pulpería que desde muy joven la ha venido desarrollando en el mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega. El negocio lo comienza cuando atraviesan una fuerte crisis económica y nos dice que fue muy duro ya que ella no tenia idea de cómo iba a mantener a sus hijos por lo que decide invertir en este negocio.

Con la experiencia que fue tomando con el tiempo, el negocio lo fue fortaleciendo, y de esta manera ha podido suplir las necesidades del hogar. Ella trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 1 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados cuando mas lo necesita para la compra de todos los productos para su pulpería. Su record es de 3 créditos con CEPRODEL.

loans.use: To purchase items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan S., 28, works as a housewife looking after the children and cooking food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Mei Sophea, works as a construction laborer, earning on average $4.20 a day. They have three children, who are all students. To provide the family with better living conditions, they agreed to ask for a loan from Kiva to purchase cashew nuts and resell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase cashew nuts to resell for a profit.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Hà, 39, was having a difficult life. She was having some health issues so she could not work on tasks that require force. She has 3 children and 2 of them had suddenly developed illness which had left sequela. So everything is relied on her husband, Mr Liên, who works on their small piece of land so things are very difficult for the family. She then joined TYM and got a loan which she used to buy goods from H. Noi city then to resell. Everyday her husband would go to every hamlet in the village to sell the goods. After a while, someone she knows teaches her how to make those paper horses and other religious objects made with paper and bamboo that people would burn as offerings in religious ceremony. So she learned the trade since it is not a forceful task. She applied for a loan and started this business. She had since then obtained numerous loans totaling in the thousands usd. This had turned her life around, things have really improved for her family. She has a lot of customers especially during the end of the year (when there are a lot of ceremonies). Her income is 200-220 USD a month. This time she is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy material (paper, bamboo).

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Hoàn cảnh gia đinh chị Nguyễn Thị Hà, 39 tuổi, trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ rất khó khăn về cả vật chất lẫn tinh thần. Bản thân chị sức khoẻ yếu không làm được công việc nặng, 2 trong 3 đứa con, 13, 15 tuổi, đang khoẻ mạnh lần lượt ốm và để lại di chứng. Tất cả trông chờ vào anh Liên, chồng chị, với vài sào ruộng, cuộc sống quả thật rất vất vả. Tham gia vào Quỹ, chị đã dùng đồng vốn nhỏ bé ban đầu mua hàng từ Hà nội về. Hàng ngày chồng chị rong ruổi trên các đường làng ngõ xóm bán hàng rong, thu nhập từ đó cũng được cải thiện. Sau một thời gian có người quen bàn chuyện và dạy cách làm hàng mã. Thấy công việc khả quan và rất phù hợp với sức khỏe của mình, chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn lớn đầu tư cho dự án này. Đến nay số vốn đầu tư lên đến vài nghìn USD, cuộc sống đã thật sự thay đổi với chị và gia đình. Khách hàng đến với cửa hàng ngày càng đông, nhất là những dịp cuối năm nên chị tất bật suốt ngày. Thu nhập của cả gia đình đạt 200-220USD/tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị Hà tiếp tục xin vay 1200USD để mua nguyên liệu (giấy, nan tre) làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy paper, bamboo to make votive objects

loans.name: Sokheourn Kao Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sokheourn K. was born in 1960 in Kralanh Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is the group leader and her group consists of six members. She is married and has three children, two of whom are students while the third stays at home. She sells baskets and her husband, Kiri Ur, is a construction worker in the village. Between the both of them, they cannot generate an income that will allow them to improve their standard of living. In order to change their situation, Mrs. Sokheourn K. wants to expand her business.  Therefore, she applied for a loan to buy more raw materials to make more baskets to sell.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials to make baskets

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela is a responsible mother who had to take control of her household when her husband had an accident in the brutal jungle. She makes beautiful handicrafts for home decoration in her city, but she has always had one problem that has thwarted production: the materials she needs are very costly. For this reason, she has decided to buy a greater quantity of supplies so that she can increase the number of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Adela, es una responsable madre de familia que tomó las riendas de su hogar, cuando su esposo se accidentó en la agreste S.. Se dedica a realizar bellos trabajos artesanales para la decoración de los hogares de su ciudad, pero siempre ha tenido un inconveniente que ha perjudicado el incremento de su producción ya que los materiales que utiliza son costosos, por esa razón ha decidido comprar en mayor volumen sus herramientas a fin de acrecentar el número de sus artículos.

loans.use: Purchase of more handicraft materials in order to boost production

loans.name: Zadith

texts.es:
Zadith Ríos P., partner of the "Coffee Flower" Communal Bank, lives in the San Martín region in the Moyabamba Province, District of Soritor. She is engaged in the sale of groceries generally, meats (chicken, beef, pork), snacks, and other food products for daily consumption. Her business is located in her own home, situated in the Jr. Federico Froevel No. 280 block. Local clients and passers-by visit her daily.

The idea of starting the business arose from the necessity to help the family get ahead and to support her husband, as well as to proviD. for the education of her children. In addition, she likes to be in permanent contact with her friends and clients.

With the loan of S/. 800.00 to be re-paid within 6 months, she will buy diverse grocery products including: boxed brand-name soaps (Marsella, Bolívar, Jumbo), hygienic paper in packages, preserved fish, oil by the liter, soda, rice and sacks of sugar. She will also buy vegetables and eggs to supply to her clients.

Zadith is 51 years old and lives with 2 of her children and her husband, all of whom support her in the business. Together they dream about having a clothing store and assuring the well-being of the family.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Zadith Ríos P., socia del Banco Comunal “Flor Del Cafe”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia D. Moyabamba distrito D. Soritor, se dedica a venta D. abarrotes en general, carnes D. ( pollo, res, y carne D. cerdo), golosinas y otros productos comestibles D. consumo diario, su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa, ubicada en el jr Federico Froevel Nro 280, donD. diariamente acuden su clientes que son moradores D. la propia localidad o transeúntes D. lugares cercanos.

La idea del negocio, surgió ante la necesidad D. sacar adelante a la familia y apoyar a su esposo, en la educación D. sus hijos y además le gusta estar en contacto permanente con sus amigos y clientes.

Con el préstamo D. S/.800.00 para ser pagado en 6 meses, comprará diversos abarrotes como: cajas D. jabón por cada marca (Marsella, bolívar, jumbo) papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas D. pescado, aceite por litros, bebidas D. gaseosas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, también comprará verduras y huevos en javas para ofertar a sus clientes.

Zadith tiene 51 años, vive junto a sus 02 hijos y su esposo, son quienes le apoyan siempre en el negocio, juntos sueñan con tener su tienda D. ropa y asegurar el bienestar D. su familia.

loans.use:
Wholesale purchase of groceries and supplies.
Compra al por mayor de artículos diversos (abarrotes).

loans.name: Theopista's Ushindi Group

texts.en:
Theopista is a married woman with 2 children aged 15 and 12. She became a vegetable seller in 2002. Every day, she works from 10am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Theopista now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with farms and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia tiene 29 años de edad, vive en concubinato con el señor Ruben, de 35 años, tienen tres hijos, dos en edad escolar y una va al colegio.

Ella se dedica a la venta ambulante y a crédito de artículos artesanales, y también elabora en su propia casa las colchas para venderlas en otras ciudades. Su pareja trabaja en una fábrica de azúcar hace más de cinco años. Gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio de ambos han podido progresar, pudiendo construir para su vivienda y hacer estudiar a sus hijos.

El crédito fue utilizado en la compra de una motocicleta para el señor Rubén, siendo un elemento de trabajo para trasladarlo hasta la fábrica, teniendo en cuenta que vive a cinco kilómetros de ella y en la zona no existen buses que lo trasladen hasta su trabajo. Además con este vehiculo saldrá también los fines de semana a vender los productos de Sonia por las ciudades aledañas.
texts.en:
Sonia is 29 years old. She lives with Ruben, and they have three children together who are all in school. She is works as a traveling sales woman. She sells artisan products and she also makes and sells quilts. Her partner has worked in a factory that processes sugar for more than 5 years. Thanks to the efforts and sacrifice of them both they have been able to get ahead, and were able to improve their home and send their children to school. This credit will be used to purchase a motorcycle for Ruben, which would be his transportation to work since they live 5 kilometer from the factory and there are no buses. Also, with this vehicle they would go out on the weekends to sell Sonia’s products in the villages.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Zuhura's Mwanzo Mgumu Group

texts.en:
Zuhura is married with 4 children between the ages of 16 and 25 and years old. She has been a clothes seller since 2005. Everyday she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Zuhura is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes for the expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Asha, who has a business dealing with shop owning.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Zenaida Marcionila

texts.es:
La señora Zenaida Marcionila A. V., tiene 70 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Mañana y vive en la calle Antenor Orrego 129 del distrito de Agallpampa, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Cursó hasta tercer año de primaria y no siguió estudiando porque no hubo apoyo de parte de sus padres. Se casó a los 16 años con el señor Eduardo Gamboa y tuvieron 10 hijos, dos de ellos fallecidos, cuando eran pequeños. Actualmente tiene a su cargo una nieta que todavía estudia. 
Empezó su negocio vendiendo fruta y otros productos que se pueden comprar en el lugar, pero luego advirtió que más se gana en la venta de la cerveza, ahora eso es lo que vende.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró y vendió fruta.
Con este crédito de 800 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará cerveza, fruta y galletas.
Zenaida sueña con viajar y conocer varios lugares que no conoce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zenaida Marcionila A. V. is 70 years old and belongs to the Women of Tomorrow Community Bank. She lives at 129 Antenor Orrego in the district of Agallpampa, in the province of Otuzco, in the suburb of La Libertad, Perú. She studied until the third year of elementary school, but did not continue because she did not have her parents' support. Zenaida got married at age 16 with Eduardo Gamboa, and the couple had 10 children. Two of the children died when they were young. Currently, Zenaida looks after a granddaughter who is still a student. She began her business selling fruit and other products, but later noticed that selling beer was more profitable, and so she now sells beer. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 months, Zenaida purchased and sold fruit. With this 800 soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, Zenaida will purchase beer, fruit and crackers. Zenaida dreams of traveling and visiting many places that she has not been.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer, fruit and crackers

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Retraité de l’enseignement, Mme G. Ayélé  est mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants. Seule à faire face aux charges de la famille avec une pension de retraite qui n’est pas au rendez-vous à la fin de chaque mois, elle n’a que sa boutique d’alimentation générale qui lui procure juste de quoi survivre avec  la famille. Elle a vraiment besoin de financement pour développer son activité et augmenter son revenu afin de supporter sans problème les nombreux besoins de la famille et surtout l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Retired from teaching, Mrs Ayele G. is married and the mother of seven (7) children. Alone to meet the family expenses, her retirement pension is not enough to get through to the end of the month. She has only her general food shop to earn just enough to meet the family needs. She requires financing to develop her business activities and increase her revenues to meet, without difficulty, the many requirements of her family, particularly the education of her children.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase provisions for her general store

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena I. sells fufu. Fufu is a local food in Nigeria that is gotten from fermented cassava. She needs the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more cassava to process into fufu. She is 46 years old and married with four children. She is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to process into fufu.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort M. sells rubber and plastic products in local markets. She owns a shop selling rubber buckets, cups, spoons, bowls, plates and other items and sells them in the market square.She buys most of her products in the town of Kumasi in South central Ghana and has been in business for six years.  She is 52 years old and married with four children. The first born has completed school and her other 3 children are in high school. Comfort lives with two of her children and husband in a town called Bibiani in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband works with the high way authority in Mampong in the Ashanti Region. She wants a loan to buy rubber products on a larger scale so she can trek to other markets to do business and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy rubber producets, such as buckets and bowls in bulk

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
La sra. Alba Luz reside en villa reconciliación, casada y con tres hijos uno casado, uno que esta trabajando y el mas pequeño estudia, su esposo es mecánico automotriz, ella vende fritanga por las tardes y ropa desde hace trece años ha logrado mantener su negocio que inicio con dinero propio con la venta de ropa, con este crédito va invertir en la compra de mesa y sillas plásticas para atender al cliente en mejores condiciones, y poder ir creciendo con el apoyo que Afodenic le ha otorgado ya que este es su octavo crédito y espera seguir beneficiándose 
Para lograr sus metas, y poder gozar junto con su familia los logros.
texts.en:
Alba Luz lives in Villa Reconciliación, is married and has three children: one is married, one is working and the youngest studies. Her husband is an auto mechanic. For the past three years she has sold fritanga (fried snacks) in the afternoons and clothing. She has managed to keep up the business, which she started with her own money from the sale of clothing. With this loan she is going to invest in a plastic table and chairs to have better conditions in which to serve her customers. With the help of Afodenic she will be able to keep growing. This is her eighth loan and she hopes to continue to do well, reach her goals and enjoy her achievements with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a plastic table and chairs to provide better service at her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and planting supplies for their land

loans.name: Kouma

texts.fr: Kouma T. est une jeune femme de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale à Womé, un village situé au sud ouest do Togo. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit, augmenter la taille de son commerce en alimentant son magasin de nouveaux produits. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kouma T., age 39, is married and the mother of 2 children. She owns a grocery store in Womé, a village located in Southwestern Togo. With this loan, she wishes to bolster her business, by supplying her store with new products. She counts on this opportunity to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To resupply her store

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 33 años y vive en su propia casa, con sus 2 hijos; Wendy de 8 y Juan de 3 años, lo que más quiere es darles unos buenos estudios. Ella es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por mejorar su vida, tiene un puesto de ropa en el mercado Tupac Amaru (Mercado Importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), vende casacas, pantalones, buzos, etc., pero todo para niños y lo hace a un precio muy accesible, es por eso que su puesto es muy concurrido por los clientes. Para Lucy lo más difícil de su trabajo es conseguir la ropa que vende, ya que es muy exigente con sus proveedores, espera tener en el futuro una tienda de ropa más grande donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más disfruta de su trabajo, es ver como le queda la ropa que vende a los pequeños clientes, puesto que a ella le gustan mucho los niños. Lucy desea que su negocio progrese y poder tener una mejor vida. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, al igual como hizo con su anterior crédito, desea pagarlo a tiempo y sin dificultades, en su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que es la socia más activa y comprometida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita planea comprar más mercadería y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lucy is a very hard working woman of 33 years and lives in her own home with her two children, Wendy, who is eight years old, and John, who is three. What she wants most is to give them a good education. She is a woman who has always strived to improve her life. She has a clothing stall in the Tupac Amaru market (the major market in the city of Juliaca) and sells jackets, pants, sweaters, etc. - everything for children at very affordable prices. That is why her stall is very busy with customers. For Lucy, the most difficult part of the job is getting the clothes she sells, as it is very demanding dealing with the suppliers. She hopes in the future to have a larger clothing shop where she can sell with greater ease. She has been doing this work for 15 years and what she enjoys most is to see how the clothes that she sells to her young clients look, because she is very fond of children. Lucy wants to advance her business and be able to have a better life. This is her second loan with MFP and like she did with her previous credit she wants to pay on time and without difficulties. In her community bank she is very respected because she is the most active and committed member. With two thousand new soles that she is asking for she plans to buy more merchandise and increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise inventory

loans.name: Marifjon

texts.en:
T. Marifjon, 34, is married and has three children. He lives in Spitamen town and works in the agricultural industry. Twelve years ago he decided to begin to cultivate land that he owned. He did so to generate more income that would enable him to support his family.

Marifjon grows wheat, corn and vegetables, which he must give the proper care so that he can produce a full, healthy harvest. He will use the loan money to buy inputs that will enable him to improve production yield. Marifjon has discovered over the years that he enjoys doing this job, and that's why he will continue to use loans in order to improve his farm and become a better farmer.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 38 años, está casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos por quienes tiene que velar y cuidar, gracias al apoyo de su pareja lograron conseguir una casa propia donde habitan en armonía. Debido a la invitación de una amiga pudo ingresar al grupo de promotoras de ventas que ofrecen productos medicinales, los cuales son muy efectivos para las variedades de dolencias que suelen atravesar las personas, lo cual hace rentable el negocio, pues son productos costosos y por cada venta recibe una comisión con la cual mantiene los gastos en su hogar. Esta actividad la viene realizando hace 4 años y en el tiempo que viene trabajando ha tenido la posibilidad de formar parte de las líderes, quienes son consejeras para las nuevas promotoras, capacitándolas y apoyándolas en la venta de los productos, también las motivan a seguir adelante y con el tiempo especializarse para instalar una consultoría donde pueda atender a sus clientes de manera personalizada y mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas en cuanto a su salud. Antonia trabaja con MFP hace 3 años y este es su sexto crédito, lo que le agrada dentro de su equipo de trabajo es la organización y responsabilidad que demandan las líderes a cada una de las integrantes. Con los 800 soles solicitados comprará la mercadería que requiere para sus clientas, pues este mes tuvo que invertir en suministrar de productos a las promotoras que tiene a su cargo.
texts.en:
Antonia is 38 and married. She has two small children to watch over and take care of. Thanks to her husband’s support they were able to get a home of their own where they live in harmony. Antonia joined the group of sales promoters through a friend’s invitation. They sell medicinal products that are very effective for the variety of ailments that people usually experience. The business is profitable. The products are expensive, and for every sale she receives a commission. This pays the household expenses. She has been in the business for four years. She has been given the opportunity to be part of the leadership; they serve as counselors for the new salespeople. The leaders train and support the new people in their sales. The leaders also motivate the new people to get ahead, and, with time, to specialize in order to set up a place to consult and tend to their customers in a personalized manner. That will improve the health and quality of life of the customers. Antonia has worked with MFP for three years, and this is her sixth loan. Concerning her work team, she is grateful for the organization and responsibility that the leaders require of each member. With the 800 PEN she will buy merchandise that her customers need. This month she had to invest in supplying products for the salespeople in her charge.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Houria

texts.en:
Houria is a 35 year old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Houria has been working as farmer for eighteen years. She plants and sells fruits and vegetables. Houria requests a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new tools and seed. This is her fourth cycle and she has always paid on time. 
Her previous loans helped her diversify her production. Houria is respected because she sells good quality food. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and fruit and vegetable shops. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Houria decided on this business because of her experience - she learned it since she was young. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Houria will use the loan to purchase new tools and seed.

loans.name: Aris

texts.es: Aris es casado, trabaja como docente de Educacion primaria en la colonia Naciones a 35 km de Nueva Guinea, todos los dia tiene que viajar a las 6 de la mañana para impartir sus clases a los niños de esa colonia, vive  en la zona # 4  de Nueva Guinea, a pesar que no tiene hijos es un joven que ha luchado para que a su  esposa y sus ancianos padres no les falte nada, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Pintar la casa y hecharle el piso a la cocina); actualmente esta estudiando su 2do año en la universidad en ciencias de la Educacion, es responsable, honesto,  trabajador,  profesa  la religión católica su sueño es tener un porvenir mejor, terminar de estudiar la carrera que esta cursando,  tener una vivienda bonita, trabajo, ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Aris is married. He works as an elementary school teacher in the Naciones colony, which is 35 km from New Guinea. Every day he has to leave at six in the morning to teach classes to the children of this colony. He lives in zone #4 in New Guinea. In spite of the fact that he does not have children, he is a young man who has struggled so that his wife and his elderly parents have what they need. He is asking to refinance his second loan to be able to improve his house (paint the house and put down a kitchen floor). He is currently in his second year of studying education in the university. He is a responsible, honest, and hard working Catholic. His dream is to have a better future, finish his career studies, have a beautiful house, work, and help his parents with their household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paint the house and put down a kitchen floor

loans.name: Ngy

texts.en:
Ngy C., 28, operates a food shop in Phnom Penh City for an income US$10 per day. C. and her husband have no children. Her husband is motor-taxi driver usually providing transportation services at the nearby markets.

C. wants to take a loan US$1,000 to expand the inventory of her food-selling business. She is optimistic that she will be able to generate more income with her business when she invests more money into it.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and meat to make food for sale

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Juan Alberto C. M. es un señor de 63 años de edad, quien vive,  en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Las Delicias de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche), siembra de granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz entre otros.

Debido a las pocas fuentes de empleo que ofrece la  comunidad, don Juan  se propuso  incursionar como microempresario en el área de la agricultura especializándose en el cultivo de tiquisque, un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Cosa Rica como en otros países.

Don Juan  ya tiene experiencia en el cuidado y el mantenimiento que se requiere para esta clase de cultivo, ya que ha sembrado tiquisque anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirlo por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio su calidad de vida ha mejorado.

En estos momentos don Juan desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢300,000 (trescientos mil colones), para ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del tiquisque.
 
Don Juan es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad
texts.en:
Juan Alberto C. M. is 63 years old and lives in a small rural community in Costa Rica called Las Delicias de Upala, located in the Alajuela province. There they have businesses, raise cattle (meat and dairy), and grow basic grains such as rice, beans, corn, etc. Because there are few jobs in his community, Juan began as a microbusinessman in agriculture specializing in growing taro, a tuber with a pleasant flavor, rich in nutrients, widely grown and in great demand in Costa Rica as well as other countries. Juan is experienced in the care and maintenance that is required to grow this crop, as he has grown taro before and has had good results at harvest so he wishes to expand his farm. Thanks to this business his quality of life has improved. Today Juan wishes to obtain a loan for ¢300,000 colones to help prepare his land, buy seeds, fertilizer, manure an dother items needed to guarantee an optimum crop of taro. Juan is a member of the Datraban communal bank, onr of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing personally and economically in addition to actively participating in the microloan organization in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy farming supplies

loans.name: Victoire Emilie

texts.fr: Victoire Emilie est née le 30 Septembre 1960 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Victoire Emilie est mariée et mère d'un seul enfant. Victoire Emilie vit avec sa famille à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Victoire Emilie a été à l'école mais elle a fini par abandonner les classes au profit de la vente d'ustensiles de cuisine avec l'aide financière de ses parents. Mais, Victoire Emilie laissa cette activité quelques années plus tard  pour vendre des tenues pour hommes et dames. C'est cette activité que Victoire Emilie mène jusqu'à ce jour. Victoire Emilie est à son cinquième crédit avec ALIDé. Victoire Emilie sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Victoire Emilie was born on September 30, 1960 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married and the mother of only one child. She lives with her family in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She attended school but ended up dropping out in favor of selling kitchen utensils with the financial help of her parents. However, Victoire Emilie left this business a few years later to sell outfits for men and women. It’s a business that she still runs today. She is on her fifth loan with ALIDé. She is requesting this loan to boost her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shirts for men and some damask fabrics

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Being a member of ASHI since 2005, Lilibeth M. is requesting for a larger amount of loan to finance her variety store and hog fattening businesses which she started up during the time she has availed loan. ASHI is the first and only MFI she joined in order to have an access to business capital. All throughout her membership, she maintained a very good performances in repayment, attendance during center meeting and business. Lilibeth is 33 years old and has four children aging from two to 12 years old. Her husband is a farm laborer. Family daily expenses are hard to manage without Lilibeth's businesses since her husband's income is sporadic and insufficient. Profits her businesses are making are the main source for financing the education of her four children wherein one is in high school, and two are in elementary.
Lilibeth wants to grow her businesses well through loans she can avail from ASHI in order to increase her profit and to be able to send all of her children to school until college.

loans.use: Will be used to finance a hog fattening (pig raising) business and variety store.

loans.name: Nyara

texts.en:
Nyara S. is currently in the business of selling beer at home and is requesting a loan to purchase more beer and wine to sell. She is 41 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has five children, and her children all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar near her home.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase beer and wine to sell

loans.name: Hermelinda E.

texts.es:
La señora HERMELINDA E. V. D. C. tiene 52 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. MACHE , provincia D. OTUZCO, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú. HERMELINDA es casada La empresaria presenta estudios Hasta 6to D. primaria, porque desD. esa edad empezó a dedicarse al campo . HERMELINDA se dedica a la venta D. productos alimenticios en la pequeña tienda D. comestibles que tiene en su casa. Viaja a Trujillo y compra los productos mas baratos para poder tener mayores ganancias.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles viajo a Trujillo y compro  arroz, azúcar, jabones, aceite , papel higiénico, gaseosas y golosinas.
 Con este crédito D. 3,000  soles lo invertirá en la compra D. mas productos alimenticios para surtir su tienda D. comestibles que tiene en su casa. HERMELINDA  sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. HERMELINDA VILLACULCA D. C. is 52 years old. She lives in the district of MACHE, province of OTUZCO, department of La Libertad, Peru. HERMELINDA is married. The entrepreneur studied until 6th graD. when she started farming. For a living, HERMELINDA sells groceries from the small store at her house. She travels to Trujillo to buy the products at a cheaper price in order to increase earnings.

With her first loan of 300 soles she traveled to Trujillo and bought rice, sugar, soap, cooking oil, toilet paper, pops, and candy.

With this loan of 3,000 soles she will invest in buying more groceries to supply her store. HERMELINDA dreams of making her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in buying more groceries to supply general store.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La señora Dionisia es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón Pampuyo” ubicado en el centro poblado de Corazón Pampuyo del distrito Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno; tiene 38 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 06 hijos, vive en Ticaraya, ella estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ropa.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ropa en todas las tallas, además se dedica también a la cría de ovinos y aves de corral.

Su mayor deseo es poder tener una granja.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones, los ahorros y las charlas.

loans.use: Para la compra de ropas de todas las tallas y aves de corral.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 45 years old and married to Romeo. They are blessed with three children: Nolisa, 25 years old; Christian, 23 years old and Ma. Kristina, 22 years old.  All of them are high school graduates.

Imelda owns and manages a general store business.  She would like to continue improving her store to further sustain the basic needs of their family.  To be able to realize her dreams, she would like to borrow additional capital from the Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5,000. She plans to use the loan to purchase different merchandise for her store and hopefully expand her business.  This will serve as a big help in fulfilling her dreams in life. She is praying that she will be loaned this amount.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
At the age of 63 and already a widow, Norma B. is still fighting against poverty for herself, her children (Erlinda, 41 years old; Edgardo, 39 years old; Armand, 35 years old; Elionor, 32 years old; and Lauriano, 29 years old) and her grandchildren.

Although most of her children now have their own work, Norma still continues to run her business, which is the selling of different school and office supplies, and also selling different foods that they personally prepare. These two businesses that they have contribute to the income that they can use for their expenses.

Every loan that she has received since she became a member of Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) is always used properly for the improvement of her businesses. Now, her 7th loan will be used in her business of selling school supplies. She will buy different school and office supplies that are really needed by the students in their school.

Norma’s plan is to improve the school and office supplies sales business because she wants to save so that their dreams of having a computer shop will be possible. This is really their dream because, in their place, it is really in demand.

loans.use: To buy different school and office supplies to sell in her store

loans.name: Makhmadlatif

texts.ru: Махмадлатиф Оев проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 41 год. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Махмадлатиф более 8 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет собственный магазин, в котором торгует хозяйственными товарами. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Mahmadlatif O. lives in the town of Vakhdat. He is 41 years old, married, with six children. Mahmadlatif has been a merchant for more than eight years. He has his own store in which he sells household goods. He is applying for a loan to increase the turnover of his merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Anastasia Uglova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the turnover of his merchandise

loans.name: Pedro Gilberto

texts.es: Don Pedro de 61 años de edad es viudo, habita en la colonia San Jose, puerto de montaña de la zona norte de Nueva Guinea a 57 Km del Casco Urbano, esta solicitando su primer credito a AFODENIC para invertirlo en su pequeño negocio de pulperia que tiene en su casa de habitacion, el cual comenzo con diñero propio con pequeñas cantidades de productos,tiene un hijo de 25 años el cual le ayuda en el manejo del negocio.  El objetivo de don Pedro es poder aumentar el inventario de su pulperia, con la cual obtiene ingresos que le permiten el sustento tanto suyo como el de su hijo.  El se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador y responsable en sus compromisos, el mayor sueño de don Pedro es lograr que su negocio vaya creciendo y poder suplir las necesidades de sus clientes, lo cual le permitira mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Don Pedro is a 61 year old widower who lives in the neighborhood of San Jose, which lies along a mountain pass north of New Guinea and 57 km from Casco Urbano.

He is requesting his first loan from AFODENIC so that he can invest in the little grocery store he established inside of his home. Don Pedro started this business with his own money and a small quantity of products. He has a 25 year old son who helps him manage the business. Don Pedro’s goal is to increase his inventory so that he can earn enough money to support himself and his son. He is known for being a hardworking gentleman who is responsible in all of his commitments. His greatest dream is to grow his business so that he can meet the needs of his customers and generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a widow with 4 children. She is 61 years old. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty.

Florence sells ice blocks to customers. Her greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more materials to make more ice blocks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make more ice blocks to sell

loans.name: Step By Step Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Beat is 32 years old and married with five children between the ages of 7 and 15. They are all in school. She also takes care of three additional dependents. 

Beat has a beauty salon business in Wantoni Mukono that has been operational for fifteen years. From her transactions, she is able to make about $52 in profit every week. Her business is mostly seasonal, during festive seasons and also during weekends, but all the same, she manages to attract her customers and so she is able to make some savings.

Beat has a dream of opening up other big salons with branches in various towns, as well as to build a family house and rentals for her family. She needs a loan to be able to buy hair treatments, hair oil and chemicals, and also to pay salon rent. She is such a hard-working lady.

loans.use: to buy hair treatments, hair oil and chemicals, and to pay salon rent.

loans.name: Baasan

texts.en:
Baasan is a taxi driver and lives with his wife and two children. He has lived in the ger (traditional Mongolian nomadic tent) districts of Ulaanbaatar for ten years.

Baasan purchased a ger insulation covering to help with the air pollution and to save money spent on fuel. He feels that he has saved so much money on fuel with the insulation that he recommended the product to his brother.


About XacBank Eco Products Program:
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius. Sixty percent of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. Sixty percent of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy a six-layer highly insulated yurt (ger) covering

loans.name: Felix Amada

texts.es: La señora Felix Amada es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 60 años de edad, y aun sigue con su negocio el destace de cerdo que desde más de treinta años hace, lo cual ha sido su medio de trabajo para poder apoyar a sus hijos. Vive en el barrio memorial sandino en donde a captado muchos clientes, ya que ella compra cerdo, y los destaza el cual vende la carne,  hace fritos, chicharrones, nacatamales, moronga, vende la manteca, por que le saca mas al cerdo a si que vendiéndolo de un solo. Meses atrás tuvo mucha dificulta con la gripe porcina por que no pude vender sus productos debido a que estaba prohibido la venta, lo cual fue muy critico por que es lo que puede hacer, ya que esta cada dia mas cansada pero por gracias a Dios salio adelante y sigue con su venta de cerdo. Con este préstamo comprara varios cerdos para el destace y poder obtener mejores ganancias. Para ella ha sido de muchos beneficios los préstamos con Afodenic ya que ha logrado mantener su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Felix Amada is a hard-working woman of 60, still butchering pigs as she has for more than 30 years. This has been her means of working to help out her children. She lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood where she has many clients. She purchases the pork, butchers it, then sells it as meat, as well as selling fries, chicharron, tamales, sausage, and lard, getting more out of a pig than she would by selling it whole. Some months ago she had a lot of difficulty due to the swine flu, because sale of pork products was prohibited. This was a critical time for her, since this is what she knows how to do. She is growing more tired, but thanks to God she is getting ahead now in pork sales. With this loan she will buy several pigs for butchering in order to improve her profits. The loans from Afodenic have been quite beneficial to her, enabling her to keep her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of several pigs

loans.name: Areas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Áreas está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras  y emprendedoras los cuales se dedican a comercializar perecederos. Uno de ellos es la señora  Sebastiana de los Ángeles Áreas López  quien comercializa frutas y verduras de acuerdo a la temporada. Ella lleva 5 años trabajando en este negocio junto con su compañero de vida e invertirá el crédito en la compra de cosechas especialmente de mango, aguacate, jocote que es la fruta de temporada.

Los otros integrantes son José Alberto R. quien desde 1992 se dedica a la compra y venta de piña y Graciela del Carmen C. González comercializa frutas y verduras y tiene una pequeña venta en su casa.
Este grupo tiene cinco ciclos de trabajar con Adim en los cuales fueron participes del proceso del proceso de capacitación y formación en desarrollo empresarial y autoestima que Adim oferta. Según ellos esto les beneficio mucho ya que aprendieron a invertir, hacer mas ordenados, ampliar sus negocios y como poder ajustar con su dinero.
texts.en:
The group "Áreas" consists of three hardworking, entrepreneurial people who work selling perishable produce. One of them is Sebastiana, who sells seasonal fruits and vegatables. She has been working in this business with her partner for five years and will use the loan to buy crops of mangos, avocados, and jocotes, which are fruits of this season.

The other members are José who has been buying and selling pineapples since 1992 and Graciela who sells fruits and vegetables and has a small store in her house.

This group has been working with Adim for five loan cycles in which they have been participants in the trainings on capacity building, business development, and self esteem that Adim offers. According to them, this has benefited them greatly as they learned to invest, gain more orders, grow their businesses, and arrange their money.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy harvests of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increasing her stock of grocery products

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tièssiri comprend dix femmes majoritairement mariées dans des familles polygames avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles résident toutes à Darabougou, village situé dans la Commune Rurale de Sakoïba (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments alimentaires (concentrée de tomate, oignons etc), de la restauration et la transformation de la farine de blé en vermicelle qui est la spécialité de Fatoumata M.. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 1er  prêt solidaire.
 Fatoumata M.  fait cette transformation de la farine de blé à l’aide d’une machine manuelle  depuis maintenant 5 ans et  elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 25kg de farine de blé, 2kg de sel et d’autres  ingrédients. 
Pour faire du vermicelle chaque jour elle pétrit, 4kg de farine de blé jusqu’à avoir une pâte homogène et lisse et avec sa machine manuelle elle transforme cette pâte en vermicelle d’épaisseurs différentes, qu’elle fait sécher sur des nattes recouvertes de toile de cretonne. Ce vermicelle est protégé par de tissus blancs et légers, une façon d’observer les mesures d’hygiène. Le vermicelle est mesuré à l’aide d’une louche et ensaché, destiné aux ménagères et restaurants. Elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout lors des évènements sociaux. 
Elle se ravitaille hebdomadairement  en matières premières, à la foire du grand marché de Ségou et effectue sa vente à domicile, au marché, généralement au comptant à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et satisfaire certains petits besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The Tièssiri group is comprised of ten women, the majority of whom are married and in polygamous families. On average, they are 37 years old and have four children. They all live in Darabougou, a village in the rural community of Sakoiba (4th administrative region of Mali). They know each other through parent, marriage, and neighbor connections. This group of women works with condiments (tomato concentrate, onions, etc.), in the restaurant business, and makes pasta from buckwheat flour, Fatoumata M.'s specialty. In order to meet their customers' needs, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso; they are asking for their first loan together. Fatoumata M. has made wholewheat spaghetti with the help of a manual machine for five years. She plans on using this loan to buy 25 kg of flour, 2 kg of salt, and other ingredients. To make spaghetti each day, she kneads 4 kg of flour until it forms a smooth, homogeneous paste. With her machine, she transforms this paste into spaghetti of varying thickness which she dries on cotton canvas mats. The pasta is protected by a light, white fabric for sanitary purposes. The spaghetti is measured with a ladle, bagged, and sent to restaurants. Fatoumata receives many orders, especially during social events. She stocks up weekly on ingredients at the grand market in Ségou and sells her product from her home and at the market. Her customers are both men and women. She plans on making a monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan and meet her family's small needs.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of buckwheat flour

loans.name: Mujeres De Hoy Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en el negocio de Marisol S. M., una integrante del grupo Mujeres de Hoy, que está ubicado en la comunidad de San Pablo Huantepec, Municipio de Jilotepec  en el Estado de México, en México.  Se ve el puesto de la nieve y las integrantes del grupo en la foto.   Ella se dedica a la venta de nieves naturales, negocio que inició hace un año. Solicita el préstamo para comprar botes y la materia prima necesaria para la preparación de su producto, explica que actualmente tiene poco material y por ello sus sabores son limitados, con este crédito ella espera diversificar su producto para atraer más clientes y contar con los recipientes necesarios para mantenerlo. Sus clientes son prácticamente los viajeros pues ella instala su puesto en la orilla de las carreteras y constantemente cambia de lugar en busca de puntos estratégicos para mejorar sus ventas. 
La señora María de los Santos M. S. es madre de Marisol, trabajaron juntas durante 3 años en la elaboración de nieve, lo cual les sirvió como experiencia para poner su propio negocio como lo hizo ya su hija, ahora ella también desea iniciar su negocio por su cuenta pues como ya sus hijos hicieron su vida independiente, piensa que tal vez en el futuro no puedan ayudarla económicamente y que mejor que tener su propio negocito para ahorrar y tener un patrimonio que llegada una edad en que ya no pueda trabajar, le permita junto con su esposo vivir dignamente. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo ella se siente entusiasmada porque desea ser autosuficiente por muchos años más y considera que este proyecto se lo permitirá.  Tiene 46 años, estudió hasta el sexto año primaria, es casada y tiene en total 4 hijos, 3 mujeres y un varón.  Quiere este crédito para comprar botes para la nieve, hieleras, vasos, palas, cucharas y la materia prima para echar andar su negocio.   También espera hacerlo crecer poco a poco con las ganancias e ir ahorrando para un mejor futuro. 

Maricela S. M. es la presidente del grupo. Tiene 22 años, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria, es casada y tiene 2 hijas de 3 años de edad.  Ella tiene una pizzería que inició hace un año. Solicita el préstamo para comprar un cancel para su negocio y poder mantener la higiene de su local. Ella quiere dar a sus hijas la oportunidad de estudiar más.

El grupo está conformado por  12 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicita  un crédito a CrediComún.  Los otros integrantes son:

-	Sandra Saray Pérez H. (Venta de zapato por catalogo)
-	Rosa Ana C. García (Venta de colchas por catalogo)
-	Lesli L. C. (Venta de lencería por catalogo)
-	Margarita García Zúñiga (Venta de Omnilife)
-	Erika Anell Martínez C. (Venta de Ropa)
-	Ernestina Pérez B. (Venta de Tortillas)
-	Ramona M. V. (Tienda de abarrotes)
-	Aurelia R. Domínguez (Tienda de abarrotes)
-	Fany Vianey C. M. (Venta de Tortillas)
texts.en:
This photograph was taken at the business of Marisol S. M., a member of the group “Mujeres de Hoy” (Women of Today). This group is from the community of San Pablo Huantepec in the town of Jilotepec, State of Mexico, in Mexico. The members of the group are photographed at Marisol’s snow cone stand. She started her natural snow cone business a year ago. Marisol is requesting a loan to buy containers and ingredients that are needed to make her product. She says that she currently has a limited supply of materials; therefore she only offers a few flavors. With this loan she hopes to diversify her product and attract more customers. However, she needs these items to maintain her business. Her customers consist of travelers, which explains why her stand is located on the side of the road and constantly changes location since she looks for strategic areas where she can improve her sales.

Sra. María de los Santos M. S. is Marisol’s mother. They have been working together making snow cones for three years. Just like her daughter, María started her working so that she could gain experience. She now wants to start her own business and live independently because she believes there may come a time in the future when her children won’t be able to support her financially. María thought it would be best to have her own small business so that she could save and build up some assets for when she is not able to work so that she and her husband can continue to live decently. Upon applying for this loan, María was very excited because she wants to be self-sufficient for many years to come and believes this project will help her do that. She is 46 years old, married, and has four children (three daughters and a son). María has a sixth grade education. She will use her loan to buy snow cone cups, ice chests, glasses, scoops, spoons, and raw materials needed to start her business. She expects to generate income gradually so that she can save for a better future.

Maricela S. M. is the group president. She is 22 years old, married, and has two daughters who are both 3 years old. Maricela completed her education through the third year of high school. She started a pizzeria a year ago. Maricela is requesting a loan to buy a screened door for her business so that her shop stays clean. She wants to provide her children with the opportunity to study.

The group consists of 12 members. This is the first time they have requested a loan from CrediComún. The other members are as follows:

- Sandra Saray Pérez H. (sells shoes through a catalog) - Rosa Ana C. García (sells bedspeads through a catalog) - Lesli L. C. (sells lingerie through a catalog) - Margarita García Zúñiga (sells Omni Life products) - Erika Anell Martínez C. (sells clothing) - Ernestina Pérez B. (sells tortillas) - Ramona M. V. (manages a grocery store) - Aurelia R. Domínguez (manages a grocery store) - Fany Vianey C. M. (sells tortillas)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making snow cones

location.town: San Pablo Huantepec, Municipio de Jilotepec, Edo d

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en: Tinh T. N. is 34 years old and married with two young children. She is a farmer, and also makes tofu to sell in her village. She has been in this business for many years. Tinh T. N. has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. She has participated in Kiva partner, SEDA, since 2003 and repaid her loans punctually. For this loan, she wants to borrow 8,066,000 VND to buy beans to make tofu.

loans.use: To buy beans to make tofu

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel C. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 21 years old and single. To make a living, Russel sells pillows and blankets in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year.

In 2010, Russel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Mahmadburkhon

texts.en:
Since he was very young, Mahmadburkhon has worked in farming. By way of this work, he succeeds in supporting his family, providing his little boy with the education he deserves. He is applying to IMON International for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops. Mahmadburkhon hopes that he will be given a loan so that he will succeed in his business and improve his standard of living.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr:
C'est une femme qui est célibataire, mère de 3enfants, le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 16ans.Avec son niveau sécondaire, elle s'est lancé dans le commerce du poison salé depuis 1997 avec 100000f de capital.Très stricte dans sa gestion et dans le choix de sa marchandise.
Agée de 38ans, elle veut s'affirmer dans la vente du poisson salé et faire la vente en gros.par jour ,elle vend 35000f et plus quand les vente sont meilleurs.
Si elle a le prêt, elle va achéter 3cartons de poisson sole, 2cartons de poisson thon, 2cartons de poisson morue, 1 sac des champignons et un panier des crévêttes.
Agrandir son activité est son soucis mageur,elle veut aussi avoir les avantages que offrent votre institution  à travers les enseignements reçuent.
pour ses enfants, elle veut assurer leurs avenir et les donnés une bonne éducation scolaire.
D'après son entourage, c' est une bonne femme.
texts.en:
Germaine D. is an unmarried woman and the mother of three children. The oldest is 20 and the youngest is 16 years old. Educated at the high school level, she began selling salted fish in 1997 with a capital sum of 100,000 f. She is very meticulous in her management and in the choice of her merchandise. Age 38, she wants to establish herself as a seller of salted fish and to become a wholesale retailer. Her sales gross 35,000 f per day and more when sales are better. If she gets the loan, she will buy 3 cases of sole, 2 cases of tuna, 2 cases of cod, 1 bag of mushrooms and a basket of shrimp. Her main concern is to expand her business. She also wants to have the advantages that this institution offers through its successful teaching. She wants to ensure the future of her children and to give them a good education. According to her family circle, she is a good woman.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her sales by purchasing  2 cases of tuna, 2 cases of sole, 2 cases of cod, 1 bag of dried mushrooms and 1 basket of shrimp.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Antonia es cliente nueva, vive en casa familiar con su esposo y sus pequeño hijito, la actividad a la que ella se dedica es la D. venta D. comida el plaza German Busch, paralelamente a esta tambien se dedica a la elaboracion D. mantillas D. polar, se ha podido apreciar que es una mujer decidida y con ganas D. superacion. La inversion del prestamo es para la compra D. insumos como ser Papa. fideo, arroz. aceite, carne, etc. para la elaboracion D. sus comidas, tambien comprara tela polar por mayor para la confeccion D. mantillas, D. esta forma la ganancia D. esta actividad sera mayor. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Antonia is a new client, she lives in the family home with her husband and her young son. She sells food at the Plaza German Busch for a living and she also makes polar mantillas. It is obvious that she is a dedicated lady who wants to improve herself. The loan will be invested in buying supplies such as potato, fideo, cooking oil, meat, etc. to prepare her meals as well as polar cloth to make the mantillas so profits will improve. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence when granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 63 years old. She is a widowed mother of three children between the ages of 37 and 41. She has been farming for the last 10 years in Litein town, Rift Valley, Kenya. Her farm produces beans, maize, vegetables and milk, which she sells to the local market. She has employed two people from her community to help with the farm work.

Zipporah recently completed her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) and has requested this loan of 50,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. She says that this loan will increase the income of the family and they will also be able to acquire another asset that will be used as security to apply for more loans in future.

Her biggest challenge has been lack of enough land to graze and a lack of knowledge on animal husbandry. She hopes, however, to improve her dairy farming to a more productive business by buying good quality dairy cows.

She is grateful to Juhudi for their constant support and will request more loans once she has completed this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Marichel

texts.en:
Marichel T. is from the village of Brgy. Aggub, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 29 years old. Marichel is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marichel owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Marichel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marichel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marichel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Agate

texts.en:
Agate K. is currently in the business of selling dresses, trousers and bedsheets at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more pairs of trousers and some shoes and women's head dresses. 

Agate is 31 years old and is married to a man who works as a driver. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

loans.use: Stock more pairs of trousers and some shoes and women's head dresses

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela L. is 40 years old. She is married with five children who are between the ages of nine and twenty. Four of the children are currently attending school. Pamela has been farming for the last twenty years in Kitale town, western Kenya. Her mixed farm produces maize, beans, bananas and milk which she sells locally. She also earns income from her salon in the same location.

Pamela recently repaid a previous loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 61,200 KES to start a poultry project and purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of the family in terms of education and health. Her primary challenges are poor prices for her products and the lack of a proper market. However, she hopes to acquire five more dairy cows and maintain a poultry farm in the future.

Pamela comments that Juhudi should diversify their products to provide school fees loans as well.

loans.use: To start a poultry project and purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ana Daisy

texts.es:
Doña Ana tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto con su esposo y su madre, ya los hijos de doña Ana formaron sus propios hogares, Ella se dedica  a la venta de comida y pupusas y reside en el Departamento de Usulután, posee este negocio desde hace 15 años y los ingresos recibidos de esta venta son los que desde hace años solventan sus gastos, lo atiende de Domingo a Viernes y en ocasiones una de sus hijas le ayuda.
