Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en mercadería y así impulsar un poco más el negocio, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar la atención y servicio a los clientes ya que contara con los productos necesarios para la preparación de alimentos como Arroz, pollo, Azúcar, Verduras, Carne entre otros que le son necesarios para abastecer la demanda.
Su objetivo principal es cancelar las cuotas de este préstamo, aumentar el número de clientes y complacer sus necesidades; Mejorar las condiciones e ingresos de la familia.
texts.en:
Doña Ana is 55 years old and lives with her husband and mother in the Department of Usulután.  Her children have already established their own households.  Ana sells food and pupusas from a business that she has managed for 15 years.  The income she receives from her sales is used to cover her expenses.  Ana manages her business Sunday through Friday and on occasion she receives help from one of her daughters.

The loan she is requesting will be used to invest in supplies so that she can acquire some more business.  With the proceeds, Ana will be able to provide better service to her customers since she will have the necessary products for preparing her dishes such as rice, chicken, sugar, vegetables, meat, and other items.  This will allow her to keep up with demand.

Her main goal is to complete each of her loan payments, increase her customer base and be able to meet their needs, improve her living conditions, and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing her dishes

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrud M. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala East region of Uganda.  She is single and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  She has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for 5 years.  She also does outside catering.  

To help expand her business, Getrud has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes and Stork food for the catering. (Stork Food Systems, poultry processing)  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Getrud hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees and buy food for her children.  In the future, Getrud hopes to expand more in the two businesses. 

Getrud is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her job skills like hair dressing.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell and Stork foods for catering

loans.name: Y. Clémence

texts.fr: A. Z. Y. Clémence est née le 21 Mars 1982 à Adjarra, dans le département de l’Ouéme. Mariée à ALI-KPARAH Ibrahim Clément un commerçant, Clémence est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Clémence est allée à l'école et s'est arrêté à l'université. La famille vit depuis quatre (04) ans à Habitat, l’un des quartiers de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Clémence vend depuis cinq (05) ans environs des mèches et des produits de beauté dans l'un des quartiers de Cotonou. Clémence s’approvisionne à Dantokpa le marché internationale du Bénin et au marché de Lomé, capitale politique du Togo. C’est pour augmenter le niveau de stock de mèches, des produits de beauté et pour renforcer son activité que Clémence sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Z. Y. Clémence was born on March 21, 1982 in Adjarra, in Ouéme county.  Married to Mr. ALI-KPARAH Ibrahim Clément, a merchant, she is married and the mother of one child, who is in school. Clémence went to school and stopped going at the university level.  The family has been living for four years in Habitat, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  The couple jointly ensure that their family expenses are covered.

Clémence has been selling hair extensions and beauty products for about five years in one of the district of Cotonou.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and at the market in Lomé, the capital of Togo.  To increase her inventory of hair extensions and beauty products and to bolster her business, Clémence is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the first time.

loans.use: Buying hair extensions and beauty products

loans.name: Phai's Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people are forming a village loA.. Mrs. Phai M., 56, was selected as the village bank president by its members. They are living in Veal Thum village in Kandal province. The members of this village will use the loA. for different purposes. 

Mrs. Phai M. is a tailor at home who is able to earn good profits to support the family. Mrs. Phai M. is a widow and works hard to support her child, a student in the university, but she does not have enough money to pay for the school's fees. Thus, she would like to ask for a loA. to add to her savings so she cA. pay for her child's school fees.

loans.use: To add to her savings to pay for her child's school fees.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. is from the village of Tambagan, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Cecilia is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Cecilia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cecilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Cecilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy  A. is a widow  who lives in Putting Bato, Washington, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a sari-sari (general) store  business. She has 3 children who are 15 to 24 years old. 

Lucy  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lucy  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500 which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and cover their daily needs. Lucy  A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fans, blenders, sheets and drugstore goods

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita P. is from the village of Plaridel. She is 58 years old. Rosita is widowed and has ten adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Sadurdin

texts.ru: Сайфудинов Садурдин проживает в районе Муминобод. Ему 57 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сын работает в телестудии города Куляб. Сам Садурдин имеет высшее образование, агроном. Работает по профессии. Кроме того в свободное от работы время занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот у себя дома. В этой области более 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Sadurdin S. lives in the Muminobod Region.  He is 57 years old. Married, with five children. His wife is a homemaker. His son works at the TV studio of the city of Kuliab. Sadurdin has a college degree; he is an agronomist. He works in his profession. IN addition, in his spare time he raises livestock. He raises cattle at his home. He has been doing this for over 10 years. He is taking out a loan in order to purchases cattle.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah M. is 22 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, neither of whom are currently in school. Norah has a salon business, which she has run for six years. She also has a second business selling fruits and vegetables.
To help expand her businesses, Norah has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hair braids and more fruits and vegetables for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Norah hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to own a boutique.
Norah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money and deal with people in the community.

loans.use: To purchase hair braids and more fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
"Fortaleza" es un comité  que está  en el tercer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres de la Fundacion Paraguaya, cuenta con 18 integrantes.
La Sra. Elisa N. posee un pequeño puesto de venta de frutas al costado de la ruta  de San Lorenzo, ella va al mercado de abasto a comprar las frutas. Ella vende además jugos naturales y tiene clientela formada.
Con el ingreso que ella obtiene día a día ayuda a su marido, pero desea poder progresar y prosperar.
Es un comité donde las integrantes tienen  muchas ganas de superarse.
texts.en:
“Fortitude” is a committee that is in their third loan cycle with the women’s committee program of the Fundacion Paraguaya, they have 18 members.

Mrs. Elisa N. has a small fruit stall next to the San Lorenzo road; she goes to the supply market to buy her fruits. She also sells natural fruit juices and has a steady customer base.

With the earnings that Mrs. Elisa N. has each day she helps her husband but she wishes to progress and thrive.

This is a committee where the members are very enthusiastic about getting ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy fruits like oranges, pineapples, melon, apples, pears, etc.

loans.name: Erni

texts.en:
Erni is a 27-year-old woman who lives in Oebufu village and is married to Alex, a 30 year old man.  They have three children:  5 year-old Indi, who is in kindergarten, and Inda and Intan, who are 4 and 3 years old.  

Emi, a woman who diligently attends family worship services, runs a billiard business. She purchased a secondhand billiard table and leases it to those who love to play this kind of sport. She has been running the billiard business for about three years. The condition of the billiard cloth is currently not good – it is scratched and it has an impact on her income. The income from her billiard business is currently between IDR 20,000 - 30,000 per day.  Her husband's income from the motor-taxi business is unstable. 

Erni also farms vegetables. The farm is situated close to her house. She grows vegetables in a small quantity as she only had a little money to buy seeds and fertilizer. When she heard about TLM Lending Programs, she thought about improving the farm with various vegetable seeds and sufficient fertilizer. She also plans to improve her billiard business by replacing the scratched billiard cloth. She is requesting a loan amounting of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. She really hopes that the loan will help increase her income from her vegetables and billiard business.

loans.use: To buy billiard cloth for re-upholstery, and seeds for farming

loans.name: Jose Baldelomar

texts.es: José tiene 53 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras. José tiene que levantarse temprano todos los días para traer sus cosechas y llevarlas a ofrecer al mercado, el es un hombre muy responsable por lo que disfruta de tener este medio de vida. Este no es el primer financiamiento que realiza por lo que se encuentra  muy contento con esta oportunidad. Son más de 26 años, de tener en este medio de vida, por lo que ha luchado por mantenerse en esta actividad.  Este crédito es para la compra de naranjas, aguacates, sandias, mangos y buscar el medio de transporte para ofrecer sus frutas.
texts.en:
Jose is 53 years old. He sells fruits and vegetables. He has to get up early every day to collect the produce and take them to the market. Jose is a very responsible man who enjoys his way of life.

This is not his first loan and he is very happy to be given this opportunity. He has had this kind of work for more than 26 years putting a lot of time and effort into maintaining it. The loan will be used to buy oranges, avocados, melons, mangos and to find transportation to deliver the fruits.

loans.use: to buy oranges, avocados, mangos y to find transportation for the fruits.

loans.name: Ángel Santos

texts.es:
Ángel Santos R. M. tiene 36 años, es soltero vive con un  hijo  de 15 años, en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  LA SOLEDAD se encuentra ubicada en el recinto EL TAMBO  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao, arroz, maíz, yuca y además cría aves como gallina y patos.

Ángel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, arroz, maíz, yuca y naranja los productos las compras en Chillanes y en El Tambo y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para dejar de herencia a los hijos.

Le gusta salir con el hijo hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Ángel Santos R. M. is 36 years old.  He is single and lives with his son, who is 15 years old, in Chillanes canton in Bolívar province.

The members of the La Soledad communal bank are located in Recinto El Tambo in Chillanes canton.  This communal bank has 12 members who work in agriculture growing cacao, rice, corn, and yucca.  They also raise birds such as chickens and ducks.

Ángel farms, growing cacao, rice, corn, yucca, and oranges.  He buys his products in Chillanes and El Tambo, and he sells his products at the fair on Sundays in Chillanes.

He is asking for the loan in order to buy supplies for his crops as well as fertilizers.  The loan will help him economically to supply his necessities and to face challenges such as infestations, illnesses, and variations in climate.  His dream is to buy land in order to leave his children an inheritance.

He likes to go out with his son to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his crops as well as fertilizers

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members. Mrs. Pov, a married woman who was born in 1971, is a group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the other members of the group.

Mrs. Pov is a farmer who owns a 1.50 hectare plot of land which she uses to grow rice for a living. Her husband, who was born in 1975, is a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to help support his family. He also helps his wife with farming. With her husband fishing, Mrs. Pov would like to ask for a loan to buy a fishing boat for her husband. 

This couple has three children; two are attending the local school and the youngest one is a year old.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Teciana

texts.en:
Teciana S. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 56 years old. Teciana is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Teciana owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Teciana has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 22,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teciana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Teciana is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Teciana from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha  lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala in Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, 3 of whom are in school. 

Aisha has a poultry farm.  She has been in this business for over 10 years and works 7 days out of every week.  She sells her products at the market  by means of retail.   She also earns additional income through brick laying and room renting.

Aisha has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy chicken feed. The main business challenges for Aisha include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van, to improve on her standards of living, and to educate her children up to university.   

Aisha lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed

loans.name: Kokou Mathias

texts.fr: Revendeur de céréales (mais, haricot) depuis 2004, Mr Kokou à 34ans, et père de 02 enfants. Sa femme est revendeuse. Il sèche les céréales au soleil pour éviter que ça pourrisse et après les conserve dans les bidons et les vend à toutes personnes. Il est à son 3éme prêt et ce montant lui servira à acheter des céréales et des fagots de bois qu’il achète à SOKODE une ville du pays et revend à son domicile.
texts.en: Having sold cereals (maize and beans) since 2004, Mr. Kokou is 34 and the father of two children. His wife also buys and sells small items. He dries the cereals in the sun to prevent their going bad. Afterwards he preserves them in jerrycans and sells them to all comers. He is on his third loan and this sum will allow him to buy cereals and bundles of wood, which he buys at SOKODE, a town in his area, and resells out of his home.

loans.use: to buy cereals and a bundle of wood.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en: Marcelo is 52 years old and is married to an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). They are blessed with 2 children. He has been engaged in a livestock business raising hogs for almost 10 years.   His net income is 12,000 PHP every three months.   He is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional feed for his hogs. He hopes that KIVA lenders will continue to assist him in the business so that he can further improve it and support his family with enough basic necessities.

loans.use: purchase feed for his hogs

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés tiene 52 años, esta casado con felicitas de 46 años, fruto de esta relación tienen dos hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Andrés se caracteriza por ser un hombre agricultor y muy cumplido al momento de comprometerse con los clientes, ganándose la confianza de ellos. Es así que siempre cuida de las plantaciones de cacao, ya que ha visto que el negocio de este fruto es muy rentable. Sin embargo hace años incursionó en la venta de productos de primera necesidad, por lo que eso significaba un mayor ingreso económico para su familia. Al principio eran pocas sus ventas, pero con el año supo posesionarse muy bien en el mercado de su localidad, y esto es gracias al precio justo y el buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que Andrés se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Andrés  esta contento  por formar parte de su banco comunal. Con los 3.000 nuevos soles desea comprar más mercadería para implementar su tienda.
texts.en: Andres is 52 years old and he is married to Felicitas, who is 46 years old. Their two children are the fruit of their relationship. They live together in a house located in the community of Canayre of the district of Llochegua. Andres is a known agriculturist and he is very committed to the agreements he has with his clients, thereby earning their trust. He is always in charge of his cocoa plantation, especially because he has seen that the product is very profitable. A few years ago he started out selling essential products and it yielded a better income for his family. At the start his sales were low but throughout the years he has known to set himself up very well in his community market by offering fair prices and through good customer service. This is the second loan he has with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and Andres is committed to be on time with his loan payments. Andres is happy to be part of his communal bank. With the 3000 nuevos soles he wants to purchase merchandise to supply his store.

loans.use: to purchase products to supply his store.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Mujeres Emprendedoras es de la ciudad de Asunción, actualmente esta formado por 20 miembros. Todas ellas están unidas por un objetivo común, que es el de poder generar más ingresos, para que de esa forma puedan vivir dignamente y sin carencias.
El comité es conocido en el barrio pues sus miembros trabajan activamente, siempre en un marco de respeto y cooperación.
La Sra Maria es modista desde hace ya varios años, por eso es muy conocida en el barrio. Tiene mucha demanda ya que sus trabajos son muy buenos. Cometa que todo el esfuerzo que hace es con miras a brindarle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida sin carencias.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos y kits de agujas para la utilización dentro de su taller de costura.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Enterprising Women) Communal Bank is in the city of Asunción.  It is currently comprised of 20 members.  They are all united for one common cause, which is to be able to generate more income.  That way they will be able to live decently and without deprivations.

The bank is known in the neighborhood by its members who actively work with mutual respect and cooperation.

Maria has been a dressmaker for several years, and she is therefore well known in the neighborhood.  There is a lot of demand in her business because her work is very good.  She says that all of her efforts are done with the vision of giving her family a better lifestyle without deprivations.

She is requesting the loan to buy fabric, thread, and needle kits to use in her seamstress shop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and kits of needles.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is a 27-year-old single lady who sells used clothes in Gongoni Market in Malindi. This lady has been in this business for the past two years now and earns a monthly income of about Kshs.7,000/= which she uses to look after herself as well as using some of it to run her business. 

Lydiah has been loaned Kshs.30,000/= by Kadet Limited and this serves as her first loan from the company. She intends to use her loan to purchase additional stock of used clothes for her business with the aim of expanding it due to the rise in her clientele in the region. The client wishes to use some of her anticipated profit to continue running her business as well as continue saving a portion of it so as she will be able to run her own boutique.

loans.use: to buy additional used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Magret

texts.en: Margret is 39 years old. She has six children, all of whom are in school. She is a widow. She has been running this business for three years. Margret took a loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more onions and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en: Otgonjargal is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband is self-employed, her eldest son attends high school, and her daughter attends kindergarten. She was first employed as a hair washer at Margad beauty salon in 2009 and worked there for one year. In 2010, she upgraded her skills and became a hairdresser and stylist at Iher Saran beauty salon. She is a diligent and hardworking woman who says, "With this loan, I want to buy supply materials for my work because the number of customers will increase when the new school year starts." She is requesting a 600,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase beauty supply materials for work.

loans.use: To purchase beauty supply materials.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Sreng (in the photo) is a weaver. Her husband, Lorn, sells recycling materials. They have been married since 2005 and have two young children: one son and one daughter. The family is living on an Island in Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sreng is asking for a loan of $800 to pay school fees for her sister and to buy a motorbike for her sister to drive to school. Sreng’s sister just finished her baccalaureate degree. She wants to continue her study at the university in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her sister and buy a motorbike for her sister to drive to school.

loans.name: Jurial

texts.en:
Jurial is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 

Jurial is providing motorela or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for maintenance.

Jurial has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jurial hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Marziya

texts.ru: Marziya 45 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Marziya uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuric. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione , posolok Akhmedbeyli vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Marziya seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami. Eto pervaya ssuda Marziyi.
texts.en: Marziya is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She has been in the poultry business raising chickens for the past 9 years. As an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) she was resettled from the city of Fuzuli to the town of Akhmedbeyli in the Fuzuli region, where she now lives with her family. Marziya is in need of 2000 AZN to buy chickens. It is a business she started with her mother. This is Marziya's first loan.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Pseudomyclian

texts.en:
Pseudomyclian is 23 years old and single with no children. Pseudomyclian owns and operates a business baking and selling biscuits in the local community. She has one year of experience in this business. Pseudomyclian needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase an oven, sacks of flour, sacks of sugar and baking powder. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve her business.

In 2011, Pseudomyclian joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Pseudomyclian's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase an oven, sacks of flour, sacks of sugar and baking powder.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 42 years old and is married to Salome who is a farmer. Together they have five children ages 15,13,11, ten and four. He is a farmer besides being a carpenter. He has been in the business for the past 17 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 33,100 from the business.

This is his third loan term from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to purchase another dairy cattle.

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business by buying more cattle. His dream is to become a successful farmer.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Blanca Berta

texts.es:
Blanca, esta nuevamente solicitando préstamo, esto se debe a la necesidad D. fortalecer el negocio, por el momento comprara, materiales para la elaboración D. recuerdos para eventos sociales, como tazas, plásticos,  papel, tela, pega y demás cosas que son parte del proceso para este trabajo. Estos préstamos le han ayudado a Blanca para fortalecer el negocio, dándole una mayor seguridad en la atención al cliente.
Su condición familiar ha sido más favorable y espera continuar D. esta manera para crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca is asking for another loan, due to the necessity of building up the business.

Right now she will buy materials needed to make keepsakes for social events, such as cups, plastics, paper, fabric, glue and other items used in the process of this work. 

These loans have helped Blanca strengthen the business, enabling her to give better care in the service to her customers. Her family status has been more favorable and she hopes to continue in this way to grow the business.

loans.use: to buy cups, plastics, paper, fabric, and glue

loans.name: Irshaad

texts.en:
Irshaad is 57 years old and married.  Her husband operates a dairy business and has some buffaloes for that purpose. He takes their milk and sells to his community clients every day.  His business is going well and due to good quality milk, its demand is increasing day by day.

Irshaad has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to support her husband.  With the loan investment, he will buy another buffalo that will allow him to fulfill the milk requirement of his clients and increase his sales and profits.

He has operated his business for many years and is very hopeful that an investment will help him earning more profits.

Irshaad is a housewife, but in her spare time she provides full support to her husband, by milking the buffaloes and keeping their place clean.

She is also a mother of one son who is unmarried.  He too supports his father's business.

Irshaad is confident about her family's bright financial future.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milk selling business.

loans.name: Gawa

texts.en:
Gawa is 26-year-old a married woman with three children between the age of 6 year to 2 years. One of them is in school. She has had a hair dressing business in her salon in Kator, South Sudan for two years.

Gawa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase weaves and hair lotions. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase weave and hair lotions for sale.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en: Alberto, a 40-year-old widower, lives in the Philippines where he has operated a shop that sells green bananas and coconut for copra for the last 10 years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, Alberto is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more bananas and coconuts to sell. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Lotuafiafi

texts.en:
Lotuafiafi is 39 years of age and is married with 3 children. She owns & operates a business venture, selling ice cake.  She has many years of experience in this business. She needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Lotuafiafi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Lotuafiafi's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Maria Lida

texts.es: La señora Maria Lida a sus 36 años de edad se dedica a prestar servicios de belleza desde hace 14 años. En el año 2009 inicio en el municipio de Marinilla localizado al oriente de Antioquia su propia sala de belleza adecuada en la sala de su casa y con la cual puede generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar, sus dos hijos y sus padres. Con el ánimo de prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, la señora Maria Lida necesita de la compra de productos tales como shampoo, crema para peinar el cabello y tinturas que le faciliten su trabajo y pueda seguir generando los ingresos para su familia y a futuro cumplir su sueño de tener su propio local de belleza en un centro comercial de la ciudad de Medellín.
texts.en: Maria Lida, thirty-six, has been providing beauty services for fourteen years. She started out in 2009 in the town of Marinilla, on the east side of the department of Antioquia. Her salon is located in her house and it allows her to make the money she needs to support her household, two children and parents. In order to better serve her clients and increase income, Maria Lida needs to buy products including shampoo, styling cream, and hair colors. This will facilitate her work and let her keep making money for the family and realize her future dream of having her own beauty salon in a shopping center in the city of Medellín.

loans.use: to buy products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Fast Move Group

texts.en:
Irene is 48 years old. She is a widow with five children aged 28, 25, 18, 15 and 10 years. Two of the children are going to school. She also has two other dependents, her uncle's children, whom she stays with. 

She is into the business of poultry in Masvingo town. She has been in business for seven years. Irene has requested a loan of $250 to buy chicks and feed.

With the income from this loan she will be able to provide for her family and other community members. The challenge being faced in the business is that due to a heat wave some of the chicks died resulting in a loss. In the next five years she would like to have a bigger space to rear her chickens and a poultry shop to sell from.

loans.use: to buy stock feed, chicks, and medicines

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is married and has four children. She is 41 years old, and resides in Tabid, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Alma owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting bananas which she sells to earn a living. She's been in this business for seven years and makes PHP 2,000 a month from it. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2010, Alma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Alma wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 34 years old, married with one child. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. Since she joined  Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy potatoes, beans, bananas and maize to sell.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, beans, bananas, tomatoes and maize to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
This is Pedro, 47, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. Single, he manages his own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Pedro operates a salon business. He offers hair styling, hair grooming, manicures and pedicures, and the like. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 21,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies for his salon, like shampoo, hair treatment creams and oils, and other things needed for his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Pedro dreams to expand his business and hopes to have a house in Manila through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for her salon, like shampoo, hair treatment creams and oils, and other things needed for her business.

loans.name: Houenoussou 2 Group

texts.fr: HOUENOUSSOU 2 est un groupement de treize personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans un même quartier et mènent des activités complémentaires. La représentante du groupe, Victoire (qui a la main levée sur la photo), est mariée à un certain Isidore. Victoire est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés dont deux restent à leur charge. Victoire vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour y parvenir, Victoire vend depuis plusieurs années, des ustensiles de cuisine et divers produits par le système de distribution. Victoire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Victoire sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe HOUENOUSSOU 2 un troisième financement auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Houenoussou 2 is a group made up of thirteen people, all of whom live together in the same neighbourhood and run complementary businesses.  The representative of the group, Victoire (with her hand raised in the photo) is married to a man named Isidore.  Victoire is 34 years old, and lives in Bénin.  The couple has four children, all of whom are in school and two remain dependents.  Victoire lives together with her husband and children.  The couple both work to provide for the various family expenses together.

To this end, Victoire has for a long time been selling kitchen utensils as well as other products through a distribution system.  Victoire buys her stock at a market in Bénin.  With the goal being to reinforce her business and to satisfy the demands of her clientele, Victoire, along with the other members of the Houenoussou 2 Group, is asking for a third loan via ALIDé.  The previous loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and other products.

loans.name: Las Magníficas De Franz Tamayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS MAGNÍFICAS DE FRANZ TAMAYO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ricardina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: confección de polleras, confección de deportivos, venta de polleras, venta de chompas, venta de ropa, venta de material de construcción, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ricardina es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de mantas de vicuña y de alpaca; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió cuando trabajaba de operaria en un taller, hace cinco años decide emprender su propio espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de hilo de alpaca y vicuña) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a solicitud del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta ahorro que se tiene en la institución.

loans.use: Compra de hilo de alpaca y vicuña

loans.name: Saul

texts.en:
My Name is Saul G. Martinez. I have 2 years making brooms and mops and cleaning items. I sell them in houses and offices here in Nuevo Laredo. The income that I make is the only source for my family support. Saul is asking for a loan of $900. With this money he plans to increase the product line and fix his pick-up truck. It’s very important to remember that in this season his products have more demand.

Español

Mi nombre es Saúl García Martínez, tengo 2 años elaborando escobas y trapeadores para venderlos en casas y oficinas aquí en Nuevo Laredo, lo que gano en esta actividad es la principal fuente de sustento familiar. Estoy Solicitando un préstamo de $900.00 para incrementar la línea de productos y arreglar mi camioneta. Es importante mencionar que en estas fechas los productos tienen mayor demanda.

loans.use: more products

loans.name: Teyyub

texts.en:
Teyyub is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Lachin  region, settled in the Absheron region. He is married and has a child.
11 years ago he decided to start this business.
Having borrowed $400, he bought 6 sheep.
The second time he borrowed $800 to build a stable.
Now he requests a loan of $1200 to build a butcher shop.

loans.use: To build a butcher shop

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a carpenter like generations of his family before him. He is married and has four children. He used to work in his father's shop, but decided to set up a workshop of his own. He is very experienced and is known for his high-quality work which is much in demand. Right now he has orders that he cannot fill because he doesn't have the materials so he is asking for a loan of $250 which he proposes to repay in 3-6 months. With your help Mario can continue working to grow his business and tend to his family. They much appreciate your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Mario se dedica a la carpintería, este oficio ha permanecido generación tras generación en su familia, él es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, trabajaba en el taller de su padre, pero decidió independizarse e iniciar su propio negocio, la experiencia que tiene en este oficio ha permitido que los muebles que fabrica sean de muy buena calidad y muy aceptados por sus clientes, así es como se ha dado a conocer y ha ganando mucha clientela.

En este momento Mario tiene pedidos que no ha podido realizar por falta de material, por lo que solicita un préstamo por $250 dólares, que ofrece devolver en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Mario podrá seguir trabajando, tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio y a mejorar la vida de su familia, ellos agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
MARIA ELENA IS 30 YEARS OLD AND HAS 3 CHILDREN. HER SPOUSE WORKS AS AN AUTOMOTIVE MECHANIC. SHE SELLS KNITTED BEDDING ITEMS AND SHE PLANS TO APLLY THE LOAN AMOUNT TO PURCHASE SHEETS, BLANKETS, BEDSPREADS AND COMFORTERS, SO THAT SHE CAN SELL THEM AT THE LOCAL MARKET. SHE BELONGS TO GROUP JOVEL 3.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA ELENA TIENE 30 AÑOS , TIENE 3 HIJOS Y SU PAREJA TRABAJA COMO MECANICO EN UN TALLER DE REPARACION DE AUTOMOVILES ELLA VENDE ROPA DE CAMA BORDADA Y ESPERA CON EL PRESTAMO INVERTIR EN COMPRAR COLCHAS , CUBRECAMAS Y SABANAS PARA PODER SALIR A VENDER TAMBIEN EN EL MERCADO DEL PUEBLO.ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO JOVEL 3

loans.use: VENTA  ROPA DE CAMA

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Sony got married in 1984 and has 5 children: a son and 4 daughters. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production business in 1992. Her eldest daughter assists her with weaving at home when she has spare time after school. Her husband is a building construction worker.

Mrs S. has taken out 5 loans from MAXIMA in the past. She is now requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk material and sewing thread and pay for selecting and building one more loom for her eldest daughter.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and embroidering, building one more loom for her daughter.

loans.name: Maritza Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, a mother is selfless and dedicated to her work selling food and raising guinea pigs to ensure that her children do not go through the hardships that she had as a child. She helps her husband provide for the welfare of their family since he earns a small fixed income. For this reason, Rosa decided to dedicate herself to developing her art of food preparation (cooking) as a source of income for her family, and so far has been able to manage it, despite its enormous dedication. Increasingly their needs are greater and there are few opportunities to grow their business and strive to see the day that this family can finish building their house in order to live comfortably. For this reason, Rosa asks the amount of $100 USD, which will be used to acquire a sales post, so she can stop paying rent, while they finish construction of their little house. We are counting on your help so that Rosa may have an opportunity to realize the yearnings of her heart.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer

Rosa, es una madre abnegada y dedicada a su trabajo de venta de comida y crianza de cuyes con el fin de que sus hijos no pasen las privaciones que ella tuvo de niña y hoy sirve de apoyo a su esposo para juntos otorgarle bienestar a su familia, quien cuenta con un sueldo fijo gracias a su trabajo en el consejo de su localidad; sin embargo dicho ingreso no abastece los egresos diarios de sus miembros.Debido a este requerimiento decidió dedicarse a desarrollar su arte por la comida como una fuente de ingreso para su hogar y hasta hoy ha podido administrarlo y pese a su enorme dedicación cada vez sus necesidades se hacen mayores y son pocas las oportunidades de crecer y poder llegar al día en que esta familia pueda terminar de construir su casa para vivir cómodamente.Por ello Rosa solicita la suma de 100 dólares que le servirán para adquirir un puesto de ventas a fin de dejar de pagar el alquiler y concluir en poco tiempo la construcción de su casita.Contamos con vuestra colaboración para que Rosa pueda tener una oportunidad más para seguir los anhelos de su corazón.

loans.use: To buy a "sales post" where she can sell food

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Veronica, 21, is a young mother. Four years ago she decided to build a life with Alex, and from their love Juancito was born. He is an active, sweet three year old. Both parents work diligently in their store where they repair and sell used cell phones. They were able to begin this business thanks to the support of Nieves and Vidal, Alex's loving parents. This young, enthusiastic couple, who have big dreams in life, want to expand their small business, which has seen an increase in demand and attention in recent months. In order to do this, they are asking for your generous investment in their business so that in the future they can increase their income and then soon be able to build a house. Right now the young couple is waitng for your support. Give them the chance to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica, es una joven madre de 21 años, hace cuatro decidió formar su hogar junto a Alex y como fruto del amor que se tienen nació Juancito, niño inquieto y muy cariñoso de tres años. Ambos trabajan diligentemente en su tiendita de reparación y venta de celulares usados, negocio que emprendieron gracias al apoyo de doña Nieves y Vidal, padres amorosos de Alex.El deseo de esta joven y entusiasta pareja, con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, es el de ampliar su pequeño negocio, que en estos últimos meses va obteniendo gran cantidad de acogida y demanda y para concretar sus planes recurren a vuestra generosa ayuda que les permitirá invertir en su negocio, para más adelante obtener beneficios mayores y en un tiempo no muy lejano construir su casita.En estos momentos esta joven pareja espera tu apoyo, brindales la oportunidad de prosperar.

loans.use: To expand and equip their daily working space.

loans.name: Dora Fatima

texts.es:
Mrs. Dora Fatima M. Diaz is a single mother of two children. They live in the city of Ybycui in her own house.

Because she didn't have a profession or a fixed income and she had to support her children, she decided to travel to Argentina in search of better job opportunities. She found work as a cleaning lady and in a short time saved a small capital and returned to her hometown. She invested her money to open a small grocery store selling basic needs food items. With time she acquired a good clientele and her business grew.

Currently, her grocery store is well stocked, and the best in the area.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to buy cider, sugar, pasta, and other food products.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Dora Fátima Morínigo Díaz es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y viven en la ciudad de Ybycui en su casa propia.

Como no tenía una profesión ni un ingreso fijo y tenía que mantener a sus hijos, decidió viajar a Argentina en busca de oportunidades de trabajo. Consiguió trabajo como empleada doméstica y en poco tiempo reunió un pequeño capital y volvió a su ciudad, invirtió su dinero para abrir un pequeño almacén con venta de artículos comestibles de primera necesidad para el hogar. Con el tiempo fue adquiriendo buena clientela y su negocio fue creciendo.

En la actualidad es una despensa bien surtida y la mejor de la zona.

Con el crédito solicitado desea comprar sidra, azúcar, fideo y otros productos alimenticios.

loans.use: buying cider, sugar, pasta, and other food products  (Compra de  sidra, azúcar, arroz, fideo y otros productos alimenticios.)

loans.name: Solidaridad Group

texts.en:
Solidaridad is the name of this group of sixteen dedicated women entrepreneurs. The name represents their mission, solidarity in numbers. These women are wives, mothers and businesswomen who want to expand their businesses and their earnings. They are located in the neighborhood of Marketalia and most are dedicated to the sale of goods for the home.

They meet with one another weekly and share advice, stories and loans. When applying for loans together, the women are held more accounT. to pay them back because they are depending on one another. Together they celebrate birthday parties for their children and do various activities outside of work.

loans.use: There are many activities and businesses into which the loan will be invested.  Many women have clothing stores where they provide clothing for men, women and children.  Others sell various goods in their general stores such as cleaning products for the home, clothing, prepared foods, drinks and baking goods.

loans.name: Saing

texts.en: Mrs. Saing H., 54, together with her husband, sells Khmer traditional medicine in their village, making on average $5 a day. They have eight children, three of whom work as construction laborers, earning $3 each a day. To make it easier to sell the traditional medicine door-to-door in their village, they are requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a motor bike to use for transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike to deliver and sell medicine door-to-door.

loans.name: Akoélé Monique

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akoélé Monique E. was born on September 24, 1979 in Tchékpé Dévé in the Kloto Prefecture, 125 kilometers from the city of Lomé. She is married and the mother of three children. She has been working as an ambulant vendor of generic pharmaceutical products in the Agoè area since 2002. She uses the money she earns to contribute to the daily expenses of her family.

Mrs. Akoété Monique E. would like to be able to sell lengths of African print cloth at the same time as her other products, so as to diversify her sources of income.

For this reason she is requesting a first-time loan of US$ 725 to purchase 20 lengths of cloth as well as generic pharmaceutical products so that she can earn more money.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame E. Akoélé Monique est née le 24 septembre 1979 à Tchékpé Dévé dans la préfecture de Kloto à 125 Km de la ville de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle est revendeuse ambulante des produits pharmaceutiques génériques dans le quartier d’Agoè depuis l’année 2002. Elle participe aux dépenses de la famille à travers le revenu qu’elle tire de son activité.

Madame E. Akoété Monique aimerait ajouter le commerce de pagne à son activité principale pour pouvoir diversifier ses sources de revenu.

A cet effet, elle sollicite pour la première fois un crédit d’un montant de 300.000 FCFA pour acheter vingt (20) pièces de pagnes et des produits pharmaceutiques génériques afin d’améliorer ses recettes

loans.use:
Purchase of lengths of African print cloth for re-sale

Achat de pagnes destinés à vendre

loans.name: Please

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is 20 years old and is single woman with 1 child, age 7 years old. Mwanahamis is a vegetables selller, she started in 2006. Can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly is a single mother who despite having been the victim of a river flood, did not let that terrible episode in her life reduce her efforts to keep her young son happy and healthy. She would like to improve the selection in her small candy stand, so she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

NELLY, es madre soltera y a pesar de haber sido víctima del desborde del río, no ha dejado que estos lamentables episodios en su vida aminoren el esfuerzo por mantener a su pequeño contento y sano. Desea mejorar su pequeño stand de dulces y por ese motivo solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Improve selection in small candy stand

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris is a member of the "El Triunfo" ("Triumph") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin and makes a living selling beauty products. For 2 years, she's sold various brands of perfumes and cosmetics, ESIKA, AVON, UNIQUE, which she's ordered and bought from catalogs to sell to her friends and neighbors, her principal customers.

With the S/.1200 (1200 Peruvian soles) loan, to be repaid in 6 months, Doris will buy products such as perfumes, cremes, shampoos, foot and body powder, make-up, deodorants, lipstick, etc. She will buy products that are in good supply so that she can stock a range of merchandise.

Doris, 30, lives with her husband and their 2 children, her motive for continuing to work because she dreams of having a business selling "refrigerios" (snack foods of various kinds) so that she can help her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Doris B. I., socia del Banco Comunal “El Triunfo”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de Picota, Distrito de San Hilarión se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza ella atiendo con pedidos en el Jr. Huallaga Nº 585. Se dedica a la venta de artículos de perfumería y cosméticos de diferentes marcas como ESIKA, AVON, UNIQUE, hace 2 años, los mismos que los vende a través de pedidos y por catalogo que oferta a su vecinos y amigos que son sus principales clientes.

Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1,200.00 que será devuelto en 6 meses, comprará diversos artículos como perfumes, cremas, champús, talco de cuerpo y pies, maquillajes, desodorante, lápiz labial, etc. Comprará artículos que salen en oferta y de esa manera contará con un stock de diversos productos.

Tiene 30 años vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, por el cual es el motor para seguir trabajando ya que ella sueña con tener un negocio que se dedique ala venta de refrigerios y así poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Kateba Group

texts.en:
This group of 3 named their group Kateba. Their names are: John K., Kadiatu S. and Adamsay K.. John K. is the leader of the group. He was born in Makeni 42 years ago. He is married with 4 children. He is a tailor and has been in this business for over 20 years now. He sews and sells clothes. He would like to use his loan to buy materials, threads, zippers, buttons, etc.

Kadiatu S. gets most of the produce she sells from "lumas" (mobile business centres). She buys goods that are available cheap at the lumas. Most often, the goods she buys and sells are palm-oil, rice, groundnuts etc.

Adamsay K. sells ground nuts, peppers, and rice. All of these businesspeople will use their loans to add to their current businesses.

Previous loans have helped them a lot. John was able to buy a new sewing machine with previous loans. Both Kadiatu's and Adamsay's businesses have greatly increased in size, and profit has thus increased. Ultimately, this has led to an improvement in the family's livelihood. However, it is continuous access to loans that can eradicate or at least reduce poverty. Thus, the Kateba group is still requesting a new loan of Le 2,400,000 to further empower their businesses.

loans.use: Buy materials, threads, zippers, and buttons to add to his business.

loans.name: Cecilio Santos

texts.es:
Cecilio, his wife, and their two small children live in his inlaws' house. He works in an egg distributing company. At night he works as a driver. His wife does macrame work and makes costumes. These activities help them survive. The family lives in the Villa Ingenio (Río Seco) zone in the city of El Alto.

This credit will go towards acquiring construction materials (cement, brick, and sand) to make a room for their children (the inlaws will help with the labor).

This is the second time that Cecilio is turning to us for a loan. His good payment record makes it easy to approve the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Cecilio su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos viven en la casa de su suegros, él trabaja en una empresa distribuidora de huevos y en las noches trabaja como transportista asalariado, su esposa colabora realizando trabajos en macramé y costuras. Dichas actividades les ayudan a sobrevivir. La familia vive en la zona Villa Ingenio (Rió Seco) de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito sera destinado para adquirir material de construcción (cemento ladrillo y arena) para hacer un cuarto para sus hijos (los suegros ayudaran con la mano de obra).

Esta es la segunda vez que Cecilio acude a nosotros, su buen comportamiento de pago facilita aprobar el préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Aladdin

texts.en: Aladdin H. is 46 years old. He is married with three children. His wife looks after the house and the kids. Aladdin supports his family by breeding cattle, which he sells for meat. He started his business in 1982 when he was very young. Cattle-breeding is the main source of income for the family and generates the income necessary to allow Aladdin to support his family and improve their living conditions. Now he has applied for a 1200 USD loan, which he is planning to use on purchasing one milking cow for 600 USD and two calves for 300 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Davlatbibi

texts.ru:
Султонова Давлатбиби, 1968 года рождения. Она замужем и у нее 3 детей. Начала предпринимательскую деятельность 8 лет назад с продажи детских носков. Сейчас у Давлатбиби широкий ассортимент детской одежды, начиная от детских маек и трусиков до джинсовых брюк и костюмчиков. Закупает свой товар на оптовом рынке и продает на рынке «Мубориз» Гисарского района. В сезон хочет пополнить ассортимент осенними товарами. 
Услышав про программу Кива захотела участвовать и получить займ в сумме 3500 сомони.
texts.en:
Davlatbibi S. was born in 1968. She is married and has 3 children. Davlatbibi started her business 8 years ago by selling children’s socks. Toda,y Davlatbibi has a wide assortment of children’s clothing, ranging from children’s undershirts and underwear to jeans and suits. Davlatbibi purchases her products at the wholesale market and sells them at the “Muboriz” market in the Gissar region. She would like to supplement her product assortment with fall products.

After hearing about Kiva she wanted to participate and to take out a loan for 3500 somoni ($1050).

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fall products

loans.name: Active Group

texts.en:
This is Kadiatu S., Kadiatu S. and Fatu M.. They named their group Active Group. They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Makeni. This is the fifth time they’ve received a Kiva loan through SMT. Most recently, each one in the group received a loan of 600,000 LE. That loan created meaningful impacts in the lives of these borrowers: they were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees and were also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. They could also add to the daily allowances their husband’s give them for food. Today, they are requesting a loan of 800,000 LE each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Kadiatu S. (right) is the leader of the group. She is thirty-five years of age. She was born in Kabala in the Koindadugu District, north of Sierra Leone. Marriage brought her to Makeni City where today she is managing her business. She is married with five children. Three of her children are in secondary school and the other two are in primary school. Her husband is a civil servant, working for the Ministry of Agriculture. Kadiatu sells locally produced items like rice, ground nuts and palm oil. She has been in this business for over 15 years now.

With this new loan, Kadiatu will expand her business. She will be able to buy at least 266 pans of ground nuts and 1,000 cups of rice. Kadiatu buys the ground nuts and rice from Kabala, a 180-mile round trip. The fare to and from Kabala is 24,000 LE. In Kabala, a measuring pan of ground nuts costs her 1500 LE. She sells a pan in Makeni at 3000 LE. A cup of rice costs her 4000 LE in Kabala and she sells it at Le 6000 in Makeni.

The only challenge she is facing in her business is the difficulty of getting vehicles to transport her goods from the farming villages where the items are grown to Kabala. Vehicles seldom travel those routes because of bad roads. And the few that do brave the roads often charge higher prices. To Kadiatu and colleagues in the group, an increase in profit means making their lives better. They will be able to take good care of their children, specifically with their educational and nutritional needs, as well as saving for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase ground nuts and rice for resale

loans.name: Junet

texts.es: Junet tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella es docente, pero a la par trabaja en la elaboración de manualidades, las cuales vende a los colegios de nivel inicial, y a las personas que solicitan sus servicios, esta actividad la realiza desde 10 años, para poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Esta labor le agrada mucho, y demuestra tener arte y creatividad  para estos trabajos, ahora por campaña navideña está desarrollando mayor cantidad de  adornos navideños para los hogares. Sin embargo, lo cansado es cuidar a sus hijos y dedicarse al diseño de los adornos al mismo tiempo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y es una clienta muy cumplida con los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado Junet desea incrementar sus materiales para elaborar mayor cantidad de  adornos navideños.
texts.en:
Junet is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two children. She is a teacher, but she also makes handicrafts, which she sells to elementary schools and to people who seek her products. She has been in business for 10 years in an attempt to increase her income. She really likes this job, and she demonstrates her artistic talents in her work. During the holiday season, she is developing a greater amount Christmas decorations for the home. However, the most difficult thing for her is looking after her children while at the same time designing decorations. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she is a client that is very responsible with her payments. Junet would like to increase her supplies in order to make a greater quantity of Christmas decorations.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase craft supplies

loans.name: Phath

texts.en:
Mrs. Phat B. lives in the Tuol Vihea village in Kampong Speu province. She and her husband, Mr. Sophea Phon, are farmers. Mrs. Phat B. is 31 years old and the mother of four children; two are attending the local school, and the others are 1 and 5 years old.

Although they try to work hard, they still cannot support the family well. In order to provide a better life for the family, Mrs. Phat B. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business and she hopes to increase her income when she sells the cow.

loans.use: Buy a cow to start a breeding business to improve living conditions

loans.name: Mrs. Seam Saom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people living in Preak Treing village in the Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes.

Mrs. Seam S., the 27 year-old village bank president is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Phen Pav is a fisherman. He has a small problem where he does not have enough fish nets for his fishing business.

Mrs. Seam S. is asking for a loan to buy fish nets for her husband's business. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

Three members in this group have loans that are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fish nets for the fishing business.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana F., 25, is the mother of a boy and a girl, both in basic school. Her husband is a rubber tapper in one of the nearby villages, and they live in a rented apartment in Asaman, a small farming community a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana.

In order to help her husband meet the demands of the family, Diana has been trading in palm nuts for the past year. Procuring the nuts from farmers in the nearby villages, she treks to other markets to sell to retailers, mostly food vendors. Diana is requesting a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk as she needs to increase her profit to better support her husband’s efforts in providing for the family.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts.

loans.name: Julie

texts.es:
Julie es socia del Banco Comunal Sauces.
Julie es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Julie vende licor de caña que reparte a tiendas, negocios, en algunas oportunidades sus ventas son al crédito y cobra semanalmente, el licor lo adquiere en la ciudad de Andahuaylas.
Julie necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de licor de caña.
Los sueños de Julie son comprar una casa, tener su negocio en un local propio.
texts.en:
Julie is a member of the Willows Community Bank. Julie is married, is 40 years old, and has 3 children. She sells sugar cane liquor (rum) that she distributes to stores and businesses. Sometimes her sales are on credit and are covered every week. She buys the liquor in the city of Andahuaylas. Julie needs a loan of 2000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of sugar cane liquor. Her dreams are to buy a house and to have a business in her own location.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar cane liquor

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su esposo, ya que sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes y de familia. Se dedica a la venta de ropa para adultos y niños, estas prendas las lleva a vender por las distintas calles de donde vive. En esta actividad ya lleva dos años y le va muy bien, ya que no tiene carga familiar y solo vela por sus gastos personales. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y se relaciona e intercambia ideas con sus clientes. Además le es rentable porque vende a diario y trabaja solo con pedidos. Posteriormente, le gustaría abrir una tienda de ropa. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque existe compañerismo entre sus integrantes. Con el dinero que está solicitando incrementará su mercadería.
texts.en:
Carmen, 47, lives with her husband. Her children are grown, independent and have their own families. She sells clothing for adults and children. She takes these garments to sell on the different streets where she lives. She has been doing this for two years, and it is going very well. Now that she does not have the expenses of the children, she works for her personal expenses. What she likes about her work is that she knows many places; she connects and exchanges ideas with her customers. It is profitable because she sells every day and works only with custom orders. Later, she would like to open a clothing store. This is the first loan with MFP. She likes to work with her community bank because of the companionship within the membership. With this loan she will increase her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Armie

texts.en:
Armie S. has been a farmer since she was just a small child. Her parents are farmers and everything she knows about farming is a credit to her parents. She is 39 years old and has four children. She told CEVI about her life as a family woman and she said, "I will be the best farmer to win food for my children."

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers for her farm. Fertilizers are a critical factor for a good harvest. She needs to buy more fertilizers to increase her yield.

CEVI is reaching out to farmers to help them sustain their livelihood. It helps people, especially the poor, to start and have their own livelihood. CEVI provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa , trabajó junto a sus hijos en la elaboracion D. Enaguas, las enaguas son faldas que utilizan las mujeres en parte ocidental del pais, la Señora Rosa tiene su puesto en la calle Rene Vargas que esta ubicado en la zona 16 D. julio D. la ciudad  D. El ALTO, a la señora se le podria considerar como una mujer que genera fuentes D. trabajo, ella aparte D. venta produce y da a terceras personas para que realicen la labor D. confeccion D. enaguas. su esposo Clemente A. Condori es contratista y actualmente su fuente D. trabajo esta la ciudad D. Cochabamba, la pareja actualmente tiene dos hijos ellos trabajan y se esfuerzan por sus dos hijos, su sueño D. ellos es D. darle una buena educacion a sus hijos y que sean personas D. bien. La Sra. Rosa invertira el préstamo en la compra D. 5 rollos D. encaje para la produccion D. enaguas.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa T. works alongsiD. her children making enaguas—traditional skirts worn by women in the western part of the country. Ms. T. has a stand on Rene Vargas Street in the city of El Alto. She can be considered a woman who generates employment opportunities because asiD. from selling her garments, she also produces them, or gives them to third parties so that they can produce them. Clemente A. Condori, her husband, is a contractor who currently works in the city of Cochabamba. The couple has two children together. They work hard and make great efforts for the good of their children. Their dream is to proviD. their children with a good education so that they can grow up to be decent people. Ms. T. will invest this loan in purchasing 5 rolls of lace in order to make skirts.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 5 rolls of lace

loans.name: Kely

texts.es:
Kely es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Kely es soltera, tiene 20 años y vive con sus padres, estudia turismo en la universidad, Kely junto a su papa tienen una tienda de repuestos en un local alquilado, el cual esta ubicado cerca del taller mecánico de su papa.
Kely necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos para la apertura de un nuevo local.
Los sueños de Kely son terminar su carrera, especializarse en gastronomía y tener mas sucursales.
texts.en:
Kely is a member of the community bank Llamkasum that means let’s work in Quechua. Kely is 20 years old and single. She lives with her parents and studies tourism at a university. Kely and her dad own a car parts store, which is located in a rented place near her father’s mechanics workshop.

Kely is asking for a loan of $700 which will be invested in the purchase of spare parts for the opening of new car parts stores. Kely’s dreams are to finish her career, specialize in gastronomy and to open more branches.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan de Dios”, del distrito de Lampa Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa. Vive en el Barrio Central en Jr. Antonio Barrionuevo Nº 577 Lampa.

Esta iniciando su trabajo con el movimiento Manuela Ramos con un préstamo inicial de S/. 200.00 para la compra de lana para hacer tapetes y colchas de distintos modelos.

Su mayor sueño es poder  educar a sus hijos, le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones de su banco comunal, y agradece la oportunidad que les dan para poder hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the Community Bank "San Juan de Dios", originally from the district of Lampa Provincia in San Roman, Puno. She is 34 years old, she is a single Mom to 4 children, and she completed her high school education. She lives at 577 Lampa of Barrio Central, Antonio Barrionuevo.

She has her business with the help of Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner). With the loan of S/.200 she will purchase wool to weave rugs and blankets in different designs.

Her greatest dream is to be able to send her kids to school. She loves dealing with finances and attending meetings at the Community Bank, and she is grateful for the opportunity to improve her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool to weave rugs and blankets.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
