Catherine H. is the mother of two children. She lives with her family in Cotonou, the largest city in Bénin, where she owns a small hairdressing salon. She has been working there for six months. Before, she worked at another salon, but the owner decided that he wanted to build a house on the property. Therefore, Catherine decided to open a salon elsewhere.

Catherine says that business is going well, but that she needs more supplies. She is seeking a loan to buy more cosmetics. In the future, Catherine would like to expand the variety of her products. Along with cosmetics, she has a small selection of clothing, which normally sells very well. She believes that a loan will help to make her business more successful.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Luisa Eugenia

texts.es:
LUISA F. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS CARIBEÑAS” su negocio esta ubicado dentro del Hospital Amazónico, del distrito de Yarinacocha, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 34 años de edad, 4 hijos, y su esposo es obrero.

Ella se dedica a la venta de libros.  El primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con él adquirió pocos libros y los vendió a precio cómodo, con un margen de ganancia baja, pero eso le ayudo a conseguir muchos clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la  compra de más libros, que está adquiriendo directamente de Lima. 

La ONG. Manuela Ramos me ha apoyado a generar un ingreso más para mi familia, me ha permitido ampliar mi negocio y seguir creciendo y desarrollándome - comentó.
texts.en:
Luisa F. M. belongs to the communal bank "Las Caribenas". Her business is located inside of Amazonico Hospital, in the Yarinacocha district of Pucallpa city. She is 34 years old, and has 4 children with her husband, who is a manual laborer. Luisa sells books for a living. With her first loan of 300 soles, Luisa purchased and re-sold some books, with a low profit margin. However, this helped her attract many clients. With this new loan, Luisa will buy more books directly from Lima. "The NGO Manuela Ramos supported me to generate income for my family, permitted me to increase my business, and helped me grow and develop myself," Luisa commented.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase books

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew has owned and run a small tailoring college and shop for the past ten years. A 32-year-old father of three, Andrew has requested his first loan of Ksh 20,000 in order to buy materials and another machine. He hopes that this loan will help to raise his income and allow him to pay school fees for his children. 

One day, Andrew wants to buy a plot of land and build a house to rent and as a home away from the Mukuru slums where he currently lives and works. Andrew describes himself as visionary, persistent and good at planning.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a deposit-taking micro-finance company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy materials and another machine for a tailoring business

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: H., 46, is the mother of a high school student and is married to Peoun, also 46, who is a local farmer on a plot of land inherited from his parents. She earns her living by raising pigs to slaughter four times a year. Her living standard has now become more and more comfortable. That's why she wants to increase the number of pigs she raises by taking out a loan of $200 from the Kiva field partner, HKL, to buy more pigs for her stall. She dreams of her only child earning a college degree.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for her stall.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en: Mr. W. Yasin is a very hard working business man. He is twenty-five years old. He is married with three children. He is running cloth business of which he has been operating for over four years. He is using the loan to purchase clothes for sale. He is a hardworking business man whose future hopes are to own a self sufficient business and be a successful man.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres "las Emprendedoras" Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de cinco señoras,  con residencia en el sector cocales de la aldea Nahualate, san Antonio Suchitepequez	
se presentaron a la Asociación Asdir solicitando un crédito para pode	
iniciar un negocio, ya que en la situación en la que estaban no respondía a las necesidades que tenían por la 	
simple razón que, no contaban con suficientes recursos económicos y esto hacía que no podían cubrir los gastos	
que en el hogar se generaban ya que con lo que sus esposos ganan mensualmente son suficientes para	
dar lo necesario a sus hijos y darles una calidad de vida. La cual tomaron la iniciativa de iniciar un pequeño negocio	
de venta de ropa, venta de frutas y artículos de primera necesidad, y ven la necesidad de realizar un préstamo	
para poder continuar con estos negocios y solo así poder mejorar las condiciones de vida a sus familias,	
además son personas conocidas y honorables en la comunidad por su participación en actividades, colaboración 	
y sobre todo por su responsabilidad en la misma comunidad.

loans.use: Capital de Trabajo

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Letecia F., 59 years old.  Her husband, Benjamin, is a florist.  They have three children.  Twenty years ago, her family used to live among the squatters in Parañaque City.  They were included among the first families to relocate to a government relocation site in Caloocan City and have lived in Tala, Caloocan City ever since.  

Letecia established her general store four years after relocating to Tala.  Her store has been serving her neighbors for sixteen years now.  She now earns P5,000.00 a month.  She came to know the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005.  She has applied for a new loan of P10,000.00 as additional capital for her general store.  This would be her 15th loan cycle with CCT.

She dreams of having a larger grocery store someday.  



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad O. is from the village of Sto.Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 63 years old. Caridad is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Caridad makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the community. Caridad has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Caridad joined GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Caridad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Caridad is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Caridad from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Greshiel

texts.en:
Greshiel M. is 45 years old and from the village of Bolisong, Kinoguitan Misamis Oriental. Greshiel is separated from her spouse and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Greshiel owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products, such as fish balls. She also sells stick brooms in the local community. Greshiel has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Greshiel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Greshiel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Greshiel is requesting another loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Greshiel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Bader

texts.en: Bader is a 23-year-old single man. Back 5 years ago, he decided to open a computer repair shop to service the neighboring villages. Today, Bader is asking for a loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase tools and accessories needed for the computers.

loans.use: purchase tools and accessories

loans.name: Lod

texts.en: Lod A., 52, is a widow with four children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of manufacturing baskets made from forest plants, earning an income of US $2 per day in revenue. The family is also assisted by one of her children who is currently employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of approximately US $10 per day. These sources of incomes from A. and her child help cover the family expenses. A. is seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, A. is asking for a loan of US $600 to purchase a plot of farmland to do farming. This is her second loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: Buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Begmat

texts.en:
Begmat is a hard-working person, and he makes an effort to give his 4 beloved children the best. He decided to stay in his home land so that he could develop it, and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals. With experience gained over 20 years in the purchase and sales of cattle, Begmat has been able to bring stability to his family.

Begmat would now like to purchase more cattle to create more income for his large family. For this reason he requests 6000 Somoni. Begmat thanks you very much for your love of the prodigal.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Nezikokolima Group, Mukono

texts.en:
S. Grace is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 38 years old and married with two children, aged 20 and 14, both still in secondary section. She also takes care of three dependents.

Grace has a poultry business where she keeps both broilers and layers for meat and eggs respectively, and in the near future, Grace hopes to expand her farm to have more chickens that will bring in more revenue. At this time, Grace needs a loan to be able to buy more chicken feed for her farm as well as booking more day-old chicks for farm expansion, using the loan in addition to the savings that she has. This will enable her to take good care of her family as well as pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Booking more day-old chicks and stocking more chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and sale of cooking utensils

loans.name: Luisa Amparo

texts.es:
La señora Luisa R. se dedica a trabajar en el municipio de Somotillo porque tiene el compromiso de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que hoy más que nunca requiere mejorarla porque debe brindarle a su familia las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo en su localidad.
Está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de algunos materiales de construcción para dar lugar al mejoramiento de dicha vivienda y así salir adelante dándole un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luisa R. works in the municipality of Somotillo because she is committed to improve her housing conditions; now more than ever her house requires improvements so she can offer her family the necessary environment for their development in their community. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials to enable improvements to her house and get ahead in life, giving her children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Kholikul

texts.ru: Лолаев Холикул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Дети, работают в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам занимается животноводством. Откармливает и продает скот. Имеет большой опыт. В этом ему помогает жена. На полученный кредит хочет купить дойную корову. Он намерен обеспечить насиление молоком и кисло- молочным продуктом.
texts.en:
Kholikul L. lives in the Yavan region. He is 47 years old. He is married and has four children. His children work as farmers. He does animal husbandry. He feeds and sells cattle and has very good experience. His wife helps him in this business. He wants to use the loan to buy a milk cow. He plans to supply the residents with milk and milk products.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Dicia Amelieta

texts.pt:
Dicia Amelieta T. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 33 anos de idade solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 11 e 08 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Nunca saiu da cidade da Matola tem um negócio próprio há mais de 10 anos, vende mais óleo, ovos, arroz e outros. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.500.00mt por semana, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, óleo, ovos, massas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade e diversificar ainda mais a sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua casa e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade a seus filhos, assim como custear despesas de ensino superior.
texts.en:
Dicia Amelieta was born in the city of Matola, in the Maputo Province, South of Mozambique. She is 33 years old, single and the mother of two children who are 11 and 8 years old. They are both in school. She only went to school until the 8th grade due to a teen pregnancy. She lives in her own house with her children and doesn't support anyone else. She has never left Matola. She has had her own business for more than 10 years. She sells mostly cooking oil, eggs, rice and others. She does not have any employees and earns around 3.500.00mt per week, which is applied towards household expenses and a savings account. This is her first loan, in the amount of 15.000.00mt, aimed at purchasing products (rice, cooking oil, eggs, pasta and others) to increase the quantity of and diversify her inventory. She commits to pay this loan on time to be able to request others. In the future, she would like to request more loans to finish her house and offer better living conditions for her children, and to also pay for college.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of products (rice, cooking oil, eggs, pasta and others)

loans.name: Rim's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Rim S. is 54 years old and is the president of this village bank, as she was selected by its 12 members. This village bank is located in Toul Krosang village in Kandal province. The members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Rim S. and her husband, Mr. Y. Yim, are laborers who receive a small salary to support their family. In order to increase their income to improve the family's standard of living, Mrs. Rim S. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig feed for her new business. This couple has five children; two are laborers while the other three are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet Kabura is a 38-year-old married mother of three children. She lives in Kiembeni, Mombasa where she runs a grocery store. She has been in the business for five years.

Harriet has been with KADET and is now taking out her second loan after successfully servicing her first loan of Kshs 10,000. With this current loan Harriet plans to purchase potatoes, tomatoes and cabbages for resale in her grocery store. She also hopes to expand her store into a retail shop selling different foodstuffs like sugar and flour.

Harriet has been able to improve her living standards over the years and hopes to even improve more.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, tomatoes and cabbages for sale.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Mrs. Heang Y. is 55 years old and she lives in Kor village in Takeo province. Mrs. Heang Y. and her husband, Mr. No Charb, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Heang Y. is now requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle for transportation. This couple has five children: one is on the  staff of a private company, two are construction workers, one owns a general store, and the youngest is a student in a local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana A. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 52 years old. Luciana is widowed and has one adult child. To make a living, Luciana owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Luciana has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luciana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Luciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Luciana is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Luciana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: God's Blessing Group

texts.en:
Oretha S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God's Blessing. She is 38 years old, married and has four children, ranging in age from 7 to 19 years old. She was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to poverty. She also cares for two siblings. All of her children are attending school.

For 8 years now, she has been selling lappas (traditional clothing) at Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 52,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more lappas. She describes herself as a peaceful woman.

Her dream is to educate her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more lappas.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.fr:
N. Leonidas est l’un des membres de Groupes Solidaires ABISHYIZEHAMWE, est née en 1977. Il est marié, il a 2 enfants et une personne en charge. Son premier née  a 4 ans  et son dernier a 3 ans. N. Leonidas a fait 6ans d’école primaire et 2ans post primaire  Il est membre actif de ce groupe solidaire et  manifeste un esprit d’équipe pour l’expansion de leur business diversifié dont tous les membres font le petit commerce. 

Il a commencé ses petits commerces des habits pour hommes et femmes depuis 2005 avec un capital initial de 70.000Frw en commercialisant des vêtements. Mais grâce a l’ACB sa qu’elle a amélioré ses activités de commerce parce qu’il est prés à solliciter un prêt de supérieur pour pouvoir augmenter son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
Leonidas N. is one of the members of the solidarity group Abishyizehamwe. He is born in 1977. He is married, has two children and one other family member in his care. His oldest child is four years old, and his youngest is three years old. Leonidas has had six years of primary school and two years of secondary school. HE is an active member of the solidarity group and shows a team spirit, motivated to expand the diversified types of business the members are engaged in. His line of business is selling clothing for men or women, something he started to do in 2005 with a starting capital of 70,000 Rwandan francs. Thanks to ACB his enterprise has picked up, and he is ready to request a larger loan in order to achieve a higher level of revenue.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing men's and women's clothing for retailing

loans.name: Danilo Candelario

texts.es:
El señor Danilo Candelario P. G., tiene la edad de 37 años es casado y habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, su esposa se dedica a  la costura y tienen dos hijos pequeños que estudian la primaria, es gracias a su trabajo y los ingresos de su familia, que logran solventar los gastos del hogar.

Ellos no habitan en casa propia, es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan edificar su hogar, este no es el primer préstamo con Afodenic, pues dicen sentirse agradecidos con los fondos Kiva por apoyarles a desarrollar en buenas condiciones su hogar y a sus hijos ahora poder ofrecerles mejores comodidades para su desarrollo socio económico.
texts.en:
Sr. Danilo Candelario P. G. is 37 years old, married, and lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla subdivision. His wife works as a seamstress and they have two young children attending elementary school. Thanks to their work and the family income, they are able to cover the household expenses.

They do not own a home. For this reason, Danilo is requesting a loan to buy construction materials so that he can start building a house. This is his first loan with AFODENIC and he says he is grateful for the Kiva funds in helping him develop good living conditions for his children. Now he wants to make them more comfortable by developing a better financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to begin the construction of his house

loans.name: G.s. El Arca De Noe Ii Group

texts.es: Petrona y Maria Gerarda son el Grupo Solidario Arca De Noé II. Ambas se dedican a la venta de granos básicos. Este no es el primer financiamiento que realizan juntas, por lo que siempre están buscando la forma de generar ingresos. Maria Gerarda se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, las dos son personas responsables que siempre están pendientes de mejorar sus negocio, la mayoría de sus clientes asisten a su local, ya que la atención tan esmerada que ofrece es lo que la caracteriza con sus clientes. Así con este crédito podrán realizar las compras de materia prima necesaria.
texts.en:
Petrona and Maria make up the communal bank "Arca De Noé II" and both make a living selling basic grains. This is not the first time they have taken out a loan together, for they are always looking for ways to generate income. Maria Gerarda sells basic grains. Both women are responsible people who are always looking to improve their business. Most of their customers come to them because of the careful attention they provide; this is what attracts their customers. They will be able to buy raw materials with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Laziya

texts.en: Laziya N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, both currently in school. Laziya has a business selling matooke (green plantain), which she has had for six years. To help expand her business, Laziya has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more matooke. With the help of the loan she hopes to generate greater profits and be able to buy food and educate her children. In the future, Laziya hopes to own a house. Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva that funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterwards, ELA participants can receive micro-finance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional micro-finance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in micro-finance.

loans.use: To buy more food like matooke

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: El Señor Rodolfo dedicado a la construcción, y también al alquiler de un local que el tiene y que le genera un ingreso extra, este local durante bastante tiempo lo fue construyendo con mucho sacrificio y ahora ya lo tiene en buenas condiciones pero aun faltan algunos detalles y el crédito es justamente para que  pueda arreglar esos detalle comprar material de construcción, el mismo refaccionara el local,  el  ingreso percibido por el local le permite hacer estudiar a sus hijos que se encuentran en la universidad y que le generan bastantes gastos, este crédito ayudara al señor Rodolfo a consolidar su actividad y continuar trabajando con esta.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is a construction worker but he also would like to rent out store space, which would be a second source of income. He had been in the process of building this store space for a long time and with a great deal of effort. He has completed most of the building but a few areas still need to be finished. This loan will be used to complete these finishing touches. He will purchase building materials and other items. The additional income that will be generated by renting out this store space will allow him to keep his children in university. This loan will help Rodolfo complete his project.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete building a store space.

loans.name: Jose Misael

texts.es:
Don José es un señor de 50 años de edad, está casado y vive junto a una hija en El Transito de San Miguel, tiene un negocio en el mercado municipal donde ofrece verduras y granos básicos, este negocio fue iniciativa de don José desde hace 10 años y lo atiende desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde todos los días de la semana; Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de arroz, frijol,  aceite, azúcar y verduras que son los productos que mas demanda tienen en  el mercado.
Este préstamo ayudara a que crezca el negocio y pueda ofrecer lo necesario a sus clientes así poder mantenerles satisfechos y que siempre prefieran consumir de su negocio dándole a don José los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.
Los sueños de José es ver crecer su negocio para ayudar a su hija y que termine los estudios para en un futuro pueda ser una profesional.
texts.en:
José is a married, 50 year old man. He lives with his daughter in El Transito in San Miguel. He has a business in the municipal market where he sells vegetables and basic grains. José started this business ten years ago. He tends his business from five in the morning until three in the afternoon every day of the week. He is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, and vegetables. These are the products that have the most demand in the market. This loan will help his business grow, and he will be able to offer his customers what they need. That way he will be able to keep them satisfied and always preferring to buy from his business. This will give José the needed income to cover the household necessities. José’s dreams are to see his business grow so that he can help his daughter finish her education. Then she will be able to become a professional in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, beans, oil, and vegetables

loans.name: Doris Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora Doris P. es socia del banco comunal Feria Libre, vive por el sector de la Florida en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la riqueza cultural  que tiene su gente, su bello centro histórico, su gran variedad de lugares para visitar, cuenta con una gran variedad de gastronomía para disfrutar.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 8 años de edad  que   estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo tiene un taller de latonería (enderezar latas de vehículos). No tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus suegros pero  independientemente.

Doña Doris trabaja junto a su esposo en el taller de latonería el cual ya tiene 6 años de funcionamiento, es la encargada de comprar los materiales que hacen falta y también colabora con el trabajo en el taller, laboran de lunes a sábados sin tener un horario fijo de trabajo.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 9 años beneficiándose de los créditos anteriores en el taller comprando materiales. Con su nuevo crédito va a comprar herramientas como una pulidora para vehículos.
 
Su meta es  construir su casa en un terreno que es de su propiedad.
texts.en:
Doris P. is a member of the Feria Libre village bank.  She lives in the Florida area of the city of Cuenca, a city known for the cultural richness of its people, its beautiful historical center, and its large variety of places to visit.  It also has a large variety of great restaurants to enjoy.

She is 28 years old and married with 2 children, who are 8 and 9 years old and study in a school in the city.  Her husband runs a body shop.  They don't have their own home but live in their in-laws' house independently.

Doris works with her husband in the body shop which they have been running for 6 years.  She is in charge of buying the materials they need and she also does the actual body work.  They work Monday to Saturday without a fixed schedule.

She has been a member of the village bank for 9 years and has used prior loans to buy materials for the shop.  With this new loan, she will buy tools like a vehicle polisher.

Her goal is to build a home on their own land.

loans.use: Purchase a car polisher

loans.name: Zipora Kanna

texts.en:
Zipora Kanna M. is 34 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Zipora has a grocery business which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Zipora has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more items like sugar.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Zipora hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Zipora hopes to educate her children to a higher level.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of sugar

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariana de 44 años, tiene un pequeño comedor donde vende almuerzos, hace comidas típicas como seco de chivo, pollo y carne. 

Empezó hace 12 años atrás ya que toda su la mayoría de su juventud se dedico trabajando como comerciante. Puso su propio negocio de comidas para mantener a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera comenzó haciendo platos típicos poco a poco invirtió dinero para comprar una cocina industrial, por esa buena decisión ella ahora tiene un pequeño comedor donde hace almuerzos en la cocina de su casa, trabaja desde las 11h00 hasta la hora que se le acaben los almuerzos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas y arroz para sus comidas, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
44 year old Mariana has a small cafeteria where she serves lunch. She makes typical dishes of the area such as goat stew, chicken, and meat.
She began this business 12 years ago and for the majority of her youth she worked as a store keeper. She started her own cooking business so that she could support her children as she is a single mother. She began making typical dishes and little by little was able to save money and buy a commercial stove. Thanks to this good decision, she now has a little cafeteria and she makes the lunches in the kitchen in her house. She works from 11 in the morning until whatever time the lunches are finished.
She wants this loan so that she can buy drinks and rice for her meals. In the future she wants to finish building her house and she wants her children to finish their studies successfully.

loans.use: Commercial kitchen

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
Flor María tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera y tiene una hija dependiente. Reside en casa de sus padres, la cual se encuentra ubicada en el distrito agrícola de Nueva Arica, una zona situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de diez años a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Ella cría animales menores en su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde vive. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para mantener a su hija y ayudar a sus padres con la economía familiar.

Flor María desea ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales, para lo cual ha creído conveniente adquirir mas animales y alimento balanceado con los cuales desea incrementar su nivel de ventas y por ende sus ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Flor es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien confiable y responsable.
texts.en:
Flor María is 33 years old, single, and has a young daughter.  She lives in her parent's house, which is located in the agricultural district of Nueva Arica, an area located about an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than ten years, she has raised and sold small animals.  She raises the animals in her home and when they have reached a good level of development, she sells them to the merchants who visit the area where she lives.  The income she earns from this work helps her support her daughter and help her family with living expenses.  

Flor María would like to expand her business of raising and selling animals by purchasing more animals and balanced feed in order to increase her sales and her profits.  She is asking for a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Flor is a woman who is eager to get ahead in life.  People who know her consider her to be responsible and trustworthy.

loans.use: Purchase animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married man living with his wife and four children. He is the main income provider for his family. He has seventeen years of experience working in sanitary projects. He takes on projects where he makes  porcelain toilets, faucets etc. in addition to his repair service. He has a large experience in this occupation. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new compressor and a special cutter instead of the one he is using.

In the future, he is looking to continue expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase a new compressor and a special cutter instead of the one he is using

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his  business

loans.name: Rellie

texts.en:
Rellie C. is from the village of Brgy. Homestead, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 52 years old, married and has 5 adult children. Rellie owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells personal products such as glasses and watches. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rellie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support her immediate family members. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hope To Succeed Group

texts.en:
Salaymatu T. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Salaymatu was born in a village call Mayorlow in northern Sierra Leone about thirty years ago. She is married to a teacher and the couple has two children – one is in primary school and the other is not of school going age.

For seven years now, Salaymatu has been selling orange, coconut, bananas, plantains, etc. This is first loan that Salamatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Salaymatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business; she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business. 

(Included in the right of the photo is loan officer Mohamed L. Tarawalie, handing over the loan to the clients)

loans.use: To buy orange, coconut, bananas, plantains, etc. at wholesale to add to her vegetable-selling business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia S. is from the village of Poblacion, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Delia is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a retail store, selling rice by the kilogram in the local community. She also has a motorela, or habal-habal service, with her husband as the driver. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional tools for the maintenance of the service & towards working capital. Delia is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional rice for sale & to use as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Delia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice for selling & using towards working capital.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is currently in the business of selling alcohol. She is 28 years old, a widow with seven children, of which three go to school. Rose borrowed a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. In the future, Rose hopes to build a house and pay tuition fees for her children with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 22 years old, single, and very hardworking. She owns a shop in which she sells several items such as matches and some food items. She has managed this business for four years .Esther is requesting a loan in order to buy more items to fill her store. She plans to reinvest the profits in her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to fill her store.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra lives in Khanewal, which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 2 room brick house with her family in the area of Shanti nagar for the past 10 years. She is 48 years old, married to A., and the mother of 3 children. All of them are enrolled in a local school. Azra is a caring lady who stays at home and carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s grocery business. He runs his grocery store in the market where he sells items of daily use to his customers.  With the loan, she will buy items such as cooking oil, salt, lentils, rice and sugar, etc., to sell at his shop. Azra hopes that an investment will be a productive one for him. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah. This is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Azra”.

loans.use: To buy groceries for store

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Sonia del Carmen B. M., de 47 años de edad, vive en  su propia casa con su  esposo y tres hijas las cuales se encuentran estudiando. Sonia es una mujer emprendedora la cual ha trabajado durante mucho tiempo para poder sacar adelante a su familia y sigue luchando día a día con la esperanza de que sus hijas tengan un mejor futuro. Posee un puesto donde vende tortas, hot dog y bebidas en la colonia los Tikales del Municipio de Apopa. Su puesto se encuentra ubicado frente a la escuela de la Urbanización, que es un lugar muy transitado por estudiantes y trabajadores de la zona que la prefieren por la calidad, precio, e higiene en sus productos y sobre todo por la confianza que ofrece a sus clientes ya que para ella el cliente es lo mas importante en su negocio y sabe que de esta  manera atrae a mas compradores y al mismo tiempo mayores ingresos. Ha decidido hacer un préstamo a INTEGRAL para invertirlo en su pequeño negocio el cual le permita comprar más productos como: pan, salchichas, aderezos, diferentes tipos de bebidas, y la variedad de productos que necesita un puesto de este tipo. De esta manera poder ofrecer y satisfacer las necesidades de más personas. Sin perder la visión de mejorar sus ganancias para poder brindar a sus hijas lo necesario para tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Sonia del Carmen B. M. is 47 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and three children who are studying.  Sonia is an enterprising woman who has worked for a long time to get her family ahead in life and she continues working hard every day in the hope that her daughters will have a better future.

Sonia owns a stall where she sells sandwiches, hot dogs and soft drinks.  Her stall is located in Los Tikales neighborhood, in the town of Apopa, opposite the local school.  This is an area which is very busy with students and local workers who like coming to Sonia's stall for the quality, price and hygiene that she offers in her products.  Above all, they come for her friendly service because, for Sonia, customers are the most important part of her business and she knows that in this way she attracts more customers and also makes more income.

Sonia has decided to take a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her small business.  This will allow her to buy more products such as bread, sausages, dressings, different types of drinks and the whole range of products that a stall of this type needs.  In this way, she will be able to meet the needs of more people without losing sight of her vision of improving her profits in order to provide her daughters with what they need in order to lead a decent life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making top-quality sandwiches, hot dogs and drinks

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es: Aníbal David O. vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 4 años, en el barrio Villa del Carmen del municipio de Soledad; allí tiene un negocio mediante el cual ofrece servicios de mantenimiento de equipos de cómputo y comercializa mercancía variada, que además de permitirle generar ingresos, le ayuda a poner en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje  SENA, empresa estatal  en la que se capacitó técnicamente.  De este negocio depende su familia y lo creó por la necesidad de empleo e independencia propia de su naturaleza y en él trabaja para hacerlo crecer.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con ello lo  surtirá de mercancías,  como camisas,  suéteres, gorras,  dispositivos para computador como mauses,  teclados y  parlantes.  Su sueño y también desafío es tener un punto comercial en grandes superficies  y  tener su casa propia, mientras trabaja persistentemente para  aumentar su capital de trabajo, así como sus ventas e incrementar sus utilidades para reinvertirlo y hacer de su negocio un gran almacén.
texts.en:
Aníbal David O. lives with his partner and two children, aged 2 and 4, in Villa del Carmen neighborhood, in the town of Soledad.  There he has a business where he carries out computer repairs and sells a variety of merchandise which also allows him to make income.  He puts into practice the knowledge he acquired from the Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje - SENA (The National Training Service) where he received technical training.  His family depends on this business which he set up as he needed a job and independence.  He works to grow his business.

Aníbal's Kiva loan is the first loan he has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to stock up with merchandise such as shirts, sweaters, caps and computer peripherals such as mice, keyboards and speakers.  His dream, and also his challenge, is to have a sales location inside a large store and to own his own home.  In the meantime, he works persistently in order to increase his working capital and his sales.  He also works to increase his profits so that he can reinvest them and make his business grow.

loans.use: to buy computer peripherals such as mice, keyboards and speakers and to stock his business with shirts, sweaters and caps

loans.name: Afiwa Justine

texts.fr: Mère de 02 enfants, Mme Justine Afiwa est mariée à un comptable et est âgée de 40ans. Elle aime rendre belle toutes personnes c’est pour cela elle se donne à cette activité (vente de pagnes, produits de beauté…) depuis 2004. Elle achète ses produits au Grand Marché de Lomé et revend dans une boutique.  Elle est à son premier prêt et veut cet argent pour acheter des pagnes, des produits de beauté pour revendre à ses clients afin d’avoir du profit pour préparer son avenir assurer une bonne condition de vie à ses enfants et participer en partie à la charge de la famille.
texts.en: The mother of two children, Mrs   Justine Afiwa is married to an accountant and is 40 years old. She  likes to make people look beautiful which is why she has been in this business (the sale of traditional dress and beauty products)since  2004.She buys her stock at the Lome Grand Market and sells them in a shop. This is her first loan and she wants the money to buy pagnes and beauty products to sell to her customers in order to make a profit to prepare her future, give her children good living conditions, and participate in the family expenses.

loans.use: Purchase traditional clothing and beauty products

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is currently in the business of selling bedsheets, clothes and table cloths. She is 29 years old, married, and has four children, only two of whom go to school. 

Rita took out a loan to stock more bedsheets, clothes and table cloths to sell. She hopes to buy a piece of land and construct a concrete house for her children in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bedsheets, clothes and table cloths to sell.

loans.name: Hamze

texts.ar: حمزه عمره 39 سنة متزوج وهو اب لثلاث اولاد يعمل في يعمل في رسم الخرائط واجراء معاملات وورش بناء له في عمله 11 سنة يحب عمله ويريد ان يطوره بشكل جيد حيث انه طموح يحب العمل ويريد ان يؤمن مستقبل جيد للعائلة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة لرسم الخرائط وللتعهدات البناء من تراب واحدار واسمنت وغيره هو انسان طموح محب للعمل ولكنه يتعرض للمنافسة في العمل وهو بحاجة الى تطوير عمله ولكن ما يميز عمله هو الانفراد في الرسم الخرائط وتخليص المعاملات في الدوائر الرسمية فهو محبوب ومميز في قريته ومقصود من اصحاب البنايات والورش والتعهدات ولكن لا تنقصه سوى بعض المادة لدعم نفسه من خلال دعم عمله
texts.en: Hamze is 39 years old and married with three children. He works in design/map drawing and construction, and he also conducts workshops. He has 11 years experience in this. He loves his business and wants to develop it as he is ambitious and wants to secure a good future for his family. With this loan he wants to purchase new map-drawing tools and construction materials such as stones and cement, etc. He is exposed to a lot of competition and is in need of developing his business. What distinguishes him is his design/map-drawing. He is well loved in his locA. area and is the sole service provider for many in the construction industry. The only thing he lacks are the finances necessary to support himself by supporting his business.

loans.use: to purchase new design/map-drawing tools and construction materials.

loans.name: Koutediomboulo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 17 aout 2005. les 09 femmes qui composent ce groupe habitent toutes le même quartier.

Madame Sire Demba qui est à droite de la photo levant la main est le responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants.

Elle s'active dans la vente de sucre, de savon, de poisson sec et de l'huile de palme. Elle a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine, pour l'avoir pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de développer ses activités en renforçant son approvisionnement en marchandise.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d'augmenter ses épargnes et contribuer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille(nourriture, habillement)...etc
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created August 17, 2005. The nine women who compose the group all live in the same neighborhood.

Mrs. Sire Demba, who is on the right of the picture with her hand raised, is the group's leader. She is 40 years old. She is married and a mother of three.

She is active retailing sugar, soap, dried fish and palm oil. She has a very good experience in this domain, since she has been operating in it for several years.

This loan will make it possible for her to expand her activities by strengthening her stock of merchandise.

Profits will allow her to increase her savings and to contribute to the improvement of the family's living conditions (food, clothing, etc.)

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, dried fish and palm oil.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is 65 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a married lady and a mother of five adult-aged dependents. Encarnacion has a backyard cattle raising business for many purposes. She raises cattle for fattening, for meat, for milk and for breeding purposes, to earn a living. She has been engaged in this type of business for more than 30 years, with a monthly income of PHP 4,000. She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to buy additional cattle for breeding.

Encarnacion has been member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Encarnacion hopes to have a cattle ranch.

loans.use: To buy additional cattle for breeding.

loans.name: Mandalbayar

texts.en:
Mandalbayar is 43 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. His two children attend a local secondary school while his wife works at a private company. He manages a taxi service business, which was started in 2009. Since then his business was quite successful which allowed him to improve his living conditions. 

Mandalbayar is a polite man who is planning to expand his business. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a car for his wife in order for her to start taxi service business too.

loans.use: to purchase a car.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
Eleuteria  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús D. Praga”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 59 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, todos independientes. No concluyó la primaria.
Se dedica a la venta D. verduras, tiene un pequeño puesto en un mercado D. la zona.  Trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace diez años, su préstamo inicial fue D.  S/. 300.00 nuevo soles dinero, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital D. su negocio y comprará dos sacos D. cebolla, zanahoria, coliflor, zapallo, lechuga, etc., en el negocio le ayuda su esposo, quien trabaja como profesor.
Su sueño es seguir con el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Eleuteria is a member of the “Niño Jesús D. Praga” (Infant Jesus of Prague) communal bank located in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department.  She’s 59 years old, married and has four children, all independent.  She did not complete elementary school.

She is a vegetable merchant.  She has a small stand in a local market.  She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 10 years.  Her initial loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her business.  She will use this new, 3000 new sol, loan to increase her business’ capital buying two sacks of onions, carrots, cauliflower, pumpkin, lettuce, etc.  Her husband, who works as a teacher, helps her with the business.  

Her dream is to stay in business and improve her income.  What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of the loan.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of onions, carrots, cauliflower, pumpkin, lettuce, etc.

loans.name: Albert

texts.ru:
Алберту 39 лет, он живет в деревне Лчашен, Гегаркуникского региона, вместе со своей матерью, женой и двумя маленькими дочками. Мать Алберта инвалид II группы, жена преподает в сельской школе, но в данный момент находиться в декретном отпуске. 
После окончания средней школы, Алберт в течение долгих лет жил в России, а по возвращении в Армению устроился на работу на Севанский хлебозавод пекарем. Параллельно со своей работой на хлебозаводе, Алберт занимается сельским хозяйством: разводит коров, овец и свиней, а также выращивает картофель. Основной доход семье Алберта приносит продажа сельскохозяйственной продукции, что и дает ему возможность содержать свою семью. 
Алберту необходим кредит на сумму 500.000 драм на покупку корма для скота, а также для покупки нескольких телят, что в будущем поможет ему увеличить доход своей семьи.
texts.en: Albert is 39 years old.  He lives in the village of Lchashen, in the Gegharkunik region, with his mother, his wife and two young daughters. Albert's mother is an invalid, and his wife teaches at a rural school, but at the moment is on maternity leave. After graduating from high school, Albert lived in Russia for many years, and on his return to Armenia he took a job at the Sevan bread factory as a baker. Along with his work at the bakery, Albert is engaged in agriculture.  He breeds cows, sheep and pigs, and he grows potatoes. The family's primary income comes from the sale of agricultural products, which enables him to support his family. Albert needs a loan of 500,000 drams to purchase feed for livestock, as well as to buy a few calves that will help him in the future to increase his family's income.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals and buy some more calves

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab, from the village of Tskaltsminda, Guria Region, is 37 years old and lives with his mother, elder brother and two children – a 17-year-old-daughter and 12-year-old son, both of whom go to school.

All adult family members are involved in family agricultural activities, growing tangerines, nut trees and various vegetables on their own plot of land. The harvested products are sold locally. In addition to the family business, Zurab also works for the village water supply entity, earning a salary of 400 Laris per month. Total average monthly income of the family comes to 600 Laris.

Zurab has requested a loan to start up a dairy business that will require purchasing a milk cow to start producing cheese which will be sold at the local market. The new business initiative will increase the income of the family and allow them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Sek is married and has four children, three of whom are enrolled in school. Her fourth child is working as a potato farmer in their village where he earns little in income. Her husband frequently works in the fields alongside her.

Sek has spent her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She has had great success growing her crops. She is able to plant her fields at least twice a year in both the rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall will be good for her crops.

However, Sek doesn’t have the money yet to use on her farm, so she is looking for a loan of 600,000 KHR to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides and seed for planting.

Sek is very grateful to all lenders who support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seed for planting.

loans.name: Navigator Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth, who is in her early 40s, is married with three children who go to school. She has had a charcoal business for one year now.  She works from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use for buying more sacks of charcoal. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house and send her children to good schools.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Navigator" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 38 years old and lives in San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is married with three children. Joel operates his own jeep for transport to earn a living. He has been engaged in this business for six years. He earns 10,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy some spare parts for his jeep for repair and maintenance. Joel has been a member of Kiva partner, GDMPC, for one year. In the future, he hopes to purchase another jeep for transport to earn more money for the education of his children and for the family. About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for jeepney repair and maintenance.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Alé

texts.fr: Monsieur Alé  habite au Sénégal. Il est âgé de 39 ans. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants  âgés entre 3 et 13ans. Il s’active depuis 17 ans dans le secteur du transport. Il est chauffeur de la catégorie C1. Alé a fait  une formation en mécanique. Par la suite il est passé au service militaire avant d’exercer le métier de  chauffeur. Grâce a ce métier il a trouvé du travail  dans une entreprise de la place.  Il est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  depuis 7 ans. Il sollicite un prêt de 250 000 frs prévu pour la réparation de son taxi. Ce financement  l’aidera pour le redémarrage des activités de son taxi qui lui procurent des revenus supplémentaires.  Ainsi l’accroissement  de ses  revenus  l’aidera a mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Alé lives in Senegal. He is 39 years old, married and the father of 4 children aged between 3 and 13.

For 17 years he has been working in the transportation sector. He is a category C1 driver. Alé trained as a mechanic. After that, he went into military service before starting work as a driver. Due to his profession, he found work in a local business.

Alé has been a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC for 7 years. He is asking for a loan of 250,000 francs which he plans to use to repair his taxi. The loan will help him to re-start his work as a taxi driver which will provide extra income. Increased revenue will help him to better meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 36 años es una mujer alegre. Ella vive junto a Juan, su esposo desde hace 18 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Rudy, Rene y Ángela; a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el barrio de Chilca. Para el futuro de sus hijos, ella ayuda a su esposo en los gastos del hogar: “los dos tenemos que trabajar, porque no alcanza el dinero”, menciona con optimismo. Ya que comenzó hace algunos años a trabajar en la compra y venta de granos verdes y verduras, en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad y Lima, la capital del país. Asimismo su esposo, trabaja como albañil en construcción de casas, según cuenta percibe una ganancia de 1500 soles mensuales, como mínimo; “todo depende de los contratos”, afirma. Además, los dos se dedican a la siembra de papa, olluco y maíz en sus terrenos agrícolas, que se ubican en la ciudad de Pampas, donde viajan cada vez que puedan, pues siempre están al cuidado de su familia que es su razón de progreso. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y se siente desarrollada, pues tiene al aliado perfecto para sus objetivos. Además agradece el apoyo de todos ustedes, prometiendo ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. La casa de Carmen no cuenta con baño propio, por ello de recibir su apoyo, invertirán  el dinero solicitado en la compra de los materiales para construir un baño fuerte y de calidad.
texts.en:
36-year-old Carmen is a cheerful woman.  She lives together with Juan, her husband of 18 years.  The couple have three children, Rudy, Rene and Ángela, who they care for in their own home, which is located in Chilca neighborhood.

For the future of their children, Carmen helps her husband with the household expenses.  "We both have to work because the money doesn't stretch far enough", she says with optimism.  Some years ago, Carmen started work buying and selling green grains and vegetables in the wholesale market in her town and in Lima, the capital of Peru.  Carmen's husband works as a builder, building houses.  She says that he makes a minimum of 1,500 soles profit a month.  "It all depends on contracts" she says. In addition, the two of them also grow potatoes, 'olluco' (a native tuber) and corn on their farmland which is located in the town of Pampas.  They travel there whenever they can.  They are always caring for their family which is their reason for making progress. 

This is Carmen's fourth loan from MFP and she feels happy because she has the perfect ally in achieving her goals.  She is also grateful for your support and pledges to make her loan repayments punctually.  Carmen's house does not have its own bathroom and so, with your support, she will invest the money she has requested in buying supplies in order to build a strong, good-quality bathroom.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for building a bathroom

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en:
Rahma is a 21-year-old young woman.  She is married and her husband is a painter who paints walls and houses, earning a decent salary. Rahma wants to purchase new washing machine and new stove to improve her living, but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN.  When Rahma gets the loan, she will be able to purchase a new washing machine and stove.  This will improve her home conditions positively. 

Rahma is a conservative woman, so her husband Abdullatef is photographed instead.

loans.use: buy a new washing machine and stove.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Doña Maria esta estable con sus ventas de tortilla y una pulperia que inicio hace poco, pues anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de fritanga, que inicio con dinero que su esposo dio  y que por motivo, que las ventas estaban bajas y  el pollo incremento de precios, no le estaba quedando ganancia, es por tal razon, el capital lo distribuyo en su nueva y pequeña pulperia.
Hoy en dia palmea por las mañanas docientas tortillas, y luego despacha en su venta, el cual quiere aumentar en productos, para crecer mas, ya que tiene poca mercaderia y obtener mas clientes, ya que su familia es de cuatro hijos, los cuales estudian y son muchos gastos, su esposo sigue laborando en seguridad, ambos queriendo un mejor futuro para sus hijos. Entre los productos a comprar: granos basicos, golosinas, caja de jabon de lavar, axe, productos lacteos, huevos, que es lo mas demandado por el cliente.
texts.en:
María is stable with her tortilla and grocery sales that she started recently since she used to work selling fried fast food.  She started with money her husband gave her because sales had dropped and the price of chicken had risen so she wasn’t making any profits.  Because of this, she used her capital for her new, small grocery store.

Today, she makes 200 tortillas in the morning and then tends to her store.  She wants to increase her stock merchandise to grow more because she has little merchandise and wants to obtain more customers because her family of four children who go to school generates many expenses.  Her husband is still working as a security guard and both of them want a better future for their children.  Among the products she will buy are basic grains, snacks, a box of laundry soap, Axe [detergent], dairy products and eggs, which are the items with highest customer demand.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Luzbe

texts.en:
Luzbe is a 29-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She and her husband run a fishing business. Luzbe sells her husband's catch at the market. She also buys from other fishermen to have more fish to sell. Luzbe said they earn about 8000 PHP per month from this business.

Luzbe has requested a loan to buy fishing nets, hooks and more fish to sell. Luzbe hopes for their business to grow and for their children to finish college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks and more fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
This is Maria Teresa, 36, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Rhoderic, a driver. She is the mother of three children. Together with her husband and children, she manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Maria Teresa maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers depend on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 13,000-PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maria Teresa fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week, where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise needed in her business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: This is 41 year old Hassan.  He is married, and has five children aged 2, 6, 9, 14 and 24 years. He has four additional dependents who live with him. They are his younger brother and sisters, and he assists with their schooling.  In 1995, Hassan established his provision and mobile phone card top-up business. He began his business because he wanted to be self employed and get a source of income to provide livelihood for his family. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about Le 1,600,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Hassan has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now needs a new loan in order to buy sugar, milk, margarine, mayonnaise, ovaltine and mobile phone recharge cards for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Hassan plans to develop his business to the point becoming a wholesale trader, build a house and educate his children to the highest possible level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for provisions such as sugar, milk, margarine, mayonnaise, ovaltine and mobile phone recharge cards

loans.name: Vi

texts.en:
Vi is a 57-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has six children. Her husband is retired. Vi earns a living running a general store, which she has done for five years. 

Vi would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. 

She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and help her to improve her family's living conditions as well as enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as snack foods and confectionery.

loans.name: Kweterana Kyamasuka Group

texts.en: Ahamed is 56 years old and married with 5 children. He is a member of Kweterana Kyamasuka, a group of hardworking people. He has no other dependents and he lives in his own house. His family goal is to educate his children. He raises cattle and he has been doing this for over 20 years. He started with one cow now he has over twenty five cows. He likes his business and he faces no difficulties in it. Ahamed needs a loan to buy cows for raising.

loans.use: to buy cows to raise.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon, 55, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Two of her children are employed; one is a battery charger and another one runs a business repairing motorbikes. 

In order to improve her family livelihood, Mon is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase motorbike spare parts for her husband to sell as well as to repair for his customers. In the future, she would like to expand her son's business, renew her home, and send her youngest child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase motorbike spare parts for her husband to sell or repair for his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his sister's dental treatment.

loans.name: Paskazia

texts.en:
Paskazia lives in the Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children. She runs a tailoring business. She makes and repairs both mens and womens clothes. She has employed one assistant and she needs an additional capital of USD 400 to expand her business.

This amount will be used to buy sewing machines and other tailoring supplies. The expansion strategy will help her increase her income. One of her two sons is expected to join secondary school early next year. The planned increase of income will help her pay for school fees and other associated costs.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Asiman

texts.en:
Asiman has 10 years of experience in this business.
Having borrowed $200 he bought 4 pregnant sheep.
The second time he borrowed  $300 and bought 6 pregnant sheep.
The third time he borrowed a loan of $500 to buy 2 cows.
Now he requests a loan of $1000 to buy 4 male calves.Asiman was born in 1961 in Yenikand village, Salyan region. He is married and has a child.

loans.use: To buy 4 male calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer, frying pan and a frying spoon

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
I built a garage to keep my car safe as the hubcaps had been stolen a few times before. However, I have recently realised that I need an extra room for my family as we have very little space. I need a loan of $1200 to build this room.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

“Construí la cochera para poder meter mi auto ya que me has robado varias veces las copas de las llantas, pero con el paso del tiempo me di cuenta de que necesito más un cuarto para la comodidad de mi familia ya que tenemos muy poco espacio”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto.

loans.use: To build a room/Construcción de un cuarto

loans.name: Hoshimjon

texts.en:
Hoshimjon S. is 30 years old, and he has a high agrarian education. He is married and has 3 children. Currently he works as an agronomist in a farm. Also he has been breeding stock for four years; he has a lot of experience and skills in breeding stock. He has a cow-house and a small piece of land where he grows corn and trefoil (clover) for animal feed. This kind of activity is an additional source of income.

With the loan amount of $1000, the client is going to buy 3 bull-calves for feeding and selling. This loan gives him the opportunity to increase the amount of animals, so village habitants can buy bull-calf cheaper near their homes. Client is going to pay off the loan amount in 6 months.

loans.use: To buy three cows for feeding and selling

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
