Ana is a charismatic and lively mother, who devotes her time to the cultivation of gladioli and lettuces in the small kitchen garden that she possesses together with her family and in which she invests all her effort daily in order to harvest the thing that is most important to her of all, her family’s happiness.

Thanks to this effort, one of her children is studying in the university at Huancayo. However the small amount of money obtained isn’t sufficient to completely meet his needs as the production of their crops has been enormously damaged as a result of a lack of fertilizer, which is growing more and more expensive. With the plan of increasing the quality of their products and therefore their commercial value, which would allow them to meet all the family’s needs and thus see them obtain happiness, she is asking for a loan of $275 dollars. Let us contribute to the happiness of this family.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva volunteer

La señora Ana es una alegre y carismática madre de familia, que se dedica a la siembra de gladiolos y lechugas, en el pequeño huerto que posee junto a su familia y en la que invierte todo su esfuerzo diariamente para cosechar aquello que es más importante para ella, la felicidad de su familia.

Gracias a ese esfuerzo uno de sus hijos, estudia en la universidad de Huancayo, sin embargo el poco dinero obtenido, no es suficiente para poder apoyarlo plenamente en lo que necesita, ya que la producción de sus cultivos se ha visto enormemente perjudicada por la carencia de fertilizantes y abonos, que cada vez son más caros.Con el propósito de incrementar la calidad de sus productos, y por ende la comercialización de estos, que le permitirán cubrir todas aquellas necesidades que tenga su familia y así poderlos ver felices, solicita un monto de 275 dólares.Contribuyamos con la felicidad de esta familia.

loans.use: Purchase manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
Olga Lidia has three small children in school. She desires to give them only the best so that they can progress and improve. One day she realized that she did not have any money to buy the books one of her children needed and thus Olga decided to begin selling something in order to make money and cover the costs of her house.

Nevertheless Olga doesn't have enough merchandise for the winter sales season. For this reason she is requesting a loan of $275 so that she can buy winter clothes to sell, like heavy pants, sheepskin coats, and scarves among other things that people buy for winter weather. With your help Olga will be able to improve the lives of her children and offer them a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Olga Lidia tiene tres pequeños hijos estudiando, a los cuales les desea dar lo mejor para que salgan adelante. Un día no tenían para poder comprar los libros que le habían pedido a uno de sus hijos y fue por eso que Olga decidió comenzar a vender algo para poder sacar dinero y cubrir los gastos de su casa.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con mercancía para la temporada de invierno es por eso que Olga está solicitando un crédito de US $275 para poder comprar ropa de temporada de invierno como son las chamarras, pantalones, bufandas entre otras cosas que son las que las personas compran en esta temporada. Con tu ayuda Olga podrá sacar a sus hijos adelante y así poder ofrecerles un mejor futuro.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the winter season

loans.name: Nazia Bibi's Group

texts.en: My name is Nazia B. from Faisalabad, a textile city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of an only son who is one year old. My husband sells plants on his cart. Earlier he used to work in a factory but  the factory had to shut down and my husband started this business a year ago. We need a loan to buy plants in bulk for our business. There area  few other women in my community who all are very hardworking and require loans for their businesses. They are: Rasheeda B. who requires a loan for her husband’s scrap business. Hameeda B.  needs a loan to buy a fruit cart for her husband. Rubina B. requires a loan to manufacture small cloth bags in which sweets are stored. Samina K. she needs a loan to help her son to expand his files( a paper used for legal documentation) business.

loans.use: Buy plants

loans.name: Manzar

texts.en: Manzar is a resident of  the Saatli suburbs and she has a small plot of land where she keeps cows. She is 50 years old, not married and runs her business on her own. She has had her business for 8 years now. Currently, she has 4 cows. Manzar wants to buy more calves in order to raise them and have more income from her business. She therefore applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of 600 USD for 12 months.

loans.use: To increase her quantity of animals

loans.name: Namataba 2 D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jamira N.. She is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Jamira is 34 years old and is married. Her husband is a builder. She has 5 children ranging from age 3 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Jamira makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land. Jamira has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jamira is joined in her small group by Hanifa N., Mary A. , Agnes N., and Hajara N.. Hanifa N. has a business selling fish and wants to boost her business. Mary A. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to expand to bulk selling. Agnes N. operates a business of charcoal sales and wants to improve her business. Hajara N. is currently in the business of selling arts and crafts and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase more bunches of matooke from the surrounding villages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase articles for their home, items of clothing to sell, and supplies for their food business.

loans.name: Mantanyaro I Group

texts.en:
Almamy K. is the leader of the Matanyaro l Group. He is 45 years old and is married with 3 children. Being the most educated person in the village, he took the lead to encourage the community to organize themselves, be honest, and work hard to produce more food.

All of the group members are engaged in farming and are requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000 ($875 USD), Le.500, 000 ($175 USD) each, for the production of vegetables and rice.

The Mantanyaro I Group is dedicated to the production of healthy vegetables and rice for their families and their village. They need additional capital to purchase the necessary inputs for their farms.

loans.use: To buy supplies for their farms.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Mr. G. B. is originally from Cantón Cojxac, in the town and department of Totonicapán. He works as a weaver and came to Asociación ASDIR in order to be able to expand the business he owns. He tells us that he has worked in weaving for over 20 years, making a traditional lightweight fabric. His brother started this business because he traveled frequently to the Panajachel department of Sololá and it occurred to him that he could market such a product there. G. B. worked for his brother for a while, but over time he thought of having his own shop. This was made possible through a loan from the BANDESA bank. He currently has four looms at home and two more in his worker’s houses. With the loan from ASDIR, he plans to buy two more looms and more materials.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El es originario del Cantón Cojxac, del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, quien labora como tejedor, acudió a la institución para poder ampliar el negocio que maneja. Nos manifiesta que desde hace 20 Años que empezó a laborar en la tejeduría, produciendo mantas laboreadas tipicas, el cual fue una iniciativa de su hermano quien viajaba mucho al municipio de Panajachel departamento de Sololá, le surgio la la idea que en este lugar se podia comercializar este producto, por una temporada estuvo laborando para su hermano, en el transcurso del tiempo pensó crear su propio taller, el cual le funcionó gracias a un crédito que el Banco que en sus siglas BANDESA le proporcionó y logro iniciar el negocio propio , actualmente tiene cuatro telares, dos instalados en casa de habitación y otros dos en casa de sus trabajadores. Con el crédito que ASDIR le va a proporcionar tiene la visión de implementar otros dos telares y compra de más materiales.

loans.use: Working capial for buying two new looms and materials

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, 33, is married and the father of one child. He lives in the southern suburbs of Beirut. Ali owns a butcher shop where he sells chicken. He recently bought a second-hand car and now needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to settle the remaining amount. This is the first time Ali has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to settle the remainder owed on his second-hand car

loans.name: Zonia Glicelda

texts.es:
Over the years, Glicelda has been perfecting the technique and design of her knitwork. She started knitting by hand, but time and experience have turned her into a skilled and talented woman in this art. Her reasons for working with so much dedication are her 4 underage children, who need care, nourishment, and an education. Meanwhile, her husband, Máximo, does seasonal work as a master bricklayer, which affects their modest household finances. For this reason, Glicelda decided to increase her clothing production. She is requesting this current loan in order to obtain materials (wool) and strengthen her knitting workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Glicelda ha lo largo de los años fue perfeccionando la técnica y diseño de sus tejidos, se inició tejiendo manualmente, pero el tiempo y la experiencia la convirtieron en una mujer con gran habilidad y talento para este arte, el motivo por el que se desempeña con mucha constancia son sus 4 menores hijos, quienes requieren de cuidado, alimentación y educación. En tanto, su esposo Máximo, se desempeña en trabajos eventuales como maestro albañil, en muchas oportunidades la económica de su modesto hogar se vio afectada, por ello, Glicelda decidió aumentar el volumen de producción de sus prendas. Solicita el presente préstamo para adquirir materia prima (lana) y fortalecer su taller de tejidos.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of wool for her knitwork

loans.name: Sulma

texts.es:
Sulma's first loan

Sulma is a member of the Kallpanchik Communal Bank, which means Our Strength in quechua. Sulma has a live-in partner, is 23 years old, and has a 1 year old son. Sulma sells vegetables in a rented space in Nazarenas market, located in the Jesús Nazareno district. Sulma begins her day very early because she goes to the supply market to do her shopping, an activity she does every day from 7 in the morning until noon, then she goes to her home to cook and clean. p> Sulma needs a loan for 1050 soles which will be invested in the purchase of a variety of vegetables.

Miriam dreams of having her own home, have a large store in a stable location, and that her son receives an education.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El Primer préstamo de Sulma

Sulma es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik que significa Nuestra Fuerza en quechua. Sulma es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo pequeño, Sulma vende verduras en un puesto alquilado en el mercado las nazarenas que se ubica en el distrito de Jesús Nazareno, Sulma inicia su día muy de madrugada porque va al mercado de abastos a hacer sus compras, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 12 del mediodía para luego ir a su casa a cocinar y limpiar.

Sulma necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras variadas. Los sueños de Sulma son tener casa propia, una tienda grande en un local estable y que su hijo estudie.

loans.use: Sulma needs a loan for 1050 soles which will be invested in purchasing a variety of vegetables.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie N., 48 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Bayouf Pout à Thiès depuis 6 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter et revendre des fruits locaux comme les mandarines, les clémentines, les oranges, les  pastèques et les mangues selon la saison. Cette activité lui permet d’avoir des revenus pour prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Marie N., age 48, is married and has been a member of the village bank of Bayouf Pout in Thiès for six years. She wants a loan to buy and resell local fruit, such as mandarin oranges, clementines, oranges, watermelons, and mangoes, according to the season. This business enables her to have an income for taking care of family needs. The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell local fruit

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mrs. Van M., born in 1982 and now living in Preak Tamao Village in Takeo Province, owns a small plot of land upon which she cultivates rice. Unfortunately, the field has become infertile, so she is requesting a loan to buy both fertilizers to restore it and more pesticides to control insect infestations. Her husband, Mr. Hao Sith, is a construction worker.

Mrs. Van M. has two children, one three years of age and the other five. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her rice field.

loans.name: Upendo K.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Upendo M. from Mbeya. Not yet married, Upendo has been running a business selling women’s and children’s clothes since 2005. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week, earning a monthly profit of about $45.

She is now requesting a loan of $575 in order to purchase more clothes in bulk and in the future plans to expand her business. Debora thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase more clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Gloria Vilma

texts.en:
Gloria Vilma C. U. is a member of the Manantial (“Spring”) Village Bank.  Vilma is 40 years old and married with two children. She is a vegetable farmer in the Chacco community, where she owns a plot of land and rents several others. She sells her vegetables on foot in the Nery Garcia Market very early in the morning.  Vilma needs a loan of $700 to pay the rent for the land she farms on.  Vilma’s dreams are to help her children get ahead in life, to own more land, and to expand her business. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow.

loans.use: To pay rent on farmland

loans.name: Mrs. Sophann Phon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen members, who live in the Liek village in Kandal province, make up the village bank loan. They plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sophann P. is the village bank president. Her husband, Mr. San Sambath, is a farmer who has 0.2-hectare to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sophann P. is 46 years old and the mother of two children; one is a construction worker, and the other attends the local school.

Mrs. Sophann P. owns a small store where she sells groceries. This business is going well, so she wants to expand the business. She is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to increase her inventoR..

loans.use: Buy more grocery products for the inventory in her store

loans.name: Pai

texts.en: Pai K., 57, lives in Bati district with her husband and sells coconuts in front of a nearby garment factory and makes about $1 profit each day. Her husband operates a motor-taxi and is makes about $5 each day. The couple has six children. All of the children are employed and share their income to help raise their family's standard of living. Mrs. Pai K. is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike and trailer for her husband to expand his motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and trailer.

loans.name: Sergio Santiago

texts.es: El señor Sergio Santiago labora para una empresa como capturista de informática, su esposa la señora María de Jesús labora como psicóloga de una prestigiosa Institución. Ellos son un matrimonio estable emocional y económicamente, ellos ahora que tienen su casita desean construir toda una barda alrededor para protección de la familia con la adquisición de este préstamo.
texts.en:
Mr Sergio Santiago works for a company as data capturer. His wife Maria de Jesús works as psychologist of a prestigious Institution. They have an emotional and economically stable marriage and now that they have their small house, they want to build a wall around it for protection of the family with the money of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall around the house for protection

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: JULIA  DE 33 AÑOS DE EDAD VIVE EN LA ZONA ROMERO PAMPA, JUNTO A SU FAMILIA, DESDE HACE 4 AÑOS ATRÁS. JULIA TIENE UN NEGOCIO PROPIO DONDE VENDE ABARROTES, POR OTRA PARTE COMERCIALIZA EN LAS DIFERENTES FERIAS DE LA CIUDAD DESDE HACE 18 AÑOS ATRÁS, POR LO QUE CUENTA CON BASTANTE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO. POR OTRA PARTE SU ESPOSO ES TRANSPORTISTA PROPIETARIO CON EXPERIENCIA DE 2 AÑOS. EN LA TIENDA DE ABARROTES COMERCIALIZA "AZUCAR, ARROZ, FIDEO, HARINA BLANCA Y OTROS". SI BIEN EXISTE COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO, JULIA CON EL BUEN TRATO QUE DA A LOS CLIENTES Y SU EXPERIENCIA HACEN FRENTE AL MISMO. SU PUESTO DE VENTA SE ENCUENTRA EN PLENA PLAZA PRINCIPAL. JULIA DESTINARÁ EL CREDITO A LA COMPRA DE UN MOTOR PARA EL MINIBUS DE SU ESPOSO. JULIA NO TIENE ANTECEDENTES NEGATIVOS EN EL CENTRAL DE RIESGOS NI EL BURO DE INFOCRED.
texts.en:
Julia is 33 years old and has lived in the Romero Pampa area with her family for four years. Julia has her own business where she sells groceries, and she has also sold at various city markets for the past 18 years, so she has plenty of experience in this field. Her husband has two years of experience as a driver. In the grocery store, they sell sugar, rice, noodles, white flour and other items. There is, of course, competition in this market, but with her good customer service and experience, Julia holds her own. Her sales post is in the main plaza. Julia will use the loan to buy an engine for her husband's minibus. Julia has no bad history in the Risk Center nor the Infocred Bureau.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase engine for minibus

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona A. is currently in the business of selling small commodities like toothpaste, etc. at the shop and is requesting a loan to buy a fridge to be used in the shop for cooling soft drinks. Lona is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a clerk. She has three children, all of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Lona also hopes to be able to buy a bus to transport passengers from town to town. 
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a wide range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy a fridge to cool soft drinks sold in the shop

loans.name: Finao

texts.en:
Finao L., 40, is married with seven children. She has three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public five days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (approximately $240).

She has three previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Finao’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy weedkiller, a gallon of gramoxone (herbicide), bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Marhamathon

texts.ru: Получая займы Мархаматхон улучшила условия не только своего бизнеса, но и социально-бытовые условия своей личной жизни. Муж помогает в бизнесе, а сама Мархаматхон кроме торговли еще воспитывает своих многочисленных внуков. Ассортимент товаров ее магазина увеличился в несколько раз и сейчас магазин открыт для своих постоянных покупателей. Она приобрела 2 морозильника для мороженного. Кроме продуктов питания там теперь продаются и промышленные товары. Сейчас она планирует закупить прохладительных напитков, товаров по уходу за домом и поэтому подала очередной займ на КИВА.
texts.en:
By taking out loans Marhamathon has improved not only her business conditions but also the living conditions in her personal life. Her husband helps her in her business and Marhamathon herself in addition to selling also raises her many grandchildren. The product assortment in her store has increased several times and now her store is open for its regular customers. She has purchased 2 freezers for ice cream. In addition to food products manufactured goods are now also sold there. Now she plans to purchase cold drinks and household products and this is why she has applied for a loan on KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for store

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, a 32-year-old trader, is married with three children who are in school. She is a very resourceful wife and mother.

Ruth supports her husband in providing for the household through the sale of used clothing and sachet (polythene-bagged) drinking water. The selling of used clothing has a very big market in Ghana as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore, the selling of used clothing has created a market for many Ghanaian women like Ruth.

Ruth wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing and shoes to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her to save more for her children’s education and also enable her to rent a store to trade in.

Ruth is member of the group called odo ye de (love is sweet). Members agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing and shoes to increase her inventory

loans.name: Gladys Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Gladys, es originaría de Huarán en la provincia de Calca, ubicado en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los incas, poseedores de una zona bastante cálida y rica en productos, situado a 1 hora y 20 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 45 años de edad y es soltera tiene 2 hijos  (18,10) años ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura específicamente ella compra y vende granos (maíz, habas, cebada, trigo),  ella solicita el préstamo para poder comprar semillas y sembrarlas y con otra parte comprar más granos para vender en la época baja de producción.

La socia esta agradecida con el préstamo debido a que en la zona no se cuenta con banca financiera y lo cual a ella le permite realizar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Gladys is from Huarán in the province of Calca, located in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas, a warm, fertile region an hour and 20 minutes from the city of Cusco. This member is 45 years old and unmarried. She has two children, 18 and 10 years of age. In addition to her domestic activities, she works in agriculture, buying and selling grains such as corn, beans, barley, and wheat. She is requesting the loan to buy and plant seeds, and also buy other seeds to sell outside of the growing season. She is grateful for the loan, since the region has no banks and the loan enables her to bring her projects to fruition.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell grain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For house construction

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Karla Patricia de 33 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos, labora para el MINED de Santo Tomas como docente desde hace 11 años, esta solicitando su primer credito para la construccion de una tapia, pues con las lluvias el patio de su casa se llena de agua de los patios vecinos, lo que produce zancudos y mucho lodo y quiere evitarse enfermedades.  A pesar que no tiene hijos desea tener comodidades en su casa para cuando los tenga.  Karla es muy trabajadora, responsable y muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo.  Sueña con tener estabilidad laboral, estudiar una especialidad y una casa bonita que tenga las condiciones basicas para vivir.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia is 33, single, and she does not have children. She has worked as a teacher for MINED of Santo Tomas for 11 years. She is asking for her first loan to build a wall. With the rains, her patio fills with water from her neighbors’ patios. This produces mosquitoes and lots of mud. She wants to avoid illnesses. In spite of the fact that she does not have children, she wants to make her house comfortable for when she does have them. Karla is very hard working, responsible, and well liked among her colleagues at work. She dreams of having work stability, studying a specialty, and a pretty house that has the basic living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos tiene 25 años, es un joven muy carismático, quien ama mucho a su madre y a su hermana menor, con quienes vive. Hace 5 años empezó a sembrar flores (gradiolos) en la chacra de su madre y otras veces en terrenos alquilados, pero desde los 18 años siembra arvejas y le va muy bien. Por eso, en aras de incrementar sus ingresos económicos se ha avocado también a la siembra de flores, las cuales son muy rentables en los meses de mayo y octubre, pues llega a sacar más de lo previsto. Dependiendo de cómo se encuentre el mercado, llega a vender la docena a 80 soles, en el caso de cada paquete (como nos muestra en la foto), los vende entre 6 a 7 soles. Entonces prefiere sembrar justo para que cosechar en las fechas de mayor demanda, ya que de ese modo ayuda económicamente a su madre y a su hermana menor en sus estudios, y eso lo llena de mucha satisfacción. Esta es la primera vez que tiene la oportunidad de acceder a un préstamo con MFP y es debido a la invitación de un integrante de un banco comunal quien lo recomendó. Por lo que Marcos hace compromisos de adherirse a las reglas y pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita piensa comprar fertilizantes químicos para abonar su chacra de gladiolos y de ese modo tener una buena producción en el mes de octubre.
texts.en:
Marcos is 25 years old and a very charismatic young man. He lives with his mother and his sister whom he loves a lot. Five years ago he started to plant flowers (gladiolus) on his mother’s small farm and other times on rented land. Since he was 18 he has grown peas which has gone very well. Therefore, in the interest of increasing his income, he started to plant flowers. The flowers are very profitable in the months of May and October, and he has earned more than he foresaw. Depending on how the market is, he can sell a dozen flowers for 80 soles. Each package (as he shows us in the photo) sells for 6 or 7 soles. Therefore he prefers to plant so that he harvests in the times of highest demand since he financially helps his mother and his younger sister in her studies, which gives him great satisfaction. This is the first time that he has had the opportunity to access a loan with MFP and it is due to the invitation of a member of a community bank who recommended him. Marcos commits to adhering to the rules and being punctual in all of his payments. With the money he is asking for right now he will buy chemical fertilizers to fertilize the plot of gladiolus flowers and therefore have a good production in the month of October.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertlizers

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita D. C. is from the village of Catarman. She is 54, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Merlita owns & operates a business providing hairdressing & beauty services to local community members. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Merlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlita repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to purchase materials for her beauty shop. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Merlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: John

texts.en: John S. is a Tanzanian an entrepreneur small business married man. He runs a business of Tailoring mart sewing different types of clothes including school uniforms at Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. He makes both men and women wearing.  He purchases the business materials from the whole and retail shops in Dar es Salaam. He purchases two sewing machines from the business income and meets his daily family demand. He needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to meet his business demand

loans.use: To buy more business materials

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma es una socia colaboradora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, tiene 52 años es madre D. cuatro hijos mayores D. edad, se dedica a la costura, tiene un pequeño taller en su casa y cuenta con el apoyo D. esposo en todo momento. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Siete Estrellas” desD. hace siete años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que invirtió en telas, Vilma necesita un crédito D. 2000 soles que será utilizado para comprar telas, elásticos, blondas, pedrería para adornar. El sueño D. Vilma es tener un taller D. costura bien implementado.
texts.en:
Vilma is a collaborative and dynamic member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the province of Coronel Portillo. She is 52 years old and is the mother of 4 older children. She dedicates herself to sewing. She has a small workshop in her home, and she has her husband’s support at all times. She has been part of the Communal Bank “Siete Estrellas” [“Seven Stars”] for seven years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which she invested in fabrics. Vilma needs a loan of 2000 soles which she will use to buy fabrics, elastics, lace, and rhinestones for decoration. Vilma’s dream is to have a well-established sewing workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, elastics, lace, and rhinestones for decoration

loans.name: Ysolina

texts.es: La señora Ysolina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Rosales”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 32 años, es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.Ysolina, lleva 15 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo así implementar su propio taller de confección de vestidos y como tenia la habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado.Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus costuras, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. A quienes les  atiende  con la amabilidad y el carisma  que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grandes y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. Ysolina, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ysolina belongs to the Los Rosales Communal Bank in the San José de Sisa district, El Dorado province, San Martín department. She is 32, in a common law marriage, and has three children who are still dependent upon her. Ysolina has been making clothes for 15 years. Little by little she started generated her own income and saving money. She wanted to set up her own shop making clothes. As she has the ability to make clothes, she did not doubt that she could do it. With support from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos she decided to set up her own business, which is located in her own house. It is in a very well-equipped space. She tells us that her sewing is going very well for her. She works on orders that her customers place in advance. She waits on her customers with the friendliness and charisma that she is known for. She will use this loan for 1,500 PEN to buy meters of different types of fabric in different colors, instruments that she uses like scissors, large spools of different colors of thread, needles for sewing and for the machine, pins, and buttons. Ysolina now feels like a very fulfilled woman who has a great desire to achieve and make the rest of her dreams come true. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and also for helping so many other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meters of fabric, needles, and pins

loans.name: Epefinia

texts.en:
Epefinia T. is from the village of Tubod. She is 63 years old. Epefinia is married and has 12 adult children. To make a living, Epefinia owns and operates a dried fish vending business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish in the local community. Epefinia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Epefinia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Epefinia has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. Epefinia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 14th loan taken out by Epefinia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Khuk

texts.en: Khuk P. sells Khmer noodles to earn a living. She sells her food to neighbors for their breakfast and usually earns about $5 each day to help meet her family’s food needs. In her business, three of her school-aged kids assist her in selling noodles when they are free from studying. In addition, her husband works as a clothes-sewer from home (he appears in the picture). Khuk P. will use her loan to purchase essential ingredients for her business, as well as to buy equipment for her husband’s tailoring business.

loans.use: For ingredients for her business, and equipment for her husband’s tailoring business

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en: Joumana has been working as a home-based tailor since 1980 to help her husband provide better conditions for their children. Today, Joumana is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a new sewing machine to expand her business productivity.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Zaida

texts.en:
Zaida V. has three wishes she hopes to fulfill in the next few years: first, that her youngest son finish his studies and get a good job; second, to be able to purchase additional appliances for her home; and third, to expand her business so that she can ultimately improve her family's living conditions. Zaida is 50 years old. Her husband, Ernesto, works as a tricycle driver and also helps manage their duck-raising business. They have four children with one still attending school. The family lives in the village of Mambagaton, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental.

Zaida raises ducks and sells the duck eggs to several regular customers in nearby villages, towns and cities. She thought of this business because their location is very conducive to duck raising with mostly farmlands in the surrounding area.

In 2003, she joined NWTF Project Dungganon to access additional capital for her business. When she received her loan, she used it to buy more ducks and feed. Now her operation is big enough that she has hired a caretaker to watch the ducks (she now has more than 350 ducks and they produce more than 200 eggs per day). She now earns a monthly income of about 24,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) and she saves most of this for the education of her youngest son and also to defray household expenses.

Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP was used as additional capital for her duck-raising business. She was able to repay her loan on time and in full without delays, and she has maintained her good record. Now on her 14th loan cycle, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP which she intends to use as working capital so that she can buy eggs from other duck raisers to meet the demand of her customers.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Tanekasu Ii Group

texts.en:
These are a group of small-scale entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They formed themselves into a group they named Tanekasu II in order to apply for a loan from Kiva lenders through SMT. They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to expand their businesses, both in terms of size and quality. Consequently, their sales and income level will improve so that they can better support themselves and their children.

On the left in the photo is Mohamed S., the leader of this group of five. Mohamed was born in Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone about thirty-seven years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and they now live in Magburaka town together with their five children. Their children are attending secondary and primary schools respectively.

Mohamed is a carpenter. He has been in this profession for more than fifteen years now. He wants a loan in order to buy working materials and make nice beds to sell. Thus with his share of this loan, he will buy boards, polish, nails, casters, velvet cloth and so on. (Attached on the left is a group member not present for the group snapshot.)

loans.use: Buy boards, polish, nails, casters, velvet cloth and so on

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en: Purevsuren is 53 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Arkhangai province of central Mongolia. His wife works as a nurse at the local hospital. His 21-year-old daughter and his son are in high school. Purevsuren is a trained carpenter who started his wooden furniture business in 1992 and has been steadily growing his business in the 18 years since. When he began his business, Purevsuren's working capital was approximately 100,000 tugrugs (approx. $70 USD). However, with a lot of hard work and good business practices his working capital is currently approximately 1,618,000 tugrugs (approx. $1,110 USD). Using his business profits, he was able to purchase a large Korean truck to use not only in transporting his goods, but also in earning money as a transportation service for other people. Purevsuren is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 tugrugs in order to purchase more wood and tools to keep his carpentry business growing.

loans.use: To purchase wood and tools

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is a 33-year-old young man who is the father of two sons and one daughter. He owns a clothing store which he started fourteen years ago. He has gained very good experience in this field. He appears in the photo at his store.

Due to the current financial hardship in Palestine, Murad’s business has deteriorated. Therefore, he thought of taking a $1000 loan from FATEN to buy more clothes which will attract more customers to his store and increase his income.

Murad adds that his store is located in the heart of the commercial souq (market) of Jineen which gives him a better chance to sell more clothes than other stores.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, es una mujer muy alegre, vive en el Distrito de Yarina cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 31 años, es madre de dos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos y chupetes, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, actualmente se encuentra separada de su pareja. Rosa forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Dalinas II”, desde hace 2 años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de gaseosas y agua embotellada, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 500 soles, que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas e insumos para sus chupetes y refrescos. La meta de Rosa es, tener una bodega bien surtida la cual le permita generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very happy woman. She lives in the District of Yarina cocha, Ucayali region. She is 31 years of age and the mother of two under-age children. She is dedicated to the sale of refreshments and popsicles. She carries out this activity in her house. At present she is separated from her husband. Rose has been part of the “Las Dalinas II” Communal Bank for 2 years. The first loan that she received was of 300 soles, that was invested in the purchase of carbonated beverages and bottled water. Now she needs a loan of 500 soles, that will be invested in the purchase of carbonated beverages and supplies for her popsicles and refreshments. The goal of Rose is to have a well supplied convenience store, which will permit her to generate a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy carbonated beverages and supplies for making popsicles and refreshments

loans.name: Ruzimurod

texts.ru: Раджабов Рузимурод проживает в районе Вахш. Возраст, 43 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Рузимурод более 12 лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном откармливает и продает мелко- рогатый скот. Этот бизнес приносит ему доход. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количество. Ризимурод хочет расширить свой бизнес. Он намерен продавать их в оптом по более выгодной цене.
texts.en:
Ruzimurod R. lives in the Vakhsh district. He is 43 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife takes care of the household. Ruzimurod has been involved in animal husbandry for over 12 years. He primarily raises and sells small livestock. This business brings him an income. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock in order to increase its quantity. Ruzimurod wants to expand his business. He intends to sell livestock wholesale at a more profitable price.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Eldard

texts.en:
N. Eldard is a 36-year-old married man with eight children. For the last four years, he has been selling coffee as a means of subsistence. He began the business in Rugaga trading center in Bushenyi district with only 100,000 Ugandan shillings. At length, banking on his hard work ethic, he was able to increase his capital in a short period of time to 2.5 million shillings.

Currently Eldard’s business generates him close to 150,000 shillings a month. This is little money by any Ugandan standards but it’s with this paltry monthly earnings that he has struggled to educate all his children.

Being a resolutely hardworking and experienced businessman Eldard remains upbeat that he is going to succeed. The one vital resource he has invariably relied on to keep his business afloat has been that friendly chord he has struck with his customers. The high quality coffee he sells is in high favor with many people and coffee outlets.

Eldard’s dream and future plan, as he makes steady progress in his business, is to have his own hybrid coffee plantations so that, from them, he can harvest coffee which he can competitively sell at a higher market price. It is for this reason that he requires a loan.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality parchment coffee to sell to his customers and coffee marketing unions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a new motor for a vehicle

loans.name: Leonides

texts.es:
Leonides tiene 52 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Marcelino de 72 años y el último de sus hijos. Anteriormente, con su primera pareja tuvo 2 hijas mujeres que trabajan independientemente.

Se caracteriza por tener un espíritu emprendedor y desde hace 30 años se dedica a la siembra de papa, arveja, maíz y lechuga en sus terrenos propios. Eventualmente recibe la ayuda de su esposo, quien también trabaja como operario ganando a diario 20 soles. 
Como otra fuente de ingresos crían dos vacas, que les generan leche para elaborar diariamente quesos que venden entre sus vecinos. 
Para el futuro, piensa instalar una tienda de venta de comestibles en una casa que tiene en una zona céntrica de su localidad, pues quiere dejar de realizar trabajos pesados.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y como es una mujer muy activa y luchadora a diario ahorra para que puntualmente pague sus aportaciones en la fecha indicada. Además, asegura que le agrada laborar con su banco comunal, ya que todos son puntuales. Con el dinero que solicita comprará 30 sacos de guano de corral, 10 sacos de papa y otros sacos de fertilizante.
texts.en:
Leonides is 52 years old and lives in her own home along with her spouse, 72 year old Marcelino, and the youngest of her children. With her first partner she had 2 daughters who work independently. She has a very enterprising spirit, and for 30 years she has grown potatoes, peas, corn and lettuce on her own land. Her husband also helps her by working as a labourer and earning 20 soles a day. Another source of income is raising cattle, which gives them milk every day to make cheeses with, which they sell to their neighbours. In the future, she's thinking of setting up a food store in a house she has in a central location, as she would like to do less heavy labour. This is the second loan that she's had with MFP and, as she is a very active and hard working woman, she saves up to be able to make all of her payments on time. Moreover, she tells us that she enjoys working with her communal bank, since everyone pays on time. With the money she's requesting, she will buy 30 bags of guano fetilizer, 10 bags of potatoes, and some other bags of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of guano fertilizer, seeds, and other fertilizer

loans.name: Aïssata

texts.fr:
Née le 10 Janvier 1981 à Sikasso, Aïssata Kouyaté est marée et mère 3 enfants. Elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants à Hamdallaye Extension, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Aïssata Kouyaté, après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à l’activité d’achat et  de vente d’habillements (pagnes Wax, de tissus brodés) de chaussures  etc. Elle mène son activité à son domicile et au marché de Hamdallaye où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant deux ans. Après 4 prêts solidaires dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son premier prêt individuel. Ses prêts solidaires précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 10 pièces de pagne Wax, 8 complets de tissus brodés. Elle achète ses marchandises à Bobo Dioulasso (république de Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes..
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born 10 January 1981 in Sikasso, Aïssata Kouyaté is married and the mother of three children. She lives with her husband and children in Hamdallaye Extension, one of the populous boroughs in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After a number of unsuccessful ventures, Mrs. Aïssata Kouyaté began to trade in clothing: pagnes Wax (colourful West African clothing fabric), embroidered fabrics, shoewear, etc. She conducts her business from her home and at the Hamdallaye market, where she is much in demand due to the quality of her products. To satisfy an increasing customer base, she decided two years ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI. Following four group loans as part of a group of neighbourhood women, she is now requesting her first individual loan. Her preceding group loans were all correctly reimbursed. With her loan she intends to buy 10 pagnes wax, and 8 complete sets of embroidered clothes. She gets her merchandise from Bobo Dioulasso (in the Republic of Burkina Faso) before retailing it for cash or credit, to mainly women customers. She hopes to attain a monthly profit of 95,000 FCFA which will be used to increase her working capital, contribute towards family expenses and paying back her loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plothing

loans.name: Hour

texts.en:
Hour K., 22, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She and her husband sell fish for an income of about $15 USD per day. 

K. is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to purchase more fish to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. The photo shows Hour K. appears with her family.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is a 45-year-old widow who has four children. Her children are 13-25 years old and three are in school.  

Speciose is an industrious woman.  She purchased a milling machine that she uses to grind food items for the local farmers.  For example, when the cassava is harvested, the farmers often want to grind a portion of it into flour to preserve it for a longer period of time.  She also grows onions, Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes, and other crops that she sells in the market.
 
She is requesting a loan to start her own wholesale store stocked with enough food to sell to local merchants.  This will increase her capital and prevent her from having to move from market to market.

About the bank:
Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) is a public limited company established to provide financial services as a ladder of opportunity to the poor and small entrepreneurs for whom access to formal financial capital is currently limited. UOB's vision is to be a sustainable financial institution achieving significant economic, social and spiritual transformational impact on the underprivileged of Rwanda through a variety of products and related training in a way that reflects the love of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy more food products to sell and to develop a permanent wholesale store

loans.name: Richar Jaime

texts.es:
Richar de 37 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil ( zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución). El tiene un taller radio técnico, arregla radios, equipos de sonido, televisores, etc. 

Por la falta de oportunidades el tuvo que trabajar reparando equipos eléctricos y así mantener a su esposa y sus cinco hijos,  aprendió en un curso que estuvo. Desde ese tiempo el se ha dedicado a trabajar en su taller, trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm. 

Para continuar con su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo repuestos para los equipos eléctricos, en el futuro el quiere adecuar mejor su vivienda para que sus hijos estén mas cómodos.
texts.en:
Richar, age 37, lives in Paraíso, (periurban area with an ecology that is breaking down). He has a radio technician shop. He fixes radios, sound equipment, and televisions, etc. For the lack of opportunities, he had to work repairing electrical equipment in order to support his wife and their five children. He learned in a course that he took. After that he has devoted himself to working in his workshop. He works from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. In order to continue with his business he wants to use the loan to buy replacement parts for electrical equipment. In the future he wants to adapt his house better so that their children will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacement parts

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia T. is from the village of Tinaclaan Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old and married with one adult child. To make a living, Lilia provides women's tailoring services to local community members. Lilia has had her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Eveling

texts.es: La Sra. Eveling A. D. E.  vive en la el Barrio 30 D. marzo en la calle Taropé, D. la zona del 5to anillo y radial 10, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida que entrega a los pensionados que tiene D. una empresa que se encuentra al frente D. su casa, todos lo días se levanta muy temprano para comenzar con las labores en cocina ya que tiene que entregar 25 almuerzos completos y algunos más que le piden extra, la Sra. Eveling necesita el crédito para comprar un horno y una cocina nueva que son las herramientas D. trabajo diario que ella necesita, en la foto se pueD. observar la cocina donD. a diario prepara sus platos. La Sra. Eveling ha trabajado con créditos en emprender desD. el año 2008, desD. entonces se ha caracterizado por ser una cliente ejemplar, carismática, responsable y trabajadora. Ella desea que todos sus hijos terminen la universidad para así sentirse satisfecha con todo el esfuerzo que realiza diariamente al preparando comida para generar sustentos para las mejores condiciones D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eveling A. D. E. lives in the 30 D. Marzo neighbourhood, on Tarope street. She works at the preparation of food, which she delivers to some retirees who have a store in the front of their house. Every day, she gets up very early to begin her work in the kitchen, since she has to deliver 25 finished meals, as well as extras on request. Eveling needs this loan to buy a new oven and stove, which are tools that she needs for her daily work. In the photo, she can be seen with the stove on which she prepares her dishes daily. Eveling has worked with loans from Emprender since 2008. Since that time she has proven herself to be a model client; charismatic, responsible and hard working. She would like to see all her children complete university. That would make all her daily work preparing food to create a better quality of life for her family worthwhile.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a stove and oven

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles D. is 36 years old. He deals with second-hand clothes (Mitumba) in Bombolulu. He is a single man  and supports two siblings in his family who live in Kongowea. Charles has been in the business for two years now and his business has been a success.

This marks his first borrowing from KADET and he plans to add more stock of clothes and supply to the tender which he has won. He intends to use the anticipated profit to purchase more stock of clothes and for his personal use.

Charles hopes to expand his business to other locations in Mombasa in the near future.

loans.use: To add more clothing stock

loans.name: Pocitos Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Pocitos”, es un grupo que está iniciando el ciclo número 11, consta de ocho integrantes, a la cabeza  se encuentra la señora Teodora como presidenta, la señora Valentina como tesorera y la señora Clara como Secretaria de Actas.

La  señora presidenta, tuvo como negocio el tejido de mantas a pedido. La venta se realizaba en su domicilio, lo mismo que la producción.  Más o menos comenzó su negocio cuando ingresó a Pro Mujer por primera vez, es decir que ya tiene cuatro años en el rubro. Su primer crédito fue de Bs.500.- con el que compro lana para elaborar las mantas. Su solicitud actual es de Bs. 2000.- para iniciar otro negocio, que es la venta de “Salchipapas” (comida rápida, compuesta de papas fritas, trozos de salchichas fritas y aderezos como mayonesa, mostaza, llajua.

Con respecto a su permanencia en Pro Mujer, ella ya está más de cuatro años en su asociación.

Las integrantes de la A.C. “Pocitos” tienen diferentes negocios, entre ellos: venta de comida, venta de salchipapas, venta de cosméticos, venta de calzados, tejido y venta de mantas
texts.en:
The “Pocitos” (Little Wells) communal bank is starting its 11th cycle. It has 8 members led by Teodora, President, Valentina, Treasurer and Clara, Recording Secretary. Madame President had a business weaving blankets on order. Sales as well as production took place at her home. She more or less started the business when she joined Pro Mujer for the first time, that is to say, she’s been in this line of work for 4 years. Her first loan was for Bs.500 that she used to buy wool to make the blankets. The current loan request is for Bs.2000 to start another business: Salchipapas sales (fast food consisting of fried potatoes with pieces of fried sausage and dressings like mayonnaise, mustard and llajua, a spicy tomato and chili sauce). With respect to her history with Pro Mujer, she’s been in her association for over four years. The members of the “Pocitos” communal bank have a variety of businesses among which are: food sales, salchipapas sales, cosmetics sales, shoe sales, blanket weaving and sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cooking oil, potatoes and sausages.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 30 years old, married and has a two-year-old child.  For three years, she has been running Hope medical clinic to earn a living.  Her business is located in the slums hence most of her customers are low-income earners.  She has been running her business with one employee.  She says that she joined Faulu Kenya in the Kingstone Self Help group. 

She has seen a big improvement in her business especially after completing her first loan.  She adds that she is aiming to achieve more with Faulu Kenya.  She has requested for 40, 000 Kes to decorate her clinic so as to attract more customers.  In five years, she sees herself having a very big business premise.

loans.use: To decorate her clinic to attract more customers

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
Bernarda is part of the communal bank “Esperanza de Colombo” and resides in the city of San Vicente.  A little less than two years ago Bernarda lost all her possessions when her house burned down, including the merchandise for her retail business of eight years, selling new clothing items for both adults and children. Since then she has worked with the Kiva partner, Fondo Esperanza, as it is conveniently offering low interest rate loans. 

She is a seamstress and for the past two years she has been selling used clothing at a street market located centrally in the city. Bernarda manages her stand only on Wednesdays and Sundays, and the other days she conducts sales from her house. 

With this loan Bernarda will purchase used clothing, toys, and cosmetics to sell. She is the mother of four, but only the youngest still resides with her, the seven year old.  She dreams of one day owning her own centrally located store and managing it every day of the week. 

San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a commune zone in the center of Chile, belonging to the Region of Libertador General Bernardo O’Higgins, located on the banks of the Estero Zamorano River. San Vincente de Tagua Tagua's main source of income is based on the production of lemons, oranges, and avocados.

loans.use: To buy used clothing, toys and cosmetic Items to resell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita H. is from the village of Wigan Cordon. She is 48 years old. Teresita is married. To make a living, Teresita raises livestock, primarily pigs for fattening and sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells one of her pigs.

In 2006, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP, which she will use to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the eighth loan taken by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Segundo Silvio

texts.es:
Segundo es maestro constructor, vive son su esposa y tres hijos en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Desde pequeño el aprendió ha construir casas y a hacer diferentes actividades de arreglo de casa pero cuando se caso tubo que hacer la enseñanza en practica para poder mantener a su familia. En la actualidad el es maestro constructor tiene contratos en diferentes partes trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 18h00pm, el le paga a un ayudante $ 10.00 diarios. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar herramientas y materiales de construcción para trabaja con sus propios materiales. En el futuro quiere mejorar su casa para que su familia este mas cómoda.
texts.en:
Segundo is a master builder.  He lives with his wife and three children in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a peri-urban area with dirt roads whose houses are located in the mountains).

Since he was a young boy he has been learning to build houses and carry out different household repairs.  When he got married he had to put his education into practice in order to be able to support his family. He is currently a master builder and has contracts in a number of places.  He works from 7.00am to 6.00pm.  He pays an assistant $10.00 a day.

With his loan he would like to buy tools and building equipment so that he can work with his own equipment.  In the future, he would like to improve his house so that his family can be more comfortable.

loans.use: Tools and equipment

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely G. is from the village of Mangayang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old. Fely is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Fely is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Brgy. Mangayang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old single woman living with her mother and one brother.  She has owned a small grocery store since 1997. Her store is located in a busy area so she has been able, over the years, to gain a good number of customers among those passing by her shop. She cooperates with her brother to provide better life conditions for their family. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store’s inventory. She expects that her business will continue to grow in the coming year. 

It is very common in Lebanon to find small supermarkets selling perishable and non-perishable goods. As members of the communities themselves, store owners have a deep understanding of local consumer needs and can offer products that meet local demands. The strong network of community relationships are an important component of life in Lebanon, especially in smaller towns and villages.

loans.use: to increase her store inventory

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen H. is a 58-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:  general store, rice dealer and cafeteria businesses. She lives in Brgy. 4, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  

By working hard in her general store, rice dealer and cafeteria businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 23,000.  Carmen is now borrowing PHP 18,000 so that she  can purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  

Carmen aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Jason's Group

texts.en:
Jason T. is from the village of Duminit, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 22 years old. Jason is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jason is married and has 1 infant. Jason owns & operates a vegetable selling business. He has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jason joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. He is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his 2nd loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement his family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jessica; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza y también tiene un negocio de una constructura, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6.00 p.m, por medio de estos trabajos la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de constructora. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una maquina mezcladora para su constructora.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jessica is a member of the “KANTU” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Jessica is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling beauty products.  She also has a construction business.  Jessica works from 8.00am to 6.00pm and, through her work, she gets her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand her construction business.

Jessica is requesting this loan to buy a cement mixer for her construction business.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy a cement mixer for her construction business

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Hawa. She is married and has five dependents. For the past 15 years, Hawa has been selling local foodstuffs in the city of Freetown. She began her business as a way of generating income to provide a livelihood for her family. She opens her business six days a week for 10 hours a day.

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 Sierra Leone leones. Hawa requires a loan in order to expand her business as a way of increasing her profit margin. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more local foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot Balumyan is single and lives with his father and mother. With a university degree, Ashot is engaged in an agricultural business which is the main source of the family's income. Concerned with the critical state of the economy, Ashot does his best to perpetuate the profit which will help him to build a well-provided life for his future family.

To expand the business Ashot has applied to SEF to purchase two high quality milk cows. Ashot’s dream is to increase the family’s profit and be able to have his own family.

loans.use: To buy two milk cows

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Rafaela casada, mujer trabajadora, su esposo de professión albañil, tiene dos hijos menores de edad. Su proyecto mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda que están en malas condiciones dándole a sus familia un mejor bienestar, agricultura desde muy joven de edad inicio a cosechar la tierra y con apoyo del suegro que le brindo los conocimientos necesario para el mantenimiento. Ha logrado tener su finca  con producción de piña. 
Sus planes son mejorar los cultivos con la aplicación de fertilizantes, para tener una mayor producción, coloración y sabor  de piña.
texts.en: Rafaela is married,  she is a hardworking woman, her husband is a construction worker and she has two young children.  Her project is the betterment of her home's infrastructure which is in bad condition so that she can give her family a better life. As a farmer from a young age she started working the land and with the support of her father in law who gave her the necessary know-how for maintenance of the land.  She was able to have her own pineapple farm.  Her plans are to improve her land with fertilizer to have a better production, color and taste from the pineapple.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sapargul's Group

texts.ru:
Сапаргуль Вахапова, 35 лет, лидер этой группы, полна энергичности и мотивации чтобы усовершенствовать свой бизнес, фундамент которого был проложен 12 лет тому назад. Связав семейные узы Сапаргуль и ее супруг, как и большинство узгенских семей сделали первые скромные шаги в животноводстве. Тогда Сапаргуль даже не догадывалась, что 5000 сомов стартового капитала будут пожалуй самым выгодным вложением в ее карьере. Животноводство всегда было социально важным занятием для местных поселений наряду с земледелием и торговлей. Уже в раннем детстве Сапаргуль со сверстниками отправлялась пасти скот на пастбища с обилием свежей травы и родниковой воды. Да и сейчас наша клиентка очень ответственно подходит к вопросу о корме и условиях содержания скота. Она проводит регулярный осмотр скота у ветеринара, так как ее товар напрямую влияет на состояние здоровья потребителя. А для Сапаргуль удовлетворенность покупателей – это самое главное, так как это залог дальнейшего спроса. Но тучи сгустились над этим бизнесом в последние годы. Повышенные расходы стали понижать прибыль от бизнеса, а попытка ощутимо повысить цены на живность вызывала негодование у потребителей. Дошло до того, что месячная прибыль опустилась до отметки в 2 000 сомов, что было недостаточно даже чтобы обеспечить ежедневные нужды двоих детей, семиклассницы Акбермет и трехлетнего Эмира. Пожалуй это было последним толчком в сознании Сапаргуль и она решилась попробовать параллельно заниматься земледелием. В Узгене очень благоприятные условия для этого дела. Именно эта идея подтолкнула Сапаргуль к образованию группы, для получения кредита от Кивы. Конкретной целью кредита является закупка удобрений для весенней подготовки земли. 
       
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.
