To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.
texts.en: Sapargul V., 35 years old, is this group’s leader. She is full of energy and motivation to improve her business, which had been founded 12 years ago. After tying the marriage knot, Sapargul and her husband, like most families in Uzgen, took their first small steps in starting a livestock business. Back then, Sapargul could never have guessed that 5000 soms of starting capital would turn out to be possibly the best investment in all her career. Raising livestock always has been socially important for the local population, along with farming and trade. Already as a young girl, Sapargul would go together with her friends to guard farm animals at grazing fields with plenty of fresh grass and spring water. And now our client still takes the issue of nutrition and other living conditions of her livestock very responsibly. She has her animals regularly examined by  a veterinarian, since the products she sells have a direct impact on consumers’ health. In recent years, however, storm clouds have gathered over this business. An increase in expenditures led to a reduced business revenue, and the attempt to raise prices in a perceptible way has been met with anger by the consumers. It had come to the point that their monthly income fell all the way down to 2,000 soms, which was insufficient even to provide for the day-to-day needs of their two children: their daughter Akhbermet, who is in 7th grade, and their 3-year old son Emir. This was the last drop for Sapargul, and she decided to also go into agriculture as a parallel activity. Uzgen offers auspicious conditions for agriculture. This idea led Sparagul to forming a group in order to take out a loan from Kiva. The concrete purpose of this loan is purchasing fertilizer to prepare soil in the spring.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Neri

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” VILCANOTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba,  perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Neri; la socia tiene 44 años de edad, separada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende lo que son productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche también vende otro tipo de productos como golosinas,gaseosas,aceite,fideos entre otros, la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio el cual trabaja conjuntamente con su cuñada, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por sus hijos que son lo más importante que ella tiene.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar de más mercadería para la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "VILCANOTA" communal bank which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Neri is 44 years old, separated and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business.  She sells staple goods such as rice, sugar and milk and other items such as sweets, sodas, oil, pasta etc.  She has been in this business for some time now, together with her sister-in-law.  She is a cheerful person and determined to get ahead because her children are what matter most to her.

She is requesting a loan to buy more goods for her grocery store.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy grocery store goods

loans.name: Maria Socorro

texts.es:
María tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia,  en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La actividad que desarrolla el titular es la costura y manualidades que ella misma elabora ya que cuenta con una máquina de coser en la cual realiza sus confecciones. También se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral como pavos y gallinas los cuales engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 3 años en la parte posterior de casa. 

María desea comprar telas e hilos para la costura de ropa y la compra de alimentos. Es por ello, en el afán de seguir creciendo en su negocio ha creído conveniente obtener un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Maria is a 46-year-old married mother of two. She lives in her own home in the Tambogrande district, an agricultural zone located in the Piura region, over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Our client is in the sewing and handicraft business. She herself makes her products since she has a sewing machine with which to make them. She also raises poultry--turkey and chickens--which she fattens then sells at the local market. She has been raising poultry behind her house for 3 years.

Maria would like to purchase fabric and thread to sew clothing, and she would like to purchase feed. For this reason, in an effort to keep expanding her business, she thinks that it is appropriate to request a 1,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and chicken feed.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 45 years old,  a widow and has seven children between the ages of 12 and 23. All her children live at home with her.
For three years she has been selling bread, oil sugar and other food items. She started the business with money from her late husband. Sarah likes to be in business because she is responsible for it and to make it work. 
Sarah has requested a loan to purchase more bread, oil, sugar, rice and other products. She wants to save money so that in the future she can have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more bread, oil, sugar, rice and other products

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira A., 47, is the leader of this group. She is married and has seven kids, the youngest of whom is 14. With the help of her husband and children, she runs a family business. She has been a farmer for 18 years. Recently the revenues from a rich harvest were spent on purchasing livestock. Now she is learning the techniques of looking after cattle. Her initial capital was 3 000 soms and her monthly revenue is 6 000 soms. The purpose of the loan is the purchase of three head of livestock for further reselling.  Gulmira would really like to do major repairs on her house in future.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex lives in the Nakulabye Kiyaye Zone neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  Alex also takes care of additional family members (her late sister’s child).    Alex has a business selling milk.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Alex sells her products at the market.    

Alex has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more jerrycans of milk.    The main business challenge(s) for Alex include thieves and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow so that she can get profits to buy milk cans.      Alex lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of milk

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is 30 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. He has a small retail shop, which he has run for five years.
To help expand his business, Haruna has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as soap, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Haruna hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as soap, for resale.

loans.name: Batchimeg

texts.en:
Batchimeg is 37 years old and lives with her three children in her older brother's house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her three children all attend local secondary school. She manages a construction-material trading business at a rented stall at a trading center. Her older daughter helps with family business during her school vacation. 

Batchimeg started her business in 2000 and has been able to stabilize her business since then. She sells all kinds of work clothes, especially work gloves. Her work gloves imported from Korea are popular among her customers due to their quality and durability. Batchimeg is a polite and diligent woman who attributes her business success to her good accounting skills. She says: "I want to expand my business in order to earn more. Also I want my daughter to be educated and have a better job in the future." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase work gloves from Korea.

loans.use: To purchase work gloves from Korea

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
This is Encarnacion, 42, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Florante, a businessman, and she is the mother of their children. Together they work hard for a safe and secure future for their family.

Encarnacion operates a meat business. She buys live pigs, cows and chickens directly from hog raisers, livestock and poultry dealers, slaughters them, and then delivers them to the fast food chains. She has several fast food chain company patrons who buy the cut meat. They prefer Encarnacion’s products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. It is also a little cheaper to buy meat from an independent meat dealer than the ones in the market who sometimes use the services of professional slaughter houses for their meat. The cost of slaughter is added to the final price of the cut meat and passed along to the customers. Thus, Encarnacion has many patrons who regularly anticipate her meat. Her regular customers are Chowking and Teriyaki Boy. She earns a minimum of PHP 933 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000. She will be using the loan to buy meat and chicken to be delivered to fast food chains. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Encarnacion hopes that her business will continue to be successful, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and be finished with their studies. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for meat and chicken for her business.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio tiene 66 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Emilio desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que llegan a su crecimiento ideal los ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o los vende en el mercado de Tambogrande, con los ingresos que obtenga solventará sus obligaciones familiares.  También cuenta con tierras de cultivo donde siembra arroz y limón, una vez que cosecha lo comercializa y tiene otro ingreso para su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más alimentos balanceados para tenerlos bien alimentados y así podrá ofrecerlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Emilio es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus  hijos tengan otras oportunidades de estudio y tener algunas comodidades.
texts.en:
Emilio is 66 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in his own home which only has electricity.  His home is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  The main business activities in this area are farming, livestock raising and handicraft production.

Emilio has been raising and selling sheep for some years.  His pen is located behind his home and he feeds his animals balanced feed and natural pasture.  Once they have reached an ideal level of growth, he sells them to the people in his area or in Tambogrande market.  He uses the income that he makes to cover his family's financial needs.  Emilio also owns farmland where he grows rice and lemons.  Once he has harvested his crops, he sells them and this makes him an additional income for his household.

Emilio has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more balanced feed so that he can keep his animals well fed and thereby be able to sell them to his customers for the best price possible.  This will enable him to repay his loan and improve his family's quality of life.  Emilio is a hard-working and very responsible person and all he wants is for his children to have more educational opportunities and some comforts in life.

loans.use: to buy more balanced feed for his sheep

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 32 years old and married to John. They are blessed with one five-year-old child. She has been selling tissues and rice for the past two years, making a monthly income of 5,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to add tissues and sacks of rice for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her  dream is to open a wholesale shop which will improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy tissues and sacks of rice for resale.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Лариса родилась в 1952 г. в городе Капан. Она замужем и имеет двух сыновей: старшему 28 лет, младшему 27. Муж работает мастером в мебельном цехе. Старший сын Ларисы женат и живет отдельно, младший сын проживает в Российской Федерации.
С 2002 года Лариса занимается собственным бизнесом: продает женскую, мужскую одежду и обувь в арендованном торговое месте на Капанской городской ярмарке.  Лариса приобретает товары из Еревана один раз в месяц. Она работает  без выходных и по мере возможностей помогает мужу содержать семью.
Ларисе необходим кредит на сумму 300.000 драм для приобретения осенней одежды в преддверии начало нового студенческого учебного года.
Данный кредит является для Ларисы 9-ым по счету и она никогда не задерживала выплат по кредиту.
texts.en: Larisa G. was born in 1952 in the city of Kapan. She is married and has two children - the oldest is 28 years old and the youngest - 27. Her husband works as a master cabinet maker in the locale furniture factory. Larisa's older son is married and lives with his own family and the youngest son is working in Russia. Since 2002 Larisa has been managing her own business: she sells women's and men's shoes and clothes in a rented market stall at the Kapan's city market. Larisa travels to the capital city of Erevan once a month. She does not take weekends off and so helps her husband and her family's income. Larisa needs a loan of 300,000 dram to purchase clothing for the fall season in preparation for the starting college school year. This is Larisa's 9th loan with KIVA and she has never been late to pay back her debt.

loans.use: to purchase fall season young adult clothes for resale

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 53 years old and married with five children. Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Lourdes has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To service his motor bike.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is an elementary graduate; she did not have the chance to enter high school or college because her parents had no capacity to send her to school. Nenita is married to a farmer and blessed with seven children. 
Nenita and her husband work together to do their best for their children's future. Two of their children are in high school or college. Nenita’s family is united in the desire to carry itself out of poverty. 
Nenita needs additional capital of 12,000 PHP to buy herbal medicines and soap to sell. She decided to take this loan to maintain her business. Through the income she generates from the business, she is able to finance her household's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy additional herbal medicines and soap to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a single 22-year old. He is a focused businessman. For the last two years, he has been managing a tailoring business to earn a living. In the next 5 years, he wants to become more financially stable. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric for making pillows and cushion covers. Thanks to Faulu Kenya's previous loans, he has been able to manage his business.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making pillows and cushion covers

loans.name: Andres Epifanio

texts.es: El señor Andrés Epifanio tiene 41 años tiene 2 hijos que están bajo su cargo. El se dedica a la venta de combustible ya que él vive en una comarca donde este producto es muy solicitado. A pesar de tener competencia siempre está buscando el medio para atraer a sus clientes, Andrés tiene que viajar hasta la ciudad para comprar este producto y venderlo a precio accesible a sus mejores clientes. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de combustible. El siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario.  Andrés se encuentra contento por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Andrés Epifanio, 41, has two children in his care.  He sells fuel, since he lives in an area where this product is in high demand.  Despite being experienced, he is always looking for ways to attract his customers.  Andrés has to go to the city to buy this product and sell it at an accessible price to his best customers.

The loan he is requesting is to buy fuel.

He has always been concerned about providing his family with the necessities.  Andrés is happy about the loan and is committed to making the repayments.

loans.use: to buy fuel.

loans.name: Fabulous, Virtuous Women (B) Group

texts.en:
Lonchin lives in Harare with her husband and two children.  She makes peanut butter, which she sells locally. She has been doing this for the last four years. They also have income from her husband's job as driver for a community bus.

The business faces competition but is faring well. Lonchin will use the money she has borrowed to buy raw materials and packaging.  She hopes to be able to borrow more money in the future to buy more equipment.  Over time, Lonchin wants to expand the business to help support the family.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials and packaging

loans.name: Olga Florinda

texts.es:
La señora Olga Florinda es casada, tiene 43 años D. edad, cursó el sexto año D. educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 1 D. los cuales aun esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta D. ropa para mujeres, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien la apoya con los gastos que realiza.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para para los estudios D. su hijo ya que próximamente se estará graduando en la secundaria, espera mejorar su condición D. vida con la educación D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Olga Florinda is married and 43 years old. She finished her 6th year of primary school. She has 3 children, one of which is studying. She works in a store selling women’s clothing. She has the support of her husband who helps her with the fees she incurs. 

She asks for a loan which she will use for her son’s studies since he will next be a secondary school graduate. She hopes to improve her living conditions with the education of her children.

loans.use: to pay for school costs.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 30 years old, single, and a college graduate, but she has not been fortunate to find better sources of income like a white collar job due to the current employment crisis. So instead of suffering from the difficulty of life, she has built her own business. She is now earning income from buying and selling rice. She has been in this business five years and is slowly reaching progress. To continue this operation, she is asking for a loan amount P13,000 to buy rice as an additional goods to sell. She hopes with the help of this loan she will be able to earn a higher income to improve her underprivileged living.

loans.use: to buy rice as an additional good to sell.

loans.name: Rajabaly

texts.ru: Ражабали 27 лет, женат, воспитывает двух детей. Ражабали работает в стоматологической поликлинике и параллельно занимается животноводством, что является очень хорошей поддержкой в покрытии расходов молодой семьи.  Стартовав в этом бизнесе с суммы в 20,000 сом  (KGS), Ражабали приложил все усилия для развития своего хозяйства  и добился успеха – на сегодняшний день его ферма с двумя дойными коровами и 25 баранами приносят ежемесячный доход в сумме около 10,000 сом от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ражабали обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота для откорма.  Доходы от кредита Ражабали планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья домашней скотины.
texts.en: Rajabaly is a 27-year old father of two. He is married. Rajabaly works in a dental clinic. At the same time, he is involved in animal husbandry, which is very helpful in covering the young family's costs. Having launched this business with a starting capital of 20,000 som (KGS), Razhabali made ​​every effort to make it successful. Today the profits from the sales of dairy and meat products from his farm, which now has two dairy cows and 25 sheep, yield about 10,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to further develop this business, Razhabaly turned to "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional cattle for fattening. Rajabali plans to invest the income from this loan into increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mamani Aycaya

texts.es: La Sra. Máxima  tiene como actividad  la venta de ropa interior y medias de forma ambulante en el mercado la Pampa de la ciudad de Cochabamba; la mercadería la adquiere en Oruro posteriormente los comercializa en Cochabamba, tiene experiencia de 1 año en esta actividad; su familia compuesta por su esposo y sus 3  hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar ; su esposo el Sr. Juan es empleado publico quien trabaja en la ciudad de La Paz; la casa donde vive es en alquiler la cual esta ubicada al sud de la ciudad,  una zona periurbana;  el crédito que se le otorga es para la compra de mercadería ropa interior y variedad de medias con esta actividad logra sustentar a sustentar a su familia.
texts.en: Máxima's business is selling underwear and socks as an itinerant vendor in La Pampa market, in the city of Cochabamba.  She acquires her merchandise in Oruro and then sells it in Cochabamba.  She has one year's experience in this business.  Her family consists of her husband and her three school-age children.  Her husband, Juan, is a civil servant and works in the city of La Paz.  They rent their house and it is located in the south of the city, in a peri-urban area.  Máxima will use her loan to buy merchandise (underwear and a variety of socks).  Through this business, she manages to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes)

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia, a 42-year-old married mother of five, works hard to provide for her family. She has run a sari-sari store in the Philippines for seven years and also earns an income from her food-vending business. Having borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF, Amalia is now requesting a PHP 17,000 loan to buy a stock of groceries to sell in her store.

Amalia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María   se dedica  a la venta de frutas y legumbres  desde hace  cinco años ella nos cuenta  que le gusta mucho su negocio por que le  deja buenas ganancias y ayuda  a las personas que lo consumen.
Esta felizmente casada  con el señor Miguel  quien se dedica  a la siembra y corta y venta de limones.
Ellas nos cuenta que tambien se dedica a la venta de comida.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más fruta y legumbres para la venta.
Le da  las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para  salir adelante y obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
María has made a living selling fruits and vegetables for the past 5 years. She tells us that she really likes her business because it makes a good profit and helps those that purchase there.

She is happily married to Miguel who makes a living planting, harvesting and selling limes. She tells us that she also works selling food. 

She asked for this loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale. She thanks the foundation for the support it has given her in order to get ahead and make a better income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Maweu

texts.en:
Maweu is 45 years old, married and has three children. He repairs shoes to earn a living. He has been in this business for 14 years. Maweu describes his business environment as good because of limited competition. 
Since Maweu joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya he has been able to educate his children. In the future, he hopes to open a shoe shop and be financially stable. Maweu has applied for a loan of 70,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy sewing thread and shoe soles.

loans.use: to buy sewing thread and shoe soles.

loans.name: Sarangerel

texts.en:
Sarangerel, 48, is a shoe seller. She lives with her family in the ger district in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Sarangerel sells her shoes in a bazaar in the suburban district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running her business for 7 years and she has many permanent customers. The Lunar Year is approaching. It is a traditional and respectful Mongolian celebration. The demand for commodities such as shoes will increase notably during these days. Therefore, she wants to prepare her commodities in advance of the celebration, which is a big opportunity for merchants. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing shoes in large quantities in order to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of shoes to increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub is 24 years of age, married and blessed with a one year old child. He owns a carpentry shop, a business he started four years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

He has requested a second loan of KES. 40,000 to purchase a plane and smoothing machine for the workshop. 

The profit he earns will aid him to repay his loan and expand his workshop. His dream is to see his business succeed.

loans.use: To purchase a plane and smoothing machine.

loans.name: Norma Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Norma se dedica a la venta de comidas, desde hace mas de 7 años, tiene una hija de 19 años, ella le ayuda en la venta de comida. Norma utilizara su crédito, para comprar utensilios y materia prima, que le permita tener mayor variedad de alimentos,que le demandan sus clientes.
el sueño de Norma es llegar a tener un local, de comidas mas grande en el centro de la ciudad.ya que donde vende actualmente es un espacio muy pequeño.Norma acudió a nuestra ayuda, para así poder incrementar sus ventas y en un futuro hacer su sueño realidad.
texts.en: Norma has been selling food for more than 7 years.  She has a 19-year-old daughter who helps her sell the food.  Norma will use her loan to buy utensils and raw materials to have a wider variety of food her customers are requesting.  Norma’s dream is to acquire a larger food place downtown because where she sells now is too small.  Norma requested help to increase sales and in future make her dream reality.

loans.use: to buy utensils.

loans.name: Las Retamitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS RETAMAS” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Máxima es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de ferretería, venta de zapatillas y ropa, venta de edredones, venta de gorras de alpaca, taller de costura, elaboración de resorteras, confección de mantas, reparación de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Máxima es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de detergentes; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, al ayudar a su madre en la comercialización del mismo negocio, pasado el tiempo decide emprender un espacio independiente de negocio donde actualmente vende.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de detergentes) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.

loans.use: Compra de detergentes

loans.name: Delmi Johana

texts.en:
I have had a small beauty salon located in my house for two years now. Because of my good service, I have a variety of clients. I work Monday to Saturday and have Sundays at home. I cut hair for both men and women. I decided to start my own business because I couldn\'t find work ina company and needed money for the care and education of my son. It\'s a difficult job but I like making people feel pretty. In the upcoming months there will be more business because of graduations, weddings and Christmas. I am looking for somehting to embellish things a little more. It might be possible to cancel the last months of my son\'s primary school education in order to prepare for his enrollment in highschool next year.

Loan Use: Purchase of dryer, hair products, acrylic nails and other supplies

Tengo un pequeño salor de belleza instalado en mi casa desde hace 2 años, y por el buen servicio que brindo tengo varia clientela, atiendo de lunes a sabado y los domingos a domicilio. Hago cortes de pelo para dama y caballero, asi como otros trabajos. Decidi instalar mi propio negocio porque no pude encontrar trabajo en alguna empresa y necesitaba tener ingresos para los cuidados y estudio de mi hijo. Es un trabajo cansado pero me gusta que las personas se sientan bonitas. En estos ultimos meses es cuando mas clientes tengo ya que hay graducaciones, bodas y navidad, por lo que me buscan para que las embellezca un poco mas y me ayuda a aumentar mis ganacias y podre cancelar los ultimos meses de estudio de mi hijo y prepararme para su inscripcion colegial el proximo año.

loans.use: Compra de secadora, producto para el cuidado del cabello, uñas acrilicas y otros.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.en:
Mr. S. has a bakery and the business is running great, but he would like to buy more equipment to increase the production of bread which is why he is asking for a $1200 loan, to be repaid in 12 months.

Espanol: El Sr. S. tiene una panaderia y el negocio ha funcionado muy bien. Pero a el le gustaria comprar mas equipo para aumentar la producion de pan, por lo cual solicita un prestamo por $1,200 Dllrs, los cuales piensa pagar en un plazo de 12 meses.

loans.use: To buy bakery equipment

loans.name: Alima

texts.en: Alima lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan with the members of her family. She is a tailor and also  she cleans fruits. She took a loan and bought sewing machines and did good business with that and supported her family. She has the responsibility of her house and she wants to expand her business. In this case she wants to take another loan and buy modern machines to help her family and do something for the future of her children.

loans.use: To buy more machines

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Mrs. Kung M. is 49 years old, married and a mother of 5 children. She lives with her husband in the Prey Veng province, Cambodia, where she and her husband together sell beef / pork rice and porridge to the people in her area. This business activity provides her with an average of around $5 in revenue per day. Meanwhile, one of the children runs a small booth at a market selling women’s handbags and the rest of her children are enrolled school. Mrs. Kung M. currently needs to expand her business by purchasing more food supplies and more utensils in order to meet her clients’ needs. In the future, she hopes to save enough money for her children’s education.

loans.use: Needs to expand her business by purchasing more food supplies and some utensils to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Didier

texts.en:
Didier N. S. is 23 years old. He sells toys and games for children of less than 12 years and lives with his family in Port-Bouët, a very populous suburb in the south of Abidjan District.

Didier is a dynamic and strong young man, who began his business three years ago. He is financially responsible for his fiancee and their baby boy.

Didier is ambitious and wants to have a real store to provide better customer service. He also wants to pay for his fiancee to learn tailoring in order to increase his family's overall revenue. Didier took out his first loan from AE&I in November 2005 and has performed very well so far.

loans.use: pay for a tailor training program for his fiancee

loans.name: Amie

texts.en: Amie is 38 years old and married with three children.  She learned soap-making in one of the CCF skills training centers in Kabala in 2003, after which she obtained her first loan to start the business.  Although her husband works as a community mobilizer, Amine needed to supplement his salary to support the families expenses.  She therefore produces soap and distributes them to various village women on a weekly basis.  Very few people make soap in the district and Amie has an opportunity to increase her production.  She is therefore requesting $250.

loans.use: Purchase soap supplies for increased production.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
Mrs. Uk N., 25, is married with three children and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement her income, she works as a garment worker, earning around $2/day. Mrs. Uk N. has applied for a loan to purchase a motor-bike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi, to enable him to generate more income for his household.

Because Mrs. Uk N. is the approved borrower, she is being pictured here. The motorbike business is a family run business and they share the profit.

loans.use: To operate a motor-taxi  to generate more income for the household.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: “I live in Lahore, Pakistan. My husband is a day labourer in the construction industry. He brings in about US$ 5 per day, which is insufficient to take care of six children. My older children dropped out of school since we used to live in a small village, where education was not encouraged. Thankfully, now my children are in school. My husband now wants to provide public transport in a rickshaw (local three-wheeled vehicle) purchased with a loan. He believes that he can make more money with this job.”

loans.use: Purchase a rickshaw

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia C. Ayala is a mother of five and married to Felipe Careaga. She owns a grocery store which has been in business now for twelve years. Through this time she has gained both great business references and personal references. She has a vision for how she would like to increase the stores business. She feels that with the addition of a meat shop, she would gain more clientèle and increase business.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for her store with the hope that with increased business, she will be able to save enough to bring a butcher into the shop, and continue the upward growth of earnings.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her convenience store.

loans.name: Centra A3(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Resty N.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth materials. Resty is 47 years old and is a widow. She has 5 children ranging from age 18 to 26 and four of her children go to school. Each week, Resty makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to to educate her children.

Resty is joined in her small group by Samyvi N., Florence K., Aisha N., and Zam N.. Samyvi N. has a business selling children's wear and wants to expand her business. Florence K. is currently operating a clinic business and wants a loan to enlarge the business. Aisha N. operates a business of selling timber and wants to add to the business. Zam N. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge.

loans.use: To add more working capital to tailoring business

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita is married with three children. Two girls, 18 and 11 years old and a boy who is 15. Thanks to her skills in sales, she has been successful in providing her children the ability to go to school. She knows that this is the way that they can get ahead in life. She sells plastic products for the home. She has the goal to buy a van so that she can get around to sell her products in different markets in the city.

She is asking for a loan of $250 which she will pay back in 3 months. She will use the loan to buy more products and continue selling. Let's help Juanita so she can reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Juanita es una mujer casada con 3 hijos dos mujeres de 18 y 11 años y un varón de 15años gracias a su habilidad en las ventas ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos logrando que todos estudien, ya que sabe que esta es la manera en que se superen ella vende productos de plástico para el hogar y en un futuro tiene establecida como meta comprar una camioneta para poder vender en los diferentes tianguis de la ciudad.

Ahora ella solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprara mas artículos y continuar vendiendo. Apoyemos a Doña Juanita para que pueda alcanzar su meta.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Wankaia

texts.en:
Wankaia is married with 5 children. She sells food items in the market town of Kabala. She needs to increase her stock of food items for purchasing so that she can consistently meet her clients' demands.

Her business is the main source of income for the family, because her husband is a daily labourer whose income depends on the availability of work. The 36-year-old would like to increase her stock and is requesting a loan of Le.1,000,000 ($350 USD).

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
Rosendo started his business to help his parents when he was young and wanted an income to support himself and help with the maintenance of his brothers and sisters. He started 25 years ago selling popsicles and ice cream sandwiches. Later he learned to make them when he bought his first freezer. With this business he can now support himself, his wife and their 3 children ages 10, 4 and 2 years.

Now he needs a loan of $400, which will be repaid in 6 months, to repair his freezer and buy raw materials. With your help he will continue with his business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosendo inició el negocio para ayudar a sus padres cuando era joven ya que deseaba tener un ingreso para mantenerse y ayudar a la manutencion de sus hermanos. Comenzó hace 25 años vendiendo paletas de hielo en con una caja de galletas y posteriormente aprendio a hacerleas comprando su primer congelador. Ahora con este negoico puede mantener y sacar adelante a su mujer y sus 3 hijos de 10, 4 y 2 años.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para reparar su congelar y comprar materia prima. Con tu ayuda el seguira con su negocio.

loans.use: To repair his freezer and buy materials for making frozen confections.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 32 year old woman, living in the village of Bioci near Ilijas. She is married with 2 children, who are both in primary school.  Her husband is a seasonal construction worker, and they also support themselves through their farming business, raising dairy cows and selling their milk to a major factory.  This is the first loan that Fatima is requesting, in the amount of $500.  She will use this loan to buy food for her cows, and is hoping that she can now afford to buy some more nutritious food that will in turn help her cows produce better quality and healthier milk.

loans.use: To buy food for her cows

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
Lita has been selling food during the evenings for quite a while now. She sees herself as a multi-talented woman; during the mornings she works in a construction project. Her food business is located in a highly transited place. Lita is 45 years old and has three children that work to pay their technical studies. What is important is to come through, not stay back. She wants to expand her business because she has had a good response due to her good flavors and joy. Her clients are very happy in her business which is why she wants to have a kiosk build for better comfort. She hereby presents this loan petition.

Translated into English by Patricia Yanez, Kiva Volunteer.

Lita vende comiD. por las noches desde hace tiempo atrás, es una mujer que se considera polifacética, ya que por la mañana también trabaja en un proyecto de construcción. Su negocio de comiD. se encuentra ubicado en un lugar muy transitable. Lita tiene 45 años y tiene 3 hijos, los que trabajan para pagar sus estudios técnicos. Lo importante es salir adelante, no quedarse atrás, quiere incrementar y ampliar su negocio, ya que tiene muy buena acogiD. debido a su buena sazón y jovialidad. Los clientes se sienten muy complacidos en su negocio, para ello quiere mandar a construir su kiosco para una mejor comodidad, motivo por el que se presenta en este medio con su solicitud de préstamo.

loans.use: To build a kiosk in order to provide better services and comfort to her clients.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga A. was born in Asunción and she is married to Hilarion Vilchi for more than 10 years. They have 4 children: three daughters ages 10, 24 and 30 and one son who is 26 years old.

For more than 7 years she has made all kinds of clothing, a profession that has helped her meet the expenses of her son Victor who is finishing his studies in medicine in Cuba as well as support her family’s expenses with the help of her husband.

She has worked with the Foundation since 2003 to buy her industrial sewing machines. Today she is asking for another loan to acquire great quantities of fabric, buttons, zippers and accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Olga A. nació en la ciudad de Asunción, esta casada con el Sr. Hilarion Vilchi desde hace mas de diez años, tiene cuatro hijos, tres nenas de 10, 24 y 30 años respectivamente y un varón de 26 años.

Se dedica a la confección de todo tipo de ropas desde hace mas de siete años, profesión que la ayudó a solventar los gastos de su hijo Victor quien terminó la carrera de medicina en Cuba y también a mantener los gastos de su familia con la ayuda de su esposo.

Opera con la Fundación desde el año 2003 logrando aumentar su activo fijo con la compra de máquinas industriales. Hoy día ella desea otro crédito para poder adquirir telas en grandes cantidades, botones, cierres y accesorios.

loans.use: buy large quantities of fabric, buttons, zippers and accessories.

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos Group

texts.en:
Arturo is the representative of the group known as Unidos Venceremos, which consists of 10 hard working and ambitious people looking to start small businesses. Arturo, the father of two young children, is hoping to better not only his life but also the lives of his children by starting a small clothing sale business. His ultimate goal is to become a big clothing distributor, and his dream is to own his own house someday! 

On behalf of Arturo, the group, and Esperanza International--- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: To become a clothing vendor

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca Z. is 55 years old. She has three kids who are currently attending school. She trades maize at the local market of Obuasi, a town in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

She is requesting a loan to enable her to buy an increased stock of maize and millet in order to grow her business and increase sales. She says her major difficulty has to do with the kidsa school fees, which she works hard to provide.  She hopes to increase her savings to continue to send her children to school. She hopes that their education will give them better future career opportunities. 

She belongs to the community group called Ntoboase Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee to assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of maize and millet

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma was born in 1966 and she lives in a suburb of Doboj, Bosnia. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a construction worker, but even though he has a steady job, he still does not earn enough to support their family.  As a result, Alma has a vegetable garden and she raises chickens, selling the meat in the local market.  

Alma requests a loan of 1,000KM from Women for Women International that she will use to purchase additional chickens. She hopes the additional income from selling chicken meat will help her to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery tiene 45 años, es soltera y vive con sus hermanas. Ella es farmacéutica y abrió su botica hace 5 años, negocio que viene funcionando adecuadamente, dando ingresos muy buenos, gracias a que en su zona no cuentan con muchas boticas cercanas, entonces no tiene competencia. Para Mery atender a las personas y ayudarlas a mejorar su salud y su calidad de vida es lo mejor que puede realizar, aunque para ello tenga que invertir  grandes cantidades de  dinero en la compra de medicinas para sus vecinos. Este es  su primer crédito con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado complementará su botica con productos de belleza y regalos, para no sólo ofrecer salud, sino también belleza y felicidad.
texts.en:
Mery is 45 years old, single, and lives with her sisters. She is a pharmacist and opened her pharmacy five years ago. The business progresses well and provides a good income thanks to the fact that, in her region, there are not many local pharmacies therefore she does not have competition. What Mery does best is attending to people and helping them improve their health and the quality of their lives. To do this, however, she must invest large sums of money into the purchase of medicines for her neighbors. This is her first loan with MFP. With the funds requested she will enhance her pharmacy by adding beauty supplies and gifts, so that she offers not only health, but also beauty and happiness.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enhance her pharmacy with the sale of other types of products.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Mrs. D., 30, earns income farming rice and raising pigs for sale. Her husband helps her in rice farming, the family's main source of income. Mrs. D. has two children who are teenagers and attend primary school. To improve her rice farming business and increase the family's income, Mrs. D. needs a loan to purchase a pump.

loans.use: Purchase of a pump to water a rice field

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mr. M. is aged 62. His wife's name is Pouv and she is 59 years old.  Both are residents of Pursat Province, Cambodia.  They are local cultivators growing things like rice, cabbage, morning glories, and Chines Kale.  They currently make an income of around $6 per day to provide the family's foods. 

The couple has nine children; seven of them are married and the others are single.  Two of their children are employed as farmers.  

Mr. M. is applying for a loan to buy a motorcycle to use for family riding, and a water buffalo to help his physical labor in plowing farmland. 

(Mr. M.'s wife is pictured because he was not available.)

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to use for family riding and a water buffalo for plowing

loans.name: Augustin

texts.es:
El   Señor Agustin Zorrilla Cano es de la Ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Niño Jesus, tiene casa propia,  con 50 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Amada Pera con 43 años de edad,   Tienen 4 Hijos, todos en edad Escolar.

Posee una Merceria en el centro de la ciudad, cerca del Mercado Municipal de Santani, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales.

El cliente sueña en construir un salon de material en su propia casa para tener otro negocio y asi obtener mejor ingreso para el bien de su familia.
texts.en:
Agustin Zorrilla Cano comes for the neighbourhood of Niño Jesus in the city of San Estanislao. He owns his home, is 50 years old and married to Amada Pera, 43. They have four school-aged children. He owns a clothing store downtown near the municipal market of Santani. He has a loyal customer base, good income, good business and personal references. The client dreams of building a fabric store in his own home in order to have another business and thus make more money for his family's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital (Purchase of goods such as jeans, shirts, T-shirts, shoes)

loans.name: Justino Alonso

texts.es: El Señor Justino Alonso Narváez Méndez tiene 38 años de edad, su estado civil es casado. La actividad económica de Don Justino es la compra y venta de ropa en general. Hace más de tres años que se dedica a este negocio, expresa que la misma necesidad lo ha impulsado a buscar una nueva fuente de ingresos ya que don Justino labora como mesero en el restaurante TIP- TOP por lo que el sueldo que gana no es lo suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos. Los propósitos de Don Justino son de mantener su actividad económica ya que es el único medio que posee para seguir manteniendo a su familia. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que se comprara ropa para damas, caballeros, niños y cosméticos. Sus deseos son de tener un hijo y poder darle educación escolar con el objetivo de salir siempre adelante. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 10.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mr. Justino Alonso Narváez Méndez is 38 years old and is married. Justino's economic activity is the purchase and sale of assorted clothing. For more than three years he has had this business and he says that need has motivated him to look for a new source of income as Justino works as a waiter in the TIP-TOP restaurant but with the salary he earns it is not enough to cover his expenses. Justino's intentions are to continue his economic activity as it is the only means that he has to continue supporting his family. The loan is for working capital with which he will buy clothing for ladies, gentlemen, children and cosmetics. His wish is to have a child and be able to give him an education so that he can get ahead. The amount that he is requesting is C$ 10.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga B. is married with two grown-up children. She has had a retail business for ten years, selling food at a department store in the city of Vasilyevka. Olga is hard-working and has been able to develop her business in three different locations. Her approach is to serve her customers well.

Olga would like a loan of 3000 UAH to increase the assortment of products she offers. She wants to increase her sales so that she can help her son and daughter financially.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of products

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en:
Titilayo is 38 years old and married with five children. She sells clothing and sack bags.

She hopes for a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more clothes and bags to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and sack bags to sell.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe A. and her husband are engaged in the sale of bariw throughout their village and in the neighboring towns. Bariw is a plant whose leaves are used to make sleeping mats. Cleofe is a native of Candari, Pandan, Antique. She is a 60-year-old woman married to Isaac A., a hired laborer. They have been blessed with five children. The eldest already has a family and the four left are still dependents. The youngest daughter, Loren, is 15 years old and a high school graduate.

Business has been good and they find enough proceeds to meet their needs; however, they still need capital to finance the business. When Cleofe joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), a KIVA partner, she was given a chance to have access to capital. She proposes to use this loan of 5,000 pesos for a down payment on a motorcycle to be used for easy deliveries and transportation for their business.

Her dream is to grow this business with the help of ASHI. She hopes for enough profit so that she can save to prepare for her old age.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Jose Atilio

texts.es: Jose Atilio F. A. reside el departamento de Ahuachapán. José tiene 45 años de edad es un hombre soltero, vive solamente con su madre la Sra. Hilda de 67 años de edad quien le ayuda en el negocio. Jose posee una pequeño negocio llamado “Librería F.”, donde vende todo tipo  de artículos relacionados a la papelería, José solicita este crédito por que quiere surtir la librería con variedad de productos como papel, fólderes, lapiceros entre otros. Anteriormente José ha manejado créditos de mayor cantidad de los cuales, ya están cancelados en su totalidad y fue muy puntual es sus pagos.
texts.en:
Jose Atilio F. A. is 45 years old, single and resides in Ahuachapán state. He lives with his mother Mrs. Hilda who is 67 years old and helps in the business. Jose has a small book store business called "Libreria F.” Flower’s Bookstore, where he sells all kinds of items related to stationery.

Jose is asking for a loan in order to restock the book store and offer more variety of products such as paper, folders, pens and more. Jose has previously had loans which are already paid in full ,and was very punctual with the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock his business

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah started her fish sales three years ago in Sefwi in the Western Region of Ghana. She is now 26 years old, married, and the mother of one child. Her husband is a trader, too.

She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and, because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She has a high customer base such that some customers travel from the other parts of the communities to buy her fish.

She buys stocks of fresh fish from Kumasi cold stores and retails to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fish to make increased sales and income to support her child and her business growth.

loans.use: To buy an increased stock of smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Mrs. Din Chin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-two people living in Khnach Khang Tboung village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Din C. is 27-year-old and the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Rous Ry, is a construction worker. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn little income to support their family. In order to improve their living situation, Mrs. Din C. decided to request a loan to buy piglets to start a pig breeding business. She has three children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the others are too young to work or study. Mrs. Sok Kea C., Mrs. Saim M., and Mrs. Sok K. do not come to take a loan but their husband are, so their husband are presented in the picture instead.    

Seventeen members in this loan group have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principle on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva es socia, del Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, sin hijos y presenta estudios superiores (Antropología y contabilidad), vive en el Barrio Vallecito.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 08 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para la compra de útiles de escritorio. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en su librería, por lo que ella va adquirir lo siguiente:, papel, lapiceros, cuadernos, cartulinas, etc.

Su sueño es tener una familia feliz.

A ella le gusta la colaboración y el apoyo que hay al interior de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Eva is a member of the community bank "3 de Mayo II" which is located in Puno district, Puno province, Department of Puno. She is 27 years old, single with no children, and has higher education (anthropology and accounting). She lives in the Vallecito neighborhood.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement (a Peruvian feminist organization) for nearly eight years, with an initial loan of 300 PEN, which she used to buy writing supplies.

Now she needs a loan of 3000 PEN, to invest in her bookstore. She will buy the following: paper, pens, notebooks, cards, etc.

Her dream is to have a happy family.

She enjoys the collaboration and the support within her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paper, pens, notebooks, cards, etc.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is managing a humble store in Cutog Grande, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. She has been operating the business for three years.  She used to be a business woman for already 3 years now. She dreams to have a bigger income and this motivated her to request a loan of PHP12, 000 that she will use to purchase enough merchandise for her store and to meet the demands of her customers.  She hopes to satisfy her family needs with the income she could get from her business. 

Monica is 42 years old and she is married to Mario, a farmer. They have three children: Maria Crisanta - 20 years old, college graduate; Chona - 18 years old and their youngest is Mario Jr. – 15 years old, both are college students.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Leydi De Los Angeles

texts.es: La joven Leydi T. de 31 años de edad, se dedica ala venta de ropa y cosméticos que desde hace cinco años trabaja en las ventas, para aportar a los gastos de la familia ya que tiene dos hijos de 2 y 8 años de edad y desea  dar lo mejor a sus hijos y que logren un bien común, su esposo es mecánico desde horas temprana sale a su jornada. Reside en comarca Sabana Grande en la capital de Managua, Su negocio lo inicio con dinero que su esposo dio y préstamo Afodenic presto el cual invertio mas en el negocio y ha podido sastifacer sus necesidades, este es su cuarto ciclo el cual comprara ropa variada, y cosmético para seguir ofertando a sus clientes sus productos, lo cual espera aumentar las ventas y captar clientes nuevos. Da las gracias a  la institución por la oportunidad de poder mantener estable su negocio y que se que son muchas las familias Nicaragüenses que tienen el veneficio del financiamiento.

loans.use: Comprar ropa variada y cosmeticos

loans.name: Dora Elizabeth

texts.es: Dora es una mujer jovial y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa provincia de Coronel Portillo, tiene 23 años, es madre soltera, tiene un hijito y se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Galácticas ll” desde hace dos años, su primer crédito fue de 300 soles que invirtió en perfumes para damas, en la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que le permitirá invertir en productos de belleza, comprará cremas, perfumes, talcos, etc. La meta de Dora es tener un bazar bien implementado.

loans.use: Invertirá en productos de belleza, comprará cremas, perfumes, talcos, etc

loans.name: Nerlita

texts.en:
Nerlita B. is from the village of P-3, Upper Hinaplanon, Iligan City. She is 43 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Nerlita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. The main source of income for her business comes from selling bamboo products in the local community. Nerlita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Nerlita joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nerlita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Velera

texts.en:
Veleria is 55 years old.  She is a widow and was left with three children.  They live in the village of Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. Being single did not stop her from improving their way of living.  However, due to financial difficulties, she was not able to support the educational needs of her children, so they ended up as only high school graduates, and two of them are already married.

Veleria is selling different snacks and vegetables in their village. She usually purchases her products in the public market of Bayombong and sells them in their village at retail prices.  From her business, she can earn a monthly net income of $74 which she needs to budget for their daily needs and to save something for future emergencies.  

She wanted to have more products to sell, so she is asking to borrow PHP13,000 from the Kiva lenders to be used in acquiring additional items to sell.  She hopes that with her patience and sacrifices, she can improve her small business and support her grandchildren's schooling.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita S. is from the village of Inobulan, Salay Misamis Oriental. She is 66 years old and a widow with four adult children. To make a living, Purita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Purita has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $63 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Purita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Purita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 33 year old engaged man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Abass has been working in construction for thirteen years. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work and to pay for his wedding expenses. This is the first time that Abass has requested a loan.

His clients are people from his region and from the surrounding villages. When Abass first started work, he wasn’t really known by the people in his region which means he wasn't able to do a lot of networking. He decided on going into this business because of his experience; he learned when he was young. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad C. is 60 years old and married with 4 adult children. She lives in the town of Lawy, Capas Tarlac. To make a living, Felicidad owns and operates a business making and selling ice cream. Felicidad has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2001, Felicidad joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI. Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients. This loan will be the 16th loan taken out by Felicidad from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for ice-cream production

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El señor Ignacio Ramón Núñez  es de Jejui  – Choré,  tiene casa propia,  es casado, 29 años de edad.

      Tiene un minibús en el cual trabaja con la Empresa San Juan de Norte, en cual traslada a pasajeros desde el trayecto Cruce Liberación a Santa Rosa del Aguaray, en su tiempo libre también se dedica a la venta de panificados dentro de la ciudad distribuyendo el producto por los almacenes de los barrios. 
        El cliente quiere comprar un camión mas grande,para poder trabajar mejor ya que cuenta con muchos clientes y el transporte ya resulta insuficiente para la y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ignacio Ramón Núñez is from Jejui – Choré. He is 29, married, and has his own house. He has a minibus, which he uses to work for the San Juan de Norte Company. He transports passengers from the Cruce Liberación route to Sana Rosa del Aguaray. During his free time he sells pastries in the city, distributing the product to neighborhood stores. He wants to buy a bigger vehicle to be able to work better. He has a lot of customers, and his minibus is not big enough. This way he will increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Iganga Development Group, Mukono

texts.en: Irene M. is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 25 years old and married with three children aged one, three, and five. Irene operates a grocery store which also sells poultry, shoes and clothes. She is a hard-working young lady with a strong drive to succeed; she was able to repay her first loan easily and is grateful for the benefit it provided. Irene now needs a loan to expand her inventory as well as to buy chicken feed for her broilers, which she also keeps to feed her family.

loans.use: Restocking her various businesses so that they could bring in more profits.

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es:
Anacleta es viuda; trabaja como comerciante de comida (vivandera), tiene 6 hijos y ninguno esta a su cargo. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona villa Ingavi Alto Lima  de la ciudad de el Alto. 

El préstamo lo destinará a la compra de  víveres por cantidad (arroz, fideo, papas, etc.) para su actividad del comercio de comida.
 
Es tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Anacleta is a widow who works selling food; she has 6 children who are all adults and independent. Her home is located in the Villa Ingavi Alto Lima area in the city of El Alto. This loan will be used to purchase large quantities of the ingredients she needs to prepare her food (rice, noodles, potatoes, etc.). This is the third loan she has received from Impro; she paid back her previous loans punctually which qualified her to receive this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients like rice, noodles, potatoes, etc. wholesale for her business selling food

loans.name: Bellamis Astrid

texts.es:
Bellamis Astrid C. M.  vive en el popular barrio la Luz de Barranquilla, tiene 34 años de edad  y  junto a su cónyuge (a la izquierda de la foto) tiene un negocio de  elaboración y venta de alimentos, el cual inició cuando  este último quedó sin empleo después de trabajar durante 20 años en una empresa; desde ahí surgió la idea de elaborar los deliciosos   arroz de pescado y arroz de pollo. Es parte de la rutina de Bellamis levantarse  en la madrugada y desde las 2.00 am  iniciar  la tarea de preparar las ollas de arroz, para que más tarde  su esposo, salga a venderlo en un punto estratégico en la salida de la ciudad de Barranquilla, en el  departamento del Atlántico vía de la ciudad de  Santa Marta en el departamento del Magdalena.
Bellamis se vinculó a los programas de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace tres años y ha recibido  3 créditos; en la actualidad solicita financiación por valor de $1.500.000, porque con una parte  de este dinero, pretende ampliar la muy pequeña cocina donde casi no cabe su estufa industrial,  que precisamente compró al obtener su anterior crédito;  y con el saldo restante, comprar materias primas e insumos  en  mayor volumen, para obtener un mejor precio en sus materias primas y de esta forma aumentar las utilidades, que mucho le contribuyen a sacar adelante a sus  tres  hijos en las edades de 17, 16 y 1 año; Ella está muy de acuerdo con su esposo, en que hay mucho por hacer, pues  los 2  hijos mayores aun están estudiando bachillerato y el menor está en una guardería del estado
texts.en:
Bellamis Astrid C. M. lives in the Luz de Barranquilla neighborhood. She is 34, and together with her spouse (at left in the photo) she has a business making and selling foods, a business she started when her spouse was unemployed after having worked with one company for 20 years. From there she had the idea to make delicious dishes of rice with fish and rice with chicken. Part of her routine is to arise very early, starting the task of preparing the rice at 2:00 am, so that later her spouse can go out selling it at a strategic spot at the exit from the city of Barranquilla on the way to the city of Santa Marta. Bellamis joined the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation program three years ago and has received three loans. Currently she is requesting a loan of $800, partly to enlarge her tiny kitchen that hardly holds the industrial range that she bought with the last loan. With the rest she will buy raw materials and supplies in large volume, in order to pay the best price for her supplies and increase her profits. This will greatly help her 3 children, ages 17, 16 and 1, to get ahead. She fully agrees with her spouse that there is much to be done, because the two elder are studying for their BA and the younger is in a public daycare.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials and supplies

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita C. is from the village of Masabud, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Tita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables, such as root crops (like gabi), for sale in the local community. Tita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2004, Tita joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Tita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her eighth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Josefina Aurora

texts.es:
La Sra. Josefina tiene 37 años, esta casada con el Sr. Diego Gil Quiroz desde hace 10 años, tienen 2 hijas las cuales acuden a la escuela.

Juntos elaboran edredones y sabanas para camas. se dedican a esta actividad manufacturera desde hace 8 años. 

Requieren del prestamo para comprar fibra termica para elaborar los edredones debido a que el invierno se avesina y necesitan almacenar produccion de edredones para que se comercialize a las otras ciudades del pais ya que las ventas de estos se incrementan mucho en epoca de invierno.
texts.en:
Josefina is 37 years old. She has been married to Mr. Diego Gil Quiroz for 10 years. They have two daughters who are in school. Together they make comforters and sheets for beds. They have been manufacturing these for 8 years. They require the loan to purchase thermal fiber to make the comforters. Winter is approaching and they need to build an inventory of comforters so they can be sold in other cities in the country. The sales increase a lot during winter.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase thermal fibers for comforters

loans.name: Parvin

texts.en:
Parvin D. was born in 1966. He is married and has a child. Parvin is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region. 

He has been in the cattle business for 6 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 Azerbaijani manat to buy 4 calves for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy 4 calves

loans.name: Rosa Leticia

texts.es:
