La señora  Rosa P. es otra socia activa del Banco Comunal  Nuevo Porvenir en el que lleva doce años, ella  vive en la parroquia Cumbe  donde la mayor parte de su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería caracterizándose por ser uno de los mayores productores de leche, su gente es muy trabajadora que lucha por sus ideales.  Nuestra socia vive en su casa propia con cuatro de los cinco hijos que engendró  ya que el mayor que hoy tendría 27 años desapareció sin dejar rastro hace ocho años, recuerda que salió al trabajo y nunca más volvió a quien ha  buscado de todas las maneras posibles y hasta más allá de sus recursos sin tener ninguna respuesta favorable pero tiene la esperanza de volverlo a ver algún día,   también recuerda con mucho dolor que es el mismo tiempo de lo que falleció su esposo a causa de un paro cardiaco, le acompañan y ayudan su hijo de 23 años estudia en la universidad de Cuenca y es profesor de educación física mientras que los otros tres aún son estudiantes de secundaria   en instituciones de la localidad. 

Rosa tiene 52 años de edad y  labora en  una picantería de su propiedad, ofrece chancho hornado,  cascarita, sancocho,  y más delicias propias de la región, en su negocio labora todos  los días sin descansar uno solo inicia sus actividades a las  10 a.m. y termina su jornada a las 8 p.m.,lleva  veinte años y fue gracias al apoyo que recibió de su familia, con el nuevo credito solicitado va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, pollos, arroz, papas, azúcar y más productos para preparar sus deliciosos platos típicos .

Su meta es  seguir creciendo en su negocio que es el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa P. is another active associate of the New Future Communal Bank which she joined twelve years ago. She lives in the Cumbe parish where most of the people are dedicated to agriculture and stockbreeding, as it is known for being one of the largest producers of milk. Its people are very hard-working and fight for their ideals. Our associate lives in her own house with four of the five children that she engendered, since the oldest disappeared without leaving a trace eight years ago. Today he would be 27 years old. She recalls that he left work and never returned. She has sought for him in all possible ways, even beyond her resources, without having any favorable answer, but she has hope of seeing him again some day. Also it gives her a lot of pain to recall that her husband passed away at the same time due to a heart attack. She supports her son, age 23, with his studies at the University of Cuenca, where he studies to be a teacher of physical education, while the other three are still students in the local secondary school. Rose is 52 years of age and works in a restaurant on her property. She offers roast pork, cascarita, stew, and more delights of the region. She labors in her business every day without resting even one day. She begins her activities at 10 AM and finishes her day at 8 PM. She has run her business for twenty years, thanks to the support that she has received from her family. With the new loan she has requested she will invest in the purchase of pork, chicken, rice, potatoes, sugar and more products to prepare her delicious traditional dishes. Her goal is to continue growing her business which provides a living for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pork, chicken, rice, potatoes, sugar and more products to prepare her delicious traditional dishes.

loans.name: Nataiyuang Enole

texts.en:
Nataiyuang Enole P. is 28 years old. She is married to Rereu Ole P. and is the mother of three children who go to school.

Nataiyuang is a farmer and has been farming her land for the past ten years.

She learnt about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her second loan which she is planning to use to prepare land for maize planting. Maize has been doing well in her area due to good climatic conditions. She hopes to use the profits to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Nataiyuang's dream is do large scale farming and attain financial independence. She is a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals

loans.use: to prepare land for maize planting

loans.name: Ear

texts.en: Ear E. is 38 years old and sells flowers in the Takeo province. Her business has been around for about four years and she makes US$5 every day. She has five children, two of which are in school and three who are employed with different jobs. She has requested a loan of US$1200 to purchase a motorbike for one of her children so that her child can operate a moto-taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente ala provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Lucila;   ella tiene 55 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos los mayores de 23 y 20 años son estudiantes en la universidad, la socia se dedica a la administración de su tienda abarrotes y con esta tienda ella puede seguir apoyando a sus hijos con los estudios. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su tienda abarrotes con mayor cantidad de productos.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the Esmeralda Communal Bank. She lives in the District of San Sebastián, which is part of the Province and Department of Cusco.

Sra. Lucila is 55 years old, married, and has three adult children between the ages of 20 and 23. All of them are university students. Lucila manages a grocery store so that she can continue supporting her children with their education. She is requesting a loan to keep her store in operation by acquiring a large quantity of products.

Lucila values and has endless appreciation for the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to submit her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of products for her store

loans.name: Ledis Maria

texts.en:
Ledis has a business selling hardware and other goods in the neighborhood of Barranquilla near one of Colombia's greatest soccer stadiums, “El Estadio metropolitano D. Barranquilla”. Her business has generated employment opportunities, staying open from 10am to 11pm daily. 


Ledis started her business in 1993 selling books in downtown Barranquilla, only later moving to her current neighborhood and changing her business model to focus on goods like stationary, hair ribbons and clips, wrapping paper and cosmetics. She also began to gradually add in hardware. Her main clients are locals and pedestrians who pass by her shop. She generally has to restock the store every two days. 


This loan will be Ledis's fourth with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to use it to buy a display case. She also plans to buy clothes in bulk (with cash) and, thereby, receive a better price: savings she can then pass on to her clients. Since starting out with FMSD, she has seen her family's income increase which is why she's so excited about continuing to growing in her large neighborhood. She already enjoys a solid reputation there and is surrounded by businesses and supermarkets attracting more potential clients.

[EN ESPANOL]

Ledis SaL. calderón, tiene un negocio D. variedades y ferreterías en la Ciudadela 20 D. Julio, barrio donD. está ubicado uno D. los mejores escenarios del futbol D. Colombia  “El Estadio metropolitano D. Barranquilla”.  Allí tiene su negocio D. variedades y ferretería donD. genera dos empleos y trabaja en los horarios D. 10:00 A.M. a 11:00 PM,. Ledis se inició como negociante en el año 1993 vendiendo libros en el centro D. Barranquilla, luego se pasó para la ciudadela 20 D. Julio comercializando variedades como papelería, adornos D. cabeza, accesorios, papel D. regalo, cosmeticos y fue agregando gradualmente artículos D. ferretería, sus principales clientes son los   peatones que pasan por el sector  y mucha gente que allí habita; ella tiene por costumbre  surtir su negocio cada dos días. Este es el cuarto crédito  D. Ledis con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, está solicitando un monto D. $1,300.000 COP, con el cual   comprará una vitrina y ropa al por mayor y D. contado, lo cual permite que se gane un descuento y mejore sus precios D. ventas al publico. DesD. que ingresó a esta organización siente que sus ingresos familiares  han mejorado, por eso está estimulada para seguir progresando sobre todo en este populoso barrio, donD. ya tiene renombre, y está rodeado D. negocios y supermercados que potencializan su clientela futura.

loans.use: to buy a display case and clothes in bulk

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou T. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old. Marilou is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a business venture selling personal home products from different suppliers to the local community members. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Meylin Eliette

texts.es: Meylin tiene 41 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de huevos. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que la gran variedad de clientes que siempre están llegando a su vivienda a comprar a precio favorable y accesible, ella tiene mucho tiempo que es cliente de Fundación y ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Después de la separación con su esposo ha decidido continuar con este medio de vida. Pues es así que ha logrado aprender a ser una empresaria independiente. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima necesaria en mayor cantidad. Sueña con que su hijo logre curarse.
texts.en:
Meylin is 41 years old, and her business is buying and selling eggs. She has operated this business for more than 10 years, and she has built up a wide range of customers who regularly come to her home to buy her products at a favorable and accessible price. She has been a client of the Foundation for a long time, and she has made her payments in a correct and timely manner. After she and her husband separated, she decided to continue with this way of life. That is how she learned to become an independent entrepreneur. She is requesting this loan to buy needed supplies in larger quantities. Her dream is that her son will recover from a condition he has.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita M. is from the town of Talibon. She is 49 years old. Perlita is married and has 5 children. Her eldest child is aged 25 while the youngest is 19 years old. To make a living, Perlita owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 18 years.

Perlita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like fruits, vegetables and dry goods. This will be the 18th loan taken out by Perlita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and to financially support her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like fruits, vegetables and dry goods.

loans.name: Sonia Patricia

texts.es: La señora Sonia Patricia es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y su expareja trabaja en Estados Unidos y le envia dinero para la manutencion D. sus hijos, la señora sonia vive sola con sus pequeños pero el cuarto donD. viven es muy chico y ella tiene planes D. construid uno mas, para mejor comodidas D. su familia, la señora sonia quiere ir contruyendo el patrimonio D. sus hijos poco a poco y espera que podamos apoyarla.
texts.en:
Sonia Patricia is a single mother. She has two children; her ex-partner works in the United States and sends child support money for the children. She lives alone with her little ones but the room they live in is very small. She plans to build an additional room for more comfort for her family. Sonia wants to gradually build assets for her children and hopes we can help her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Sol Y Esperanza Group

texts.en:
The communal bank “Sol y Esperanza” (Sun and Hope) consists of sixteen associates from Santiago’s Puente Alto district. These individuals' livelihoods consist mainly of store sales, clothing sales, the manufacture of leather crafts, cooking and selling homemade bread, pies, empanadas, and handmade knitted items. 

Angela is the president of the group. In the photo she can be found in the furthest row above, and third from the left. She has been selling used clothing for the past two years in a kiosk at two fairs close to her house.  Before this she sold articles of leather; for example, coin purses, wallets and cigarette cases, among other things. She decided to change her merchandise to test sales, and thankfully it has gone very well. Angela is also the mother of a seven-year-old boy. 

Angela dreams of having her own home in two more years, and to install a business of fast food and a small grocery store.
 
She has enjoyed working with Kiva partner, Fondo Esperanza, as it has motivated her interaction with other entrepreneurs within the communal bank and with the loan officer.  In addition, she receives entrepreneurial training where she learns to administer her accounts, expenses and earnings. 

Puente Alto is a community in northern Santiago, the capital of Chile.  Puente Alto has nearly 500,000 inhabitants and it is expected to continue growing.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to resell

loans.name: Ivania Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Ivania Del Rosario tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos menores de edad. La señora es dueña de un negocio de video juegos. Ella dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 7 años ante la necesidad de suplir las necesidades de su hogar, sin embargo ella no tenía experiencia fue por sus hijos quienes les gustaba este tipo de diversión que ella decide establecer este negocio en su vivienda. Ella está solicitando este crédito con el propósito de realizar inversión en la compra de video juegos, controles entre otras cosas. Doña Ivania tiene el anhelo de ver a sus hijos graduarse de la universidad y que posean todos los estudios que ella nunca tuvo, por ello es que trabaja tan duramente para brindarles a ellos lo que su mama no pudo brindarle a ella.
texts.en:
Ivania del Rosario is 31 years old, married and has three young children.  She owns a video game store.  She started this business seven years ago to provide for household needs.  Actually, she did not have experience.  It was because her children love this kind of entertainment that she decided to establish the business in her home.

She is asking for a loan to purchase video games and controls, among other things.

Ivania's hopes are that her children graduate from university, and that they have all of the education that she never had.  This is why she works so hard, to provide them with what her mother could not give her.

loans.use: Working capital for video game store.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena E. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has 6 children. Her eldest child is 23 years old. She is engaged in farming and has been planting and harvesting rice crops for more than a few years now. She also started raising pigs a few months ago. Her pigs are for fattening and sale. Rowena does all these activities to ensure income for the family. Most of her children are still going to school so she works hard to sustain their education.

Rowena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rowena is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: H. Louise est née en 1976 à Gbénonkpo, un des quartiers de Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin où elle vit depuis sa naissance. Louise est mariée à HOUKPATIN Gildas. Louise est mère de trois (03) enfants, tous scolarisés. Louise est allée à l’école et s’est arrêtée au cours primaire. Louise vit avec ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari toutes les charges familiales. Louise exerce comme activité la vente des pains sucrés à son domicile. Mais Louise vend également des produits divers (lait, sucre, nescafé, piles, conserves, savons, etc.) qu’elle approvisionne à Dantokpa, le marché international du Bénin. C’est pour améliorer le niveau de son activité et augmenter le stock des produits divers que Louise sollicite à nouveau un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurement reçus par Louise ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
H. Louise was born in 1976 in Gbénonkpo, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where she has lived since birth.  She is married to HOUKPATIN Gildas, and is the mother of three children, who are all in school. Louise has attended school and stopped going in primary school. She lives with her children and ensures, along with her husband, that all family expenses are covered. 

Louise has a business selling sweetened breads out of her home.  She also sells a variety of goods (milk, sugar, Nescafé, batteries, canned foods, soaps, etc.) that she purchases at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  To improve her level of business and to increase her diverse stock of goods, she is requesting a new loan from ALIDé.  The previous loans she received have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: Buying a variety of goods (canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, sugar, batteries, insecticides, soaps, etc.)

loans.name: Sunnara

texts.en:
Mr. Sunnara C. (pictured above) and his wife, Mrs. Pov Kim, live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2006 and have a young son. 

Sunnara is a construction worker. His wife is a garment factory worker. He has previously had a loan from Kiva and is now asking for his second loan of $600 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg D. is 51 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His oldest son works as a driver and her middle son attends university, while her youngest herds their cows. Erdenechimeg operates a milk and other dairy product vending business. She owns three cows, which produce the milk, and sells a variety of dairy products out of the rented stall at a local market of the Bayanzurh district. She has been engaged this business since 1998, and has gained a lot of experience as a businesswoman. 

Erdenechimeg is a hardworking person and focused on the future. She says, “ All I want is to provide a higher education for my children. ” She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital for her dairy product vending business.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Nghiêm's Group

texts.en:
C. Nghiêm Thị (20201020065) is a 31 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. C. is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nghiêm Xá 2 (8).

C. is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, C. owns & operates a business providing hairdressing & beauty services to local community members. C. has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,800,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by C. from SEDA. C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị S. (0) is a 62 year-old female who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND loan to support her business of making & selling food.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

C. Nghiêm Thị (20201020065) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  C. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Nghiêm Xá 2 (8).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ làm tóc & làm đẹp cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 3.800.000 VND.  Vào 2009, C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  C. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.
Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:
1.  Nguyễn Thị S. (0) là 62 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.
Về SEDA:
Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business.

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.en:
Abdusattor S. is 49 years old, married and has six children. In his area of the country, cattle breeding is one of the main activities. That’s why Abdusattor decided to engage in livestock breeding also. His wife and children are the main helpers to him in this activity, as it’s a family business.

He started this business with 10,000 KGS and managed to broaden it with three bull-calves and three milk cows, whose milk he and his wife, Turgan, sell at the local market.

Now, Abdusattor plans to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to buy bull-calves and cows, which will increase their milk sales. With the revenues, Abdusattor wants to broaden his farm, which will allow him to pay for a good education for his children.

Abdusattor is a very positive and hard-working person, who believes that his efforts will lead his family to a prosperous future.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega 3 Group

texts.en:
Dionisia is the coordinator of her group Alfa y Omega (Alpha and Omega) 3, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the areas surrounding Santiago, the DR's second largest city, which is located in the Cibao valley and is famous for agricultural production. In this area, however, running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and four of their seven children, while the other three children have their own home and family.

Dionisia is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, selling a variety of cloths for Kids, Women and Men. She will use the profits to invest in her family and improving her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a married man with two children, both of whom are still young for school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent bills.

He has operated a phone accessories shop for the past two years, selling to his neighbours and passerbys. Isaac faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to expand in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase phone accessories. He decided to join Yehu because of its efficiency in service delivery.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories.

loans.name: Reina Mariluz

texts.es:
Reina, de 32 años de edad, está casada, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 10, 8 y 2 años de edad, residen en San Buena ventura departamento de Usulután, Reina tiene un negocio de granos básicos (maíz, maicillo, frijol, arroz y café), este tiene 2 años de existir, trabaja de lunes a domingos, actualmente necesita comprar más productos y solicita un préstamo para comprarlos, ya que quiere adquirirlos por mayor cantidad para obtener un mejor precio.
Este préstamo le será de mucha ayuda ya que el negocio será capaz de atender la demanda y abastecer las necesidades de los clientes. Su sueño principal es que sus hijos puedan estudiar y culminar en un futuro una carrera universitaria, además de seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Reina, 32 years old, is married and lives with her husband and three children of 10, 8, and 2 years. They live in the San Buena Ventura department of Usulután. Reina has had a business of basic grains (corn, maicillo [millet], beans, rice, and coffee) for two years and works from Monday to Sunday. She currently needs to buy more products and is requesting a loan to buy them as she wants to acquire a larger quantity to get a better price.
This loan will be of a lot of help to her since the business will be capable of meeting the demand and fulfilling the needs of her customers. Her primary dream is for her children to be able to study and complete a university career, as well as to continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase corn, millet, beans, rice, and coffee

loans.name: Auxiliadora De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Auxiliadoraes  de la ciudad de Concepción, tiene 19 años y  está cursando el 1° año de la carrera de Obstetricia en la Universidad UNI NORTE de Concepción.
Su mamá es la sra. Arcadia.
El crédito sale a nombre del Sr. Tomás, quien es su padre, ya que la misma todavía no cuenta con un ingreso fijo, pero el sr. Tomás firma con su señora y su hija quien es la beneficiada.
Ella solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad y también para la compra de libros que está necesitando para estudiar.
Auxiliadora agradece este préstamo ya que le ayudará en su estudio y al mismo tiempo podrá contar con referencias crediticias que en el futuro será  de mucha importancia para concretar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora, 19, is from the city of Concepción.  She’s in the first year of Obstetrics at UNI NORTE University in Concepción.  Her mother is Arcadia.

The loan will be issued in her father Tomás' name because she still does not have steady income.  Tomás, his wife and daughter all sign on and it’s the daughter who is the beneficiary.

She is asking for the loan to pay her monthly tuition and also to buy the books she needs for her courses.

Auxiliadora is grateful for this loan because it will help her with her studies and at the same time create credit history which in the future will be very important to carry out her projects.

loans.use: To pay tuition and other school supplies.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary wants a loan to buy more shoes for resale. She lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda.She has been selling shoes  for the last five years and her desire is to become a large scale trader of shoes and educating her children.Rosemary needs the loan to buy shoes for resale.

loans.use: Buying  shoes for resell

loans.name: Xiomara Guadalupe

texts.es: Xiomara Guadalupe E. V. de veintiocho años de edad reside con su madre, su padrastro y cinco hermanos en San Salvador. Ella posee un comedor en donde algunos miembros de su familia también trabajan, este negocio está situado en una zona muy transitada, existen varias empresas a sus alrededores, por lo cual existe mucha clientela que la prefieren por el rico sabor de sus platillos, por  precios cómodos y porque hay gran higiene en la preparación de los alimentos; además es muy servicial le gusta mantener feliz al cliente. Xiomara necesita comprar material para sus comidas como granos básicos, bebidas, embutidos, mariscos, harina, entre otros; es por eso que decidió solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar todo lo que necesita. Xiomara es muy positiva y tiene fe que aunque posea una familia muy numerosa y sea difícil de sustentar todas sus necesidades lograra con su comedor sacarlos adelante y darles una vida apropiada.
texts.en:
Xiomara Guadalupe E. V. is 28 years old and lives with her mother, her stepfather and five siblings in San Salvador.  Xiomara owns an eatery in which some members of her family also work.  Her business is located in a very busy area with several companies round about.  For this reason, she has a lot of customers.  They like to buy from her because of the rich flavor of her dishes, her affordable prices and because she employs good hygiene when preparing her meals.  In addition, she is very obliging and likes to keep her customers happy.

Xiomara needs to buy supplies for making her meals such as basic grains, drinks, sausages, seafood, flour, etc.  For this reason, she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL that would allow her to buy everything she needs.  Xiomara is very positive and believes that although she has a large family and it is difficult to cover all their needs, she will manage, through her eatery, to get them ahead in life and provide them with a decent life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, drinks, sausages, seafood and flour

loans.name: Sonia Narcisa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Los Tres Ángeles se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Sonia es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones y además porque ha hecho muchas amigas en el grupo. Tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un  hijo de cuatro años de edad. Su esposo es obrero en el Municipio de Manta.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que también se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos y comida rápida como: hamburguesas, hot dog, roscas, colas, aguas, entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días y nos cuenta que empezó este negocio con el primer crédito que obtuvo del banco comunal.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar sodas, aguas, pan, salchichas, carne y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos.

Su sueño es tener otro hijo.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Los Tres Ángeles (The Three Angels Communal Bank) meets every fortnight in the Montecristi Canton, a place renowned for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its arts and crafts, celebrated both at national and international level. It is also the homeland of the famous Toquilla straw hats.

Sonia is a founder member of the Communal Bank, and she likes it because the interest rates are lower than those of other institutions and also because she has made many friends in the group. She is 45, she is married and she a 4-year-old child. Her husband is a laborer working in the town of Manta.

She is a very good housewife who also engages in preparing and selling sandwiches and fast foods such as hamburgers, hot dogs, doughnuts, colas and water among other things. She works every day and she told us she started this activity with the first loans she was granted from the Communal Bank.

She will use this loan to buy fizzy drinks, water, bread, sausages, meat and other ingredients to prepare her meals.

She dreams of having another child.

loans.use: To buy fizzy drinks, water, bread, sausages, meat and other ingredients for her meals.

loans.name: Seray

texts.en:
Seray, age 25, established her plastic slippers and cosmetics business in 2003. She began her business because she had learned how to engage in this type of work from her mother. The rising cost of goods from her suppliers and transport fare is a challenge to her endeavor. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month. She and her husband have four children, ages three, six, nine, and 13. 

She would like to request a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to to buy more plastic shoes and cosmetics. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Seray plans to establish a bigger shop and to give her children a quality education. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plastic slippers to offer for sale

loans.name: Jamiyla's Group

texts.en:
Jamiyla J., 50, is the leader of this group. She is married and has five children. Jamiyla’s husband has been engaged in cattle breeding for a long time, which yielded enough start-up capital for building a foundation for a second family business. 

Eight years ago Jamiyla bought a spot in the largest trading center of the town. She stocked her small shopping place with the most necessary household appliances bought wholesale. The retail of technology requires big expenses and technical skills at operating the machines, however it brings desirable profit too. The business helps with tuition fees of her two oldest children, who are college students. 

The initial capital of 100,000 soms has paid back in several months. Now their monthly income reaches 50,000 soms. However a big portion of it is put back into the business, making necessary consumer purchases impossible. Jamiyla claims that the family needs vital things in order to have proper living conditions. This loan she plans to spend on a refrigerator for their house in order to keep food fresh. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge.

loans.name: Eazat

texts.ar: عزات عمره 45 سنة هو رجل متزوج واب لاربع اولاد يعمل في بيع المواد الغذائية والسمانة له في عمله نحو 5 سنوات يحب العمل ويسعى الى تطويره وزيادة رأس المال فيه يرد ان يؤمن العيش الكريم له ولعائلته فهو طموح محب للعمل يعمل بجد ونشاط يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة ومواد غذائية للعمل ادوات تنظيف وغيره حتى يتمكن من توسيع العمل ليشمل عدد اكبر من البضائع وبذلك من الزبائن يحب ان يكون لديه محل اكبر وهذا من احد احلامه يتميز ببيع الالبان والاجبان وهذا ما يتميزه في محيطه العملي ويتميز بالنظافة والاسعار الجيدة ولكن ما يقف عائق دون تطور العمل هو رأس المال حتى يتمكن من عبور الاحوال الاقتصادية الضيقة بعض الشيء الى رأس مال جيد وبضاعة متنوعة
texts.en: Eazat is a 45 year old married father of four children. He works in a grocery store and has been doing this for approximately five years. He loves his work and is seeking to develop it as he is ambitious, energetic and hard-working. He wants to secure a decent standard of living for himself and his family. With this loan he wants to purchase new stock, groceries and cleaning materials, etc. for his store in order to be able to expand his business and accommodate more stock and thereby a greater number of customers. It is one of his dreams to own a bigger store. He is distinguished for selling different types of milk and cheese and also for his cleanliness and good prices. What is preventing his business from progressing is lack of financial capital in order to overcome a difficult economic period, and be able to achieve financial stability and sell a greater range of goods.

loans.use: to purchase new groceries and cleaning products to sell at his store as wells as to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and one child. Since 2003 he has owned a medical clinic where he works as physiotherapy specialist. He is known as a very good physiotherapist and has a wide range of clients visiting his clinic in order to obtain the required treatment. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., to purchase an advanced physiotherapy machine. In this way, he will be able to provide his customers with more helpful services. In the future, he is planning to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase an advanced physiotherapy machine.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 29 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Edna works very hard to provide for them.

Edna runs a buying and selling "nipa" business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional "nipa" to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Edna would like to save enough so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase additional nipa  (palm frond mats) to sell.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Esperanza es viuda y es una mujer trabajadora  ya que pese a su edad ella tiene su puesto de antojitos mexicanos desde hace 35 años y también se dedica ala venta de aguacates, en la central de abastos ya que tiene una huerta y cuando es temporada de este fruto sale a venderlos desde muy temprana hora. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de carne, verdura, ingredientes para hacer los antojitos y un comal ya que ella quiere cambiar el que tiene por que ya se le rompió. Ella vende afuera de su casa los antojitos como pambazos, quesadillas, tacos, enchiladas etc. y vende de martes a sábado por la tarde. La meta que tiene es poner una cenaduría donde sus clientes estén a gusto cuando vallan a cenar.
texts.en: Esperanza is a widow and a hard-working woman, since in spite of her age she continues to run her Mexican food stand, which she has operated for 35 years. She also works selling avocados at the farmers' market, since she has an avocado grove, and when this fruit is in season, she goes out to sell them starting very early in the morning. She is requesting a loan to buy meat, vegetables and other ingredients to make her Mexican foods, as well as a tortilla grill, since her previous one broke and she wants to replace it. She sells foods outside of her house such as pambazos [sandwiches], quesadillas, tacos, enchiladas, etc., from Tuesdays through Saturdays in the evening. Her goal is to set up a restaurant where her customers will be comfortable when they go out to eat.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food stand.

loans.name: Yesenia Del Rocio

texts.es:
Yesenia de 22 años es madre de familia, vive con su hijo en la casa de su madre, cuenta con servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande, que pertenece al departamento de Piura.    Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

Yesenia se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace unos un año, su mercadería lo ofrece en su casa a sus clientes, también trae a pedido, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 700 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su negocio con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
22-year old Yesenia lives with her son in her mother’s house. The house has electricity only. It is located in Tambogrande in Piura department. It is an area known for its agriculture, cattle, and crafts.

Yesenia sells clothing, a business she has run from her home for the last year. Her customers come to her house to buy the clothing; she also delivers products that have been ordered. She wants to get more orders from her customers so that she can earn more money and pay household expenses.

As she can see her business prospering as each day passes, Yesenia believes it is a good time to seek a loan of 700 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa. She wishes to buy more merchandise and better stock her business with the latest fashions. Her goal is to continue expanding her customer base so she can pay off her loan and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her clothing business

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en: Wilfred is 47 years old, married to Leah. They are blessed with two children, fifteen and twelve. He has been in the farming business for one year with a monthly income of KES 9,000 which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings. With the anticipated profit from the business he plans to expand his farming business. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children and buy a large farm and export its produce.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 49 years old. She has six children, all of whom are in school. She is married. She has a business selling charcoal firewood in Kator in South Sudan. She has been running this business for four years. She can also earn income from selling beer. Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business and building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en: Jeffrey is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 4 children. For the past two years, Jeffrey has operated a piggery selling grown and matured pigs. He has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy pig feed. Jeffrey is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jeffrey hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has practiced farming for the last six years. She is a 48 year old widow and has two school going children in High School.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She has been loaned KES.20,000. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for labor.

In future, Ruth hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 3 children aged from 10 years to 13 years. She describes herself as innovative. She operates a general store where she sells flour, sugar, milk and rice. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. She says her biggest business challenge is lack of enough working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase flour, sugar and rice. Her business goal is to open up another business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will own a wholesale business and give her children a better life.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice and flour

loans.name: Ngoura

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père de quatre enfants.Il exerce l'activité d'élevage en achetant des bovins qu'il engraisse pendant trois à quatre mois avant de les revendre.Son activité lui procure des revenus assez consistants pour prendre en charge sa famille. A l'approche des fete de Tabaski, il sollicite un pret de 200000F pour acheter un bœuf.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man, father of four children. He raises livestock, buying cattle that he fattens for four months before reselling them. His business brings in enough consistent income to support his family. As Tabaski (local name for a Muslim feast day) nears, he is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Irma Deisy

texts.es:
la sra. Irma tiene 48 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de el Triunfo en el departamento de Choluteca, Irma se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, tiene muchos clientes ya que sus precios son bajos y sus productos son de buena calidad.
Irma es madre de 6 hijas, todas son profesionales.
Irma tiene la ayuda de su esposo, juntos trabajan duro para salir adelante.
en sus tiempos libres visitan la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria para surtir su negocio.
texts.en: Irma, 48, lives in the community of El Triunfo, Choluteca Department.  She sells items of popular consumption.  She has a grocery store located in her home.  She has many customers because her prices are low and her products are good quality.  Irma is the mother of six children all of which are professionals.  Irma helps her husband and together they work hard to get ahead.  In their free time they go to church.  She will use the loan to buy groceries to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Jovita sigue participando en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Jovita no solo se dedica a la venta de granos secos sino también se dedica a la venta de productos de ferretería.
En esta oportunidad Jovita requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo granos secos y una amoladora. 

Jovita se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Jovita continues participating with Asociación Arariwa’s micro finance unit’s “San Isidro de Compone” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  Jovita not only sells dry grains but also sells hardware.  On this occasion Jovita needs the loan to buy merchandise like dry grains and a grinder.  Jovita is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and also commits to repaying her loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy dry grains and a grinder.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 55 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 1 child. 

Natividad has a poultry business and earns approximately 20,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase additional feed for the chickens. Natividad has been a member of PMPC for a year. 

In the future, Natividad hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for the chickens

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, who is 49 and a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Enrique, 50, who is a driver. She is a mother of three children: Her eldest has just graduated from college; the second one is still in college; and the youngest is in high school. She keeps herself busy attending to the needs of her family and attending to her business.

Teresita has a car wash. She has three car-wash boys who cater to their numerous customers. Their rate for a car wash depends upon the type of the vehicle. Car owners pay 60 Philippines pesos (Php), Jeepneys are Php 80, and delivery trucks are Php 100–150. Her regular customers are the owners of the vehicles that reside within her community, and some are drivers who regularly pass by their busy area. She also sells different car accessories as additional income. She earns a minimum of 500 Php in sales every day.

Teresita is requesting a loan amounting to 8,000 Php that will serve as additional capital. She will spend it to buy additional car accessories and tires for her business. She believes that different designs of car accessories will definitely help her boost her income. Her profits help her to pay water and electricity bills, and some are saved for future expenditures.  

Teresita dreams of having another car wash in another area. She wants her children to become degree holders. She never fails to attend the fellowship* meeting every week as it inspires her to become a better person by studying the word of God and sharing His goodness with everyone.
  
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of car accessories and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is 24 years old, a farmer, married, and blessed with one child.  To support his family, he patiently works in the field every day.   He doesn't feel his tiredness in working the field because of his child that serves as his inspiration.  He pursues his work in order to provide a better future for his family.

With his net income of P30,000 every harvesting season, he suffers insufficiency because of the high price of farm inputs.  The profit is not enough for his business, let alone if he add his families expenses.  This caused him to ask for a loan in the amount of P15,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides needed in his farming business.  Through this loan, he would be able to provide the necessities to his farm and return to a high net income.  In this case, he would then save for the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Yamileth Del Socorro

texts.es: Yamileth ,32 años de edad, madre de tres hijos, habitante de la ciudad de Granada de oficio comerciante, nos expresa su agradecimiento por el cambio positivo que le genero el prestamo pues noto una mejora en sus ventas ya que pudo comprar mas productos para vender y siente que su negocio va avanzando poco a poco. Ahora requiere un segundo credito para comprar granos basicos, enlatados, sopas, sazonadores, salsa de tomates, productos de limpieza. Con esta nueva inversion piensa incrementar las ventas para hacer prosperar su negocio y lograrlo establecer con mas variedad y le permita salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Yamileth is a 32-year-old mother of three children. She is an inhabitant of the city of Granada and works as a merchant. 

She expressed to us her gratitude for the positive change that her loan generated. She noticed an improvement in sales, as she was able to buy more products to sell and she feels that her business is progressing, little by little. 

She now requires a second loan to buy basic grains, canned goods, seasonings, tomato sauce, and cleaning products. With this new investment, she thinks she can increase her sales, so that her business will propser and allow her to get a wider variety of products, as well as help her move forward with her family.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, eggs, milk, meat and cleaning products to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 39 years old. She is currently residing at Cauayan City. Though she is separated from her husband, still she is thankful because she has been blessed with two school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer has been engaged in her sari-sari store for four years and eight months. She earns about P10,000 a month.

As she said, with the income she generates from her business, she was able to give her children a good quality of life and to continue sending them to school. Therefore, Jennifer wants to borrow a loan of P30,000 to buy additional stock of groceries such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, curls and other basic ingredients to sell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, curls and other basic ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Etelbina Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Etelbina  Antonia  es una señora amable, trabajadora  y humilde desde pequeña empezó a trabajar  para ayudar a  su familia.
Ella cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes desde hace cinco años , le va gracias  a dios por el apoyo que le ha dado fundación y así continuar con su tienda.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra  de mas mercancía de abarrotes como es : aceite,leche,manteca,pan,galletas,refrescos y detergente.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Etelbina Antonia is a nice, humble and hardworking woman who has started working when  she was very young to help her family.
She has been running a general store for five years, and she "gives thanks to God" for the support she has received from the foundation that has allowed her to keep on running her shop.
She has requested a loan to buy more general products such as oil, milk, butter, bread, biscuits, drinks and detergents.
She thanks the foundation for the support provided in getting ahead and fulfilling her dreams.

loans.use: To buy oil, milk, butter, bread, biscuits, drinks and detergents.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
I am 51 years old, single and live with some relatives.
I have a small grapic design shop since 2000 and make posters, signs, vinil tarps, etc.
Our slogan is: " Tu lo imaginas y nosotros lo hacemos" which means "You imagine it and we will do it".

Using computers, we do all kinds of signs for business, cars, and taxis. 

My biggest accomplishment are buying a car, furniture, and remodeling my home. My goal is expanding my business by opening another printing local. 

The loan will be used for debt consolidation and improving my personal finances. With the savings that I will get from lower monthly payments, I will be able to put more money in my business. 

I have payed all my loans on time.

loans.use: To repay very expensive debts and improve cash flow.

loans.name: Bwikaara Tweyombeka Group

texts.en:
Magret, 41 years old, is a widow with seven children, ages 18, 16, 14, 12, 10, 6 and 5.  Four of them attend school, and Margret is in charge of paying their tuition and providing other basic needs.

Since 2008 she has dealt in sell of second-hand clothes as her source of income. She borrowed 500,000 (UGX) from UGAFODE previously and she has now applied for 1,000,000 (UGX) to boost her business since the festive season is at hand.

Her dream is to have her children educated up to the university level and expand her business so that she can get more returns. But she is limited as to capital and because of bad weather that affects her farming projects. She hopes to overcome these issues with the financial aid from UGAFODE.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth Afua

texts.en:
According to Elizabeth, nursing is a calling to help the weak, sick and dying patients.

Elizabeth dreams of becoming a professional nurse. To achieve her goal, Elizabeth has enrolled in Goaso Nursing Training College. She plans to graduate in May 2017 but without a loan from Kiva, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. With GHS 3030 loan, Elizabeth plans to pay for her tuition and buy study materials.
 
Elizabeth's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without this opportunity for a higher degree, Elizabeth's parents will never have the chance better their lives. Elizabeth shares that finances have always been tight and with a degree She will be able to secure a job to cater for her family.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition and study materials costs

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 56 years old and she is very good entrepreneur. She is a single mother and has one son. This is the reason that seven years ago she decided to start her own business. She started with very little merchandise, but little by little her business grew and she also started to sell clothes with excellent results. She is very clear about the secret of success in a business like hers; She knows it is the variety of products that she offers because if a client is looking for something that she does not have, he or she may never return to her, for this reason she tries to be with good stock. Valentina is requesting a loan of US$ 475 to purchase merchandise and new clothes for the season and she is hoping to repay the loan in 6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Valentina es una mujer de 56 años de edad muy emprendedora, ella es madre soltera y tiene un hijo, motivo por el cual hace siete años decidió iniciar su negocio de mercería de manera muy incipiente, poco a poco fue haciéndose de mas mercancías hasta incluso incluir la venta de ropa, con excelentes resultados entre sus clientes. Ella esta conciente de que el éxito de un negocio como el suyo esta en el surtido de mercancías que tenga, ya que si un cliente busca algo y no lo encuentra ya no querrá volver, es por eso que procura siempre estar bien surtida, es por eso que necesita un préstamo por la cantidad de $475 USD para comprar diversa mercancía, así como algo de ropa de la nueva temporada, su plan es pagarlo en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Catherine would like to buy three steers

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is 55 and has been living in Monterrey for 38 years. She was born in Doctor Arroyo, Nuevo Leon, but she moved seeking opportunity. She has always worked cooking food to help her husband support the family, and ten years ago she began selling tamales by the dozen. She now sells them with her neighbors and every Thursday her daughter distributes them at the factory where whe works. Silvia's husband is a blacksmith and his shop is connected to there home. She is currently asking for a $275 loan to be able to meet demand for her tamales. She proposes to repay the loan in 4 to 8 months. You can be an essential role in the growth of this business and the life of Silvia's family. Please do not hesitate and support them.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Doña Silvia tiene 55 años y 38 de estar viviendo en Monterrey, ella nació en Doctor Arroyo, Nuevo León, pero cambio su residencia en busca de mejores oportunidades desde muy joven. Siempre ha trabajado y vendido comidas, con la finalidad de generar ingresos adicionales para el mantenimiento de su hogar y apoyo a su esposo, pero hace 10 años inició el negocio de venta de tamales por docenas y actualmente los vende con sus vecinas y una de sus hijas los distribuye cada jueves en la fábrica donde trabaja. Su esposo es herrero y tiene su negocio en de su propio domicilio.

Actualmente solicita el crédito por la cantidad de $ 275 dólares para poder surtir los pedidos que constantemente le solicitan, ella ofrece devolver este préstamo en un plazo de 4 a 8 meses. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida Silvia y su familia, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Saroeurn is married since 1979 and has 9 children, 4 daughters and 5 sons. She opened a grocery store 3 years ago. In addition, she also sells flowers at her store. Her husband is a construction worker. One of her sons works in A private company and the others are still studying. 

She has previously borrowed money from MAXIMA. The current loan amount that she is requesting is $1,000. The loan will be used for purchasing more grocery items in order to expand her business. This family has the ability to repay the loans.

loans.use: Purchasing grocery items.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Business Description

Roxana is the owner of a local school named “Soldiers of Jesús” that has over 250 students. She and 10 other teachers work together to educate elementary-aged children from 7 am to 1pm. She was able to build the school on borrowed land and has seen it go from a small bamboo structure into a respectable concrete building.

Loan Use

Roxana wants to borrow from Mifex because she is hoping that she can make new uniforms for her students. The uniforms will be used for a special presentation at the school and a field day. Roxana hopes the students can continue to use the uniforms for physical education. She will buy the materials and have them made at a better cost if she has the money to invest. She figures she will be able to provide parents with much better prices after having the uniforms made in bulk.

Personal Information

Roxana is 36 years old and has five children. She separated from her husband about two years ago and is raising her family on her own. Her school and her faith have helped her get through these two years. She feels confident she can continue to provide not only for her own children, but also for the children of the surrounding community.

loans.use: Buy materials to make new uniforms for her students

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela A. M. is married and has 7 children, ages 28, 27, 26, 25, 26, 25, 24, 23 and 17. The eldest 5 have jobs and families of their own. She began her dairy product sales (cheese, cream, butter, etc.) over 7 years ago with only 1,000 Córdobas or $53 USD, selling hard and fresh cheeses.

Previously she sold seafood in the bus terminal market, but found that job to be unprofitable for her. Because of their age, she and her husband work together. He is in charge of buying the products and setting up the stand, and, when she has to step out, he also helps sell the products. The stand does not have a fixed site, but only a table for displaying the products and a black plastic cover. She told us that one of her greatest desires would be for the stand to have its own plot of land, since they currently set it up on the sidewalk.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Esta señora es casada, con un total de 7 hijos, todos con edades seguidas (28, 27, 26, 25, 26, 25, 24, 23 y 17 años de edad), ya los mayores trabajan y formaron su familia, exceptuando a los dos menores. Ella inicia el puesto de venta de lácteos (queso, crema, mantequilla, etc.) hace más de 7 años con un reducido capital de trabajo de C$ 1,000 córdobas, vendiendo quesos duros y frescos.

Anteriormente, ella se dedicaba a la venta mariscos en el M. de la terminal, pero esa actividad no le era rentable. Su esposo trabaja con ella por ser ambos ya personas un tanto mayores. Él se encarga de las compras y la instalación diaria del puesto, también le ayuda con la venta cuando ella tiene que salir. El puesto no posee un local propiamente dicho, únicamente tiene una mesa en donde coloca el producto y un techo hecho totalmente de plástico negro, ella nos manifiesta que uno de sus mayores deseos en cuanto al negocio se refiere es tener su propio tramo, ya que actualmente se encuentra ubicada en la acera.

loans.use:
Purchase of goods and ingredients.

Compra de mercaderia e insumos

loans.name: Sati

texts.en:
Sati is a 37-year-old widow and lives with her daughter and her son-in-law. She sells some snacks and beverages and usually earns $5 per day.

She wants to expand her business and really needs a $50 loan to buy more food to sell. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more beverages and snacks

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina lives in Beregovo, western Ukraine. She sells second hand footwear in a local market called “Progress”. Irina’s business has been growing consistently because of little competition in the market. She started selling second hand items eight years ago. Today she has about $4000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $500-600.

Irina is requesting a loan of $1200 to increase her turnover capital and assorted inventory in her kiosk. She enjoys doing what she’s doing and likes working with this type of merchandise. Irina wants to invest her savings in opening a new vending facility in the future. We believe her focused efforts, hard and committed work and great communication skills will help Irina grow in her business and be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: Increase capital and inventory

loans.name: Hector Ramon

texts.es:
Hector G. began selling food from his home in León. He is known as being very dedicated to his business since he always has searched for the way to capture the attention of his customers and make them feel important. His home where his business is located serves as a small restaurant where customers arrive, order food and are quickly served their meals.

Hector G.’s business is in urgent need of remodeling the bathrooms that customers use. It is necessary to buy new sinks, lighting and paint. To achieve this, he has received loans from CEPRODEL, which have allowed him to improve the condition of his business through the purchase of some of the materials he needs. He will obtain the other part through the next loan that he is certain will be granted by CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Hector G. inicia su actividad de venta de comida en su casa de habitación en León. Se ha caracterizado por ser muy dedicado a su negocio ya que siempre ha buscado la manera de captar la atención al cliente y hacer que se sientan importantes. Su casa de habitación donde se ubica el negocio sirve como pequeño restaurante donde los clientes llegan, solicitan la comida y al instante son servidos sus alimentos.

La necesidad con urgencia del negocio de don Hector Granero es que necesita remodelar sus baños por lo que los clientes hacen uso de ellos. Es necesaria la compra de un nuevo lavamanos, luminaria y pintora. Para realizar esta actividad ha recibido créditos en CEPRODEL que le han permitido mejorar las condiciones de su negocio por medio de la compra al contado de parte de los materiales que necesita. La otra arte la obtendrá por medio del próximo crédito que muy seguro cree que le será otorgado por Ceprodel.

loans.use: Invest in restaurant.

loans.name: Wakaliga D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mary N.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and fish and is requesting a loan to open up her charcoal business premises in other locations. Mary is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a shop attendant. She has 5 children ranging from age 9 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Mary makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. Mary has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in order to start her fish business and expand the charcoal business and the loan was paid back on time.

Mary is joined in her small group by Florence S., Mary K., Mary N., and Aisha J.. Florence S. has a business in tailoring and bridal dressing and wants to buy more bridal dresses and accessories. Mary K. is currently operating a local brewery business and wants a loan to purchase more jerry cans of brew. Mary N. operates a business selling used clothes and wants to add more stock. Aisha J. is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to increase working capital.

loans.use: To boost charcoal business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana has a general store which she started up 8 years ago, when she had to pay for exams for one of her children and did not have the money to do so. That was when she decided to sell from her house and begin her business little by little. Her husband works in construction and they have 4 children. His income was barely enough to pay for their home, with very little left over.

She is asking for a loan of US $350, which will be repaid in 4 months, to buy goods for the store and expand it a bit. With your help, Juliana will be able to contribute to the education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Juliana tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual inicio hace 8 años cuando tenia que pagar exámenes de uno de sus hijos y no contaba con ese dinero, fue así que decidió vender en su casa y poco a poco inicio el negocio. Su esposo se dedica a la construcción y tienen 4 hijos, no completaban con los ingresos de el ya que actualmente esta pagando la casa donde habitan y le queda muy poco dinero.

Ella solicita un crédito por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir su tienda y ampliarla un poco. Con tu ayuda Juliana podrá contribuir a la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Candido

texts.en:
Candido B. started his own business a few years ago with a loan from his brother. Since then, the business has grown every day. Candido sells chocolates, candies, and tires in a store located in the shopping center of Ciudad del Este. His frequent clients include other sellers in the zone as well as people from town who know about the good quality of his products.

Candido’s family always helps him with the business. The earnings generated by the sales is an essential source of income for the whole family. As a result, Candido’s business has brought many benefits to his family.

The credit provided will be used for the purchase of products that include tires and chocolates.

loans.use: Purchase of choclates, candies, and tires.

loans.name: Dora Patricia

texts.es:
Dora started her business because at the time her husband was left without a job and she had always liked automotive trends. She needed to help her husband to pay for the maintenance of their children, receipts for services and school. She began over 20 years ago when a relative invited them to join him in business because her husband had knowledge of mechanics. She took advantage of the opportunity to begin buying cars and selling the motors. She has 3 children: Abelardo age 21, Victor Manuel 18 and Ana Patricia 15 years. Abelardo, the oldest, helps in the business.

She needs a loan of $1175, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy 2 cars in order to remove the motors. With your help this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Dora inició el negocio ya que en ese tiempo su esposo se quedo sin empleo y siempre le ha gustado el giro automotriz. Ella necesitaba ayudar a su esposo con el pago de la manutencion de sus hijos,recibos de servicios y escuela. Comenzó hace mas de 20 años un familiar los invito a unirse al negocio ya que su esposo tiene conocimientos de mecanica, aprovecho para empezar a comprar carros y venderlos los motores. Ella tiene 3 hijos: Abelardo de 21, Victor Manuel 18 y Ana Patricia de 15 años. Abelardo el mas grande ayuda en el negocio.

Ella neceita un prestamo por US $ 1175 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar 2 carros para sacar los motores. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: To buy 2 cars to remove the motors for resale.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en: Moustafa, 21,  has been engaged for 3 years despite his young age. He owns a grocery shop and is a very responsible man whose priority in life is the improvement of his business which is his only source of income. He wants to get married and therefore needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to furnish the house for his future family. This is the first time that Moustafa is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: to furnish the house for his future family

loans.name: Edelmira Leonor

texts.es:
Mrs. Edelmira Leonor is single mother and is 55 years old. She studied to be a high-level technician, an executive secretariat, and a commercial secretariat. A few years ago, she retired. Edelmira has one daughter, who is independent. She lives in the district of Moche in Trujillo, La Libertad.

The businesswomen researched and studied the production of bricks on the internet and from there, she, with the support of her grandchildren, started her business. She has molds and vibrating machines. She takes part in fairs, where she shows her work (the bricks). Also, she takes care of animals.

Her sister-in-law encouraged Edelmira to request a loan and to belong to the “Virgen de Fatima” community bank. With the first loan of 300 new soles, she bought cement and molds for her business. With this loan of 1,000 new soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy cement at wholesale in order to get a better price.

Edelmira’s goal is to help financially in her grandchildren’s education so that they can be professional and have their comforts.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Edelmira Leonor es madre soltera, tiene 55 años, estudió Superior Técnica, Secretariado Ejecutivo y Secretariado Comercial, hace unos años se jubiló, tiene 01 hija, la cual es independiente, Vive en el Distrito de Moche en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.

La empresaria investigó y estudió sobre la fabricación de ladrillos en internet y de ahí ella empezó con el negocio, junto con sus nietos que son los que la apoyan. Ella posee moldes, máquinas vibradoras. Participa en ferias, donde muestra su trabajo (ladrillos). También se dedica a la crianza de animales.

Su cuñada la animó a solicitar el préstamo y pertenecer al Banco Comunal “VIRGEN DE FATIMA”, y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, compró cemento y moldes para el negocio. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará cemento al por mayor para obtener mejor precio.

Tiene como meta, ayudar económicamente en la educación de sus nietos, para que sean buenos profesionales y tener sus comodidades.

loans.use: To buy cement at wholesale

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del comité Nuevo Amanecer se unieron entre vecinas del barrio centro de la ciudad de Villa Elisa para de tal forma participar del programa. Así llegaron a formar un comité de mujeres y llegaron a acceder al correspondiente para la financiación de sus actividades económicas.
