En el comité se encuentran muchas personas y una variada gama de actividades económicas que desarrollan cada una de sus integrantes. El crédito recibido de la Fundación Paraguaya es muy útil para financiar cada una de los micro emprendimientos de las integrantes del comité, que se están desarrollando con este programa. Todas las Sras son madres y trabajadoras, lo que las une de una manera especial y fortalece el compromiso solidario del préstamo.

El crédito que solicitan será para la compra de varios artículos, la mayoría de ellos, materia prima o artículos de mercancía para las actividades de las integrantes del comité. Por ejemplo, la Sra. María Beatriz C. invertirá su préstamo en la compra de telas, botones, hilos y todos los materiales que necesita para la confección de ropas. Este tipo de artículos son adquiridos por todas las integrantes que se dedican a la confección de ropa. Otras que se dedican a la fabricación de dulces, tortas, etc. adquirirán azúcar, harina, vainilla, huevos, leche, entre otros. Las señora dedicadas al comercio, o sea las que tienen despensa, casilla, venta de cosméticos etc. utilizarán su crédito para la compra de artículos para la venta, tales como discos, azúcar, cosméticos, ropas o introduciendo nuevos productos para la venta, como ropas a la moda, nuevos productos de limpieza, etc.
texts.en:
The members of the New Dawn Committee are women from the central neighborhood of Villa Elisa. They formed the group to help finance their economic activities. There are many people in the committee who carry out a variety of activities to make a living. The loan they receive from Kiva partner Fundación Paraguay is very useful in financing each member's small businesses, which they have developed thanks to this program. All the women are mothers and hard workers, and what brings them together and strengthens their bond is a common commitment to the loan.

The loan will be used to purchase various items, the majority being raw materials or supplies for the members' various business activities. For example, María Beatriz C. plans to invest her loan in the purchase of fabrics, buttons, threads and all the other materials needed to make clothing. These types items will be acquired by all the members who work as seamstresses. Others who make a living selling desserts and candies will invest in the purchase of sugar, flour, vanilla, eggs, milk, among other items. The women dedicated to commerce or have a convenience store, or sell cosmetics will use their loan to purchase items to sell, such as discs, sugar, beauty products, clothing or new products to start selling (new clothing styles, new cleaning products, etc.).

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various merchandise and supplies

loans.name: Manuela Transito

texts.es: La señora Manuela Transito S. C. es originaria del municipio de Totonicapan  pueblo del occidente de la capital de Guatemala, dona Manuela solicita un credito en las oficinas de asdir para mejora su calidad de vida y la de su familia, atraves de ampliar su cobertura de mecardo actualmente vende en los mercados de Chichicastenango, Panajachel  con variedad de telas tipicas con el credito desea agregar otro pito de tejido de Güipiles del departamento de Totonicapan  ya que es el traje del departamento de Totonicapan.  Asi mismo ya se esta finalizando el ciclo escolar  y endonde varios jovenes quieren aprender este arte y doña manuela se caracteriza a ensenarles a los jovenes.
texts.en:
Manuel Transito S. C. is a native of the municipality of Totonicapan, a town located west of the capital of Guatamela. Dona Manuela is asking for a loan from ASDIR to improve her family´s quality of life, by broadening her offering in the market. She currently sells a variety of traditional fabrics in the Chichicastenango and Panajachel markets. With this loan she would like to add other fabrics like Güipiles (or huipiles, a Mayan textile made into a tunic or blouse) from Totonicapan, which is the traditional outfit from the department of Totonicapan. At the same time, since the school year is drawing to an end and many young poeple want to learn this art, Doña Manuela would like to teach them.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
For the past eight years, Akosua S. has been trading in the local market of Obuasi in Ghana. She is a 36-year-old woman and is married with five kids, who are in school. She is a petty trader, who sells palm kernel oil, vegetable oil, tin tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish etc. on top of a table in the local market. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business.

With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She says that she would be grateful for your assistance. Akosua is a member of the group called Judah. Members agree to guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernel oil, vegetable oil, tin tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish etc

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah A. S. is married and supports 7 dependents. He has attended school through senior high school.. Elijah is a mechanic who does repair work and sells spare parts at Kissi near Elmina, Ghana. He has maintained this business since 1996. His wife has a business as a trader. Elijah uses his income to take care of the family's financial needs. Elijah will use the loan to purchase supplies of spare parts to sell. With the new profits from this increased business, he plans to save towards building a house for the family to live in.

loans.use: Purchase additional spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres De Batalla Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres de Batalla" is a large group of men and women from an extremely poor area in the Dominican Republic. Each member of this group is hoping to receive a loan to increase the size of their business. Each member in this group has received a previous loan and some aR. on their 3rd or 4th while others aR. hoping for their 2nd. This group has businesses ranging from clothing stores to small grocery stores.

Maria V. B. is the representative of this group and and also a hardworking mother to 4 children, all under the age of 17. She has a lot to work for, and is a perfect example of this group. She was having a hard time providing for her children befoR. she started her own business, and had no steady income. She took out her first loan and started a small business making clothing. She was always a great seamstress and thought it would work well if she could use her skill in her business. She did very well with her first loan and has continued to increase her business. She said for the first time she feels like a provider and knows that she can take caR. of her children. She dreams of being a designer and have other people create her designs. She loves what she is doing and is excited to have something of her own for once. She is also praying that one day her children will all be able to go to college and enjoy a better life than she had. She is excited about what the futuR. hold for her, her family, and her business!

loans.use: Purchase of materials for clothing

loans.name: Mrs. Tha Arn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of eight people who live in Aleng Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. 

Mrs. Tha A. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. She is a basket maker in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Leng Chamroeurn, collects palm juice, which is processed into palm sugar or wine. He now faces a problem, because he cannot climb up the palm tree. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Tha A. has decided to ask for a loan to buy bamboo to tie to the palm tree, so her husband can climb up to gather palm juice. 

Mrs. Tha A. is 24 years old and the mother of four children. Two of her children attend the local school. The two youngest are ages four months and five years old. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy bamboo

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
S. is a villager who lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia.  He makes a living as a local crop grower, growing vegetables, rice and some fruit trees that he can grow during both seasons including the dry season and rainy season.

He is married and the good father of two children: one child is a teenager and attends school, while the other is a lovely baby.  Whilst his wife assists him in growing crops, she also raises pigs from home for sale. 

S. faces difficulties watering crops; thus, he is asking for a loan to purchase a pump to irrigate his crops.  The remaining loan will be used to buy more piglets to raise. 

(S.'s wife is pictured because he was not available that day.)

loans.use: To purchase a pump to irrigate his crops and more piglets to raise

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
Ciprina inició el negocio porque es algo que le gusta hacer y le divierte mucho elaborar diferentes manualidades, además que es una actividad que realiza en casa y a cualquier hora y al mismo tiempo puedo estar al pendiente de mis nietos.  Comenzó el negocio en Marzo de 2006, gracias a una maestra que le enseñó a elaborar las manualidades, primero comenzò haciendo bolsas y juegos de baño, después empezo a elaborar cosas de acuerdo a la temporada que se iba acercando como flores para el día de muertos, arreglos para la navidad, el día de la amistad, el día del niño, el día de las madres, etc. y gracias a Dios me ha ido muy bien ya que todos mis arreglos los alcanzo a vender entre familiares, vecinos y amistades.  Poco a poco ha ido haciendo  mas clientes que a través de otras personas la recomendaban al ver su trabajo el cual les gustaba mucho.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $6,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas con el cual va  a poder comprar materia prima como tela, pegamento, foamy, hilo, tijeras, papel, etc. Que me permita elaborar arreglos que me encargan mis clientes para fechas especiales y eventos.
texts.en:
Ciprina started a business because it is something that she wanted to do. She enjoys making different crafts very much, and it is an activity that she can perform in her house whenever she wants. At the same time, she can take care of her grandchildren. She began the business in March 2006 thanks to a teacher that taught her to make crafts. She first started making handbags and bathroom sets, and later began making things related to each coming season, such as paper flowers for the Day of the Dead and decorations for Christmas, Friendship Day, Children's Day, Mother's Day, etc. Thanks to God, she has been getting more customers through recommendations from other people who liked her work. She needs a loan of $6,000 MXN that she will repay in 12 installments that she will use to purchase raw materials such as cloth, glue, foamy, thread, scissors, paper, etc. This will allow her make decorations that her customers entrust her to make for special dates and events.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar A. makes a living growing rice. He is 41 years old and currently has no children. His wife, Edna A., works overseas. They are working very hard to build a good future for the children they plan to have. Edgar started his business 21 years ago. He started working a one-hectare farm, which he tilled to earn money to meet their needs. Now, he works a farm more than twice that size, and hopes to expand it even more in the near future.

He is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers and other items he needs for his farm. If he can secure this loan, he believes that his farm will definitely produce a better harvest -- and this will allow him to buy more land for him and his wife.

CEVI is committed to help Edgardo grow his business by providing him with credit, training and insurance.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other items for his farm

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Almost one hectare of the farmland in Banteay Meanchey Province is used by Mrs. Noun Y. for cultivating rice and some vegetable crops for the village. Noun Y., 56, has been farming for years, a skill she is widely known for since she was left her grandparents' side. Her husband's name is Yoeun, 66, and he helps with her with the farm work. The family has four children; two of them are single and the others are married and live away from the family home. Three of their children are employed.

Because rice farming is the family's main source of income and the rice dry season is approaching, Noun Y. needs to borrow US$ 1200 as capital to use in her business activities, buying fertilizer, a second-hand motorcycle, and to pay for plowing her fields.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, a second-hand motorcycle, and to pay for plowing her field

loans.name: Zabirov

texts.ru: Забиров Насрулло проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 36 лет, женат и имеет пятерых детей. Работает фельдшером -посменно. В нерабочие дни занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Имеет магазин , где торгует хозяйственными товарами. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это даст возможность увеличить ассортимент товара и привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
N. Zabirov lives in the Gissar region. He is 36 years old, married and has five children. He works as a paramedic part time. He has a retail business on the days when he doesn't work. He has a store where he sells household products. He has been in this business for ten years now. He plans to get a loan to increase commodity circulation. This will give an opportunity to increase the variety of the merchandise and attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase variety of inventory

loans.name: Felicino

texts.en: Felicino S. tills a 1.75 hectare farm in his village. He owns the farm and sells most of his crop in the local market. The income that he earns from this farm feeds and clothes his family. Felecino S. is 58 years old and the father of two children. He has applied for a loan to buy seeds and herbicides. Doing this will help him increase his harvest. He is grateful to CEVI because it provides not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy seeds and herbicides

loans.name: Jiguisèmè1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Jiguisseme 1  est un regroupement de femmes du village de Kampogosso dans la préfecture de San (quatrième région administrative du Mali) qui se connaissent bien par des relations de voisinage. Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, autres parents, coépouses et enfants. Elles sont toutes mariées,  ont en moyenne 38 ans et au moins 6 enfants. 
Elles cultivent principalement  l’arachide et le maïs.
Pour satisfaire leurs besoins de semences, d’intrants et de petits  matériels agricoles, pour cette culture d’arachide et de maïs sur plus  d’une dizaine  d’hectares, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux  ans (deux prêts de campagne). Les deux prêts précédents ont  été correctement remboursés. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des sacs d’arachide, de maïs, d’engrais  et des petits matériels agricoles au marché de Kimparana.
Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être  vendues. 
Elles vendent les céréales  dans tous les marchés qui sont aux environs de Kimparana et au grand marché de San à une clientèle riche et variée. 
Les femmes du groupe Jiguisseme 1 comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 50 000 F CFA chacune après les récoltes.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utiliseront une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Jiguisseme 1 brings together women from the village of Kampogosso in the prefecture of San (fourth administrative region of Mali) who are well known to each other because they are neighbors. They live in big extended traditional families with their husbands, other relatives, co-spouses and children. They are all married with an average age of 38 and at least 6 children. They mainly grow peanuts and maize.

To satisfy their needs in terms of seed, intrants, and other agricultural necessities for this cultivation of peanuts and maize on more than 10 hectares, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso two years ago (two rural loans). The two preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed. This loan will be used to buy sacks of peanuts, maize, fertilizer, and other minor agricultural necessities in the marketplace at Kimparana.

After the hot rainy season, the harvests are stocked for a time so that they will be more valuable when sold. They sell the cereals in all the marketplaces around Kimparana and the big open-air market of San to a rich and varied clientele.

Each of the women of the Jiguisseme 1 group expects to make a profit of 50,000 F CFA after the harvest. Besides reimbursing the loan, they will use a part of that income to cover everyday expenses for their families.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of intrants, seeds, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Josephen

texts.en:
Josephen T. is from the village of Masabod, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Josephen is separated from her spouse and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Josephen owns & operates a handicraft business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling bamboo handicrafts to local community members. Josephen has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately Php 18,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In May 2009, Josephen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephen is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Feliciana Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Feliciana del Socorro O. tiene la edad de 57 años, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casada y con tres hijos mayores de edad, su negocio es la venta de comida rápida que junto con su esposo vende como: enchiladas, repochetas,  carne asada, y refresco naturales frutas, y golosinas, llevan ya diez años en las ventas, anteriormente vendía artesanía en el mercado oriental, y con ahorro comenzaron este otro negocio, sus planes son remodelar el local para captar nuevos clientes. Con este crédito va a comprar  productos para hacer la variedad de ricos platos de comida para ofertar a sus clientes lo cual espera vender más y obtener mejores ganancias. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo para invertir en su pequeño negocio, también espera hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Feliciana del Socorro O. is 57 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is married and has three adult children. Her business is fast food which she and her husband sell, including enchiladas, reprochetas, grilled meat, soft drinks made from natural fruits and candy. They have been in sales for the past 10 years. Previously she sold crafts in the eastern market and with her savings started this other business. Her plans including remodeling her stand to attract new customers. With this loan she will buy products for making a variety of delicious food to offer her customers, and she hopes to sell more and have more earnings. She is thankful to Afodenic for their support in investing in her small business. She also hopes to make some improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits, vegetables, and meat.

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru: Рахматулло Бобобеков проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 41 год. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. По специальности "шофер". Рахматулло более 5 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он в основном выращивает бахчевые растения. Кредит просит для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Rahmatullo B. lives in teh Kurgan-Tyube district. He is 41 years old, married and has five children. He completed high school. By specialization, he is a driver. For more than five years, Rahmatullo has been involved in farming. In general, he grows melon plants. He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Taufaanuu

texts.en: Taufaanuu L. (0) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Saasaai. She is married and has four school-aged children. Taufaanuu owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 400 WST a month. In 2009, Taufaanuu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Laarnie

texts.en:
Laarnie is a vegetable vendor in her village in Cutog Grande, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. Aside from selling, she is also a small producer of vegetables wherein she harvests every two months. She then sells her produce to buyers at wholesale price and some at retail price in her village.

Laarnie wants to maintain her business and this is the reason why she wants to request a loan of PHP 8,000 to be used as additional capital.

Her husband, Danilo, is a farmer and the couple is gifted with two children: Carol - 7 years old, already in grade one and Karen - 2 years old.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Stars Of Santiago Group

texts.es:
Dentro de las costumbres y creencias de nuestra gente, existe gran respeto y devoción a la figura del “Tata Santiago” (Padre Santiago) ídolo religioso perteneciente al catolicismo, reconocido por los milagros realizados a petición de sus fieles. Por tal motivo, "Estrellas de Santiago" es el nombre que dieciocho mujeres han elegido para bautizar su asociación. Hace cuatro años que trabajan dentro de la Organización, siempre responsables y con mucha devoción a su patrono, quien bendice y da frutos a sus distintas actividades como ser la confección de ropa militar, artesanía en miniatura y comercio en general.
Todas estas mujeres precisan de dinero principalmente para la compra de materia prima en el caso de aquellas que confeccionan y las otras que realizan artesanías, y también es el caso de aquellas que se dedican al comercio en general, siendo que precisan trasladarse a otras regiones en busca de mercadería que tenga un flujo ágil y sea rentable para sus intereses.
texts.en:
According to the customs and beliefs of our people, there is great respect for and devotion to the "Tata Santiago" (Father Santiago) figure, a Catholic religious idol known for the miracles he performed at the request of his followers. For that reason, "Stars of Santiago" is the name that these eighteen women have chosen to christen their association. For four years they have worked within the organization, always responsibly and with great devotion to their patron saint, who blesses them and brings success to their various activities, such as making military clothing, creating miniature handicrafts, and business in general. All of these women need money, mainly to purchase raw materials in the case of those who make clothing or crafts. Those engaged in business in general need to travel to other regions in search of merchandise with a strong supply that will be profitable for their interests.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald B. is from the village of Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 28 years old, is single, and has two school-aged children. Ronald owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling bananas and firewood in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ronald joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand his product offering

location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mr. Sin S. lives in Trapeang Reang village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Kuoy Rin, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, they earn only a small income to support their household. In order to improve the family living, Mr. Sin S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to be motorbike taxi driver. He is 44 years old and the father of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one being too young to work or study. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to be motorbike taxi driver.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal was born in 1956. He lives in the Fuzuli region. He is married and has 3 children.

Seven years ago, Kamal started a cattle breeding business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 4 calves to improve his cattle breeding business.

loans.use: To buy 4 calves

loans.name: Gacu

texts.en:
Gacu S. is currently in the business of selling maize and millet flour and is requesting a loan to buy more items like simsim, groundnut paste, etc. for sale. Gacu is 40 years old and is married to a prison officer. She has 10 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy more items like simsim, groundnut paste, etc. for sale

loans.name: Luisa Drofi

texts.pt:
Luísa Drofi Q. nasceu no Distrito de Morumbene, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, tem 44 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 6 filhos de 21, 17, 15, 13, 9, e 3 anos de idade 5 destes vão a escola. Fez 10ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos em Boane e sustenta ainda seu sobrinho que vive com ela.

Saiu de Morumbene para Chokwe (província de Gaza) em 1984 com seu marido, devido a transferência de seu Marido pelos serviços. Em 1986 é transferido para Boane, onde por fim fixaram sua residência. Mais tarde separa se com o marido e contínua a viver na mesma casa com seus filhos. Trabalha como agente comunitária de saúde num orfanato (Casa do Gaiato) ha mais de 8 anos e tem um salário mensal de 3.500.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum valor no banco comercial BCI.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 8.500.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de Construção (cimento, areia e pagamento de mão de obra) para continuar com a ampliação da sua obra. O empréstimo anterior foi de 7.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.

Futuramente pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para poder concluir a sua obra e dar melhor conforto a seus filhos.
texts.en:
Luísa Drofi Q. was born in the district of Morumbene in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique. She is 44; divorced; and the mother of 6 children who are 21, 17, 15, 13, 9, and 3. Five of them are in school. She studied through 10th grade and didn't continue due to the lack of financial resources. She lives in her own home with her children in Boane and also supports her nephew who lives with her.

She left Morumbene for Chowke (in the province of Gaza) in 1984 with her husband when he was transferred there for his job. In 1986, he was transferred to Boane, where they started their home. Later she separated from her husband, and she continues to live in the same home with her children. She has worked as a community health worker at an orphanage (which is called Casa de Gaiato) for more than 8 years and has a monthly salary of 3,500 meticais, which she applies to her home's expenses and still saves some in the commercial bank, BCI.

She has never had a loan with another bank. She became familiar with Hluvuku through her colleages, who are also clients of the institution. This is her second loan, and it is for 8,500 meticais. She will use it to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, and to pay for labor) to continue expanding her home. Her previous loan was for 7,000 meticais, which she used for the same purpose.

In the future, she hopes to request more loans to be able to finish her home and to give more comfort to her children.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials (cement, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Teresia Mwikali

texts.en:
Teresia is borrowing her first loan from KADET. She is 36 years old and is married with two children, a 13-year-old and a 4-year-old. 

Teresia has been operating a shoe printing and sales business for three years. She prints patterns onto shoes and then sells them to customers. Her business is in the city of Nairobi in a busy market area. She has some permanent clients, but also has a walk-in shop where first customers frequently purchase items.She also has rental homes from which she earns money as a secondary source of income. 

With this loan, Teresia will purchase stock for her shoe business. She is especially excited to have extra stock on hand during the busy holiday season. Teresia's dream is to open other outlets in the future and to create employment for other Kenyans.

loans.use: To buy shoes for her shoe printing business

loans.name: Ulongoni Group

texts.en:
Jambo (hello) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania!

This is MwanaH. S. and the Ulongoni loan group seated at the Makumbusho Branch Office of Tujijenge Tanzania, Ltd. MwanaH. is 33 years old and married with three children. Her children are 15, 13, and 5 years old.

MwanaH. is a hairdresser and her specialty is weaving and braiding hair. Many of her clients are local Tanzanian Rastafarians. She has been in the business for five years, and works from 8 a.m. till 6 p.m. daily. She makes a weekly profit of 35,000 Tanzanian shilling (about US$26).
 
MwanaH. has had one previous loan from Tujijenge, which she used to buy the cotton and thread that she braids into people's hair to make dreadlocks and extensions. She hopes to use this loan to buy more of the same supplies.

In the photo, MwanaH. is sitting in the front row wearing a bright yellow dress. She is seated with the other members of her loan group. They will all hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. The Ulongoni group thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy cotton and thread for Rasta hair braids

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil and wheat flour in bulk.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Nuestra socia GABRIELA, pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL DE ORO”, la socia vive en la ciudad de Cusco, en el barrio de san jerónimo ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad.

Nuestra socia tiene 39 ella es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos el menor de sus hijos vive con ella, y tiene 7años, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia vende ropa los días martes y sábados en Cusco en el centro comercial “comerciantes de Tahuantinsuyo” y los otros días lleva a la provincia de Urubamba a una hora de Cusco y a la provincia de Urcos a 1 hora y 15 minutos desde la ciudad del Cusco, nuestra socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y desea seguir siendo madre y padre para sus hijos y apoyarlos en sus estudios y cuidar de la educación y alimentación de su menor hijo, para lo cual ella solicita el préstamo y desea invertir en la compra de mayor mercadería.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Gabriela belongs to the Sol de Oro Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Cusco in the San Jerónimo neighborhood, which is 15 minutes from the city. She is 39, and she is the single mother of four children. Her youngest child, 7, lives with her. She alternates her activities between the home and her small business. She sells clothes on Tuesdays and Saturdays at the commercial center in Cusco, “Comerciantes de Tahuantinsuyo”. The other days she takes the clothes to the Urubamba province, which is one hour from Cusco and the Urcos province, which is one hour and fifteen minutes from the city of Cusco. She is a very hard-working woman who wants to keep being mother and father to her children and support them in their education. She wants to take care of the education and the food for her youngest child. That is why she is asking for the loan. She wants to invest in buying wholesale merchandise. She values and is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay her debt on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes wholesale

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
Raúl C. P., tiene la edad de 56 años, está casado, vive con su esposa y 2 hijos que es son mayor prioridad. Ellos tiene 21 y 23 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una vaca de leche. La idea es tener ganado con producción de leche para venderla a las personas de la comunidad y así maximizar sus ganancias. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Don Raúl trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura, pero sobre todo a la cría del ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y sobre todo como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Raúl C. P. is 56 years old, married, and has two children (ages 21 and 23). His children are his highest priority. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a dairy cow. His idea is to have dairy cattle so that he can sell milk to the residents of the community and maximize his earnings.

This is the first time Raúl has requested a loan from FUDECOSUR. He is very pleased with the services that have been provided. Don Raúl has many years of experience in agriculture, particularly raising livestock. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater financial stability. Raúl wants to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow
